Ivania Azucena U. is a 62 year old woman who enjoys working. For more than 18 years, she has been selling general merchandise. She started selling clothes in different parts of the district, but she didn’t have a way to take her merchandise with her. She would have to incur additional expenses to pay someone to transport her goods. In most of the places where she went, she was already paying a hosting fee to secure a space where she could sell her products.

Ivania has requested a loan to use as working capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shoes, and shorts. She hopes to make repairs to the roof of her house because she experiences problems during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Roth Kong Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eleven people all living in Smaong village in Takeo province, is requesting a loan. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Ev Mei, is a driver who gets little salary. Mrs. Srey Roth K. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom stays at home while another attends the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas, Group 1, 2, 3

texts.en:
Teresita runs a small market stall selling clothes, food and other items.  She has operated her store for over eight years and her loans have allowed her to increase her business by 80%.  She plans to use this loan to buy a box of used clothes and food items to sell.  She has successfully repaid two loans and this will be her third loan with Esperanza.  Teresita is single and has three grown children.  She wants to continue to increase her business and add more products to her store. 
 
Teresita is the group coordinator of the Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Activas (Active Women).  Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR).  The group is based in Puerto Plata in a community that has unreliable access to running water and electricity and lacks trash service.

loans.use: A box of used clothing and food items to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Lacer who is 29 years old and works as a tricycle driver. They are blessed with three children, two are already studying and the youngest is one year old.  

Jennifer is a vendor in their village. In the morning she sells meat, fish, chicken and longganisa (a type of sausage).  In the afternoon, she sells different snacks like pansit, native cakes, ice candy, and bananas. She patiently retails her products from house to house to earn a living.  She can see that her business is growing and for it to become more productive she has requested a loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP7,000.  She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha N. is 41 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 8 to 15 years old. Josepha lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately 3 hours drive from Kigali, the capital city. Josepha owns and operates a business where she sells a great variety of goods. She would like to add handbags to her offering.  A proven entrepreneur, this is her tenth year in this business and she employs four people from her community. Her business requires that she works from 6 AM to 6 PM every day.

Josepha is a seasoned businesswoman. She is requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase handbags to sell. It should be noted that her first loan was paid on time and in full. The success of her business, partially enabled through this loan, continues to help her to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: More inventory, specifically handbags

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 44 años de edad.  Tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. La actividad económica de Isidora es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Su negocio nació por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos, para el sustento diario de su familia, por lo que diario salía a vender ciertas golosinas pero esto lo pero ya estaba cansada de viajar todos los días. Y se ubico en su vivienda. Ella solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo e invertir el dinero en materia prima como golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos naturales, pan y gaseosas. Su sueño es que su pequeño negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Isidora is 44 years old. She has 4 children, but none depend on her. Isidora's economic activity is a grocery store. For more than 20 years, she has been dedicated to her business. The location of her business is at her home. Her business started with the need to obtain a source of income for the daily living of her family. Prior to that, she sold some candy, but she became very tired of commuting every day, and now she is located at her home. She is requesting a loan for working capital and to invest the money in raw materials such as candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda. Her dream is that her small business will turn into a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, basic grains, natural juices, bread and soda

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es: Don Marcos Rodríguez es un hombre trabajador desde que salio del ejercito de Nicaragua le dieron una pensión el cual con este dinero monto su propio negocio desde hace quince años vendiendo lentes, relojes, lámparas de noche, alarmas entre otro en la cotran del Mayoreo en donde vende ambulante por que solicito un permiso para vender ambulante dentro de la misma. Ya que es donde salen todas las unidad de buses a los diferente departamento del norte. Gracias a los préstamo que Afodenic a  otorgado ha logrado mantener su inventario, por que las ventas en los últimos meses han sido baja a demás el tiene que comprar su almuerzo ya que desde horas temprana sale con su venta para poder lograr vender. Con este préstamo que es temporada navideña desea invertir en la compra de billetera, calculadoras, gorras, relojes para dama y caballero como una variedad de lentes para atraer clientes y lograr que sus ventas aumenten para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su esposa y sus dos hijos ya que de su fuente de trabajo subsisten.
texts.en:
Marcos is a hard-working man. When he left the Nicaraguan Army he received a pension and with this money he began his business, selling glasses, watches, night lights, alarm clocks, among other things, in Managua's Mayoreo market. He is a mobile vendor who has obtained permission to sell there. This is where all buses depart for the northern departments.

Thanks to loans provided through AFODENIC, he has been able to maintain his inventory, although in recent months his sales have been low. Since he must start selling very early if he wants to succeed, he has to buy his own lunch.

With this loan for Christmas season Marcos wants to buy billfolds, calculators, caps, and watches for ladies and gentlemen, as well as a variety of glasses, to attract customers, increase sales and satisfy the needs of his wife and his 2 children, who depend on his source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POCKET BOOKS, BILLFOLDS, CAPS, CALCULATORS AND GLASSES TO INCREASE BUSINESS

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Myrna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla G. is from the village of Misom, Balingao Mis. Occ. She is 52 years old. Luzvilla is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzvilla owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as tuba (coconut wine), dried fish, milk (sachet), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Luzvilla has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzvilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzvilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: Olga Lidia A. López desde hace cinco años decidió tener su propio negocio que consiste en un bar y billar. Este se localiza  por la terminal de interlocales de León  y buses en el mercado Israel. Según A. este tiene mucha concurrencia debido a que esta cerca de la Terminal de buses y muchos mientras esperan ingresan a distraerse.
texts.en:
Five years ago Olga Lidia A. López decided to have her own business, which consists of a bar and billiard’s table. This is located at the inter-urban bus station of Leon in the Israel Market. According to A., it is very busy because it is near the bus station, and while they wait a lot of people enter to entertain themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 22 year-old young man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He has owned a shop that sells cell phones and electronics since 2005. He has no family to support him, and he needs a loan of $3000 to buy more stock of electronics and cell phones to develop his project. Mohammed is ambitious, motivated, and honest and would be very pleased if he gets this needed help.

loans.use: To buy stock and evolve his business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. B. is a 39-year-old mother of two who lives in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Irene has worked in sales over the past ten years. She is a busy entrepreneur who earns a living by selling various products including shoes, catalogue products, jewelry, perfumes and cosmetics. Irene’s goal is to expand her shoe selling business; she plans to use this loan to increase her shoe inventory.

Irene makes sales over the phone and by visiting individual clients in her community. She also sells products to her children´s teachers and other members of her community. Through word of mouth, her client base has grown. Irene´s goal is to have her own store where she would be able to sell various products in order to maintain her diverse client base.

A main obstacle for Irene is economic and she says she could double her sales with more working capital. She hopes that this loan will help accomplish just that. Another challenge has been clients who are late on payments or refuse to pay. To overcome this obstacle, she has created flexible payment schedules for some of her clients. For example, instead of one payment, a client is allowed to make a number of smaller payments.

At the moment, Irene is taking guitar lessons and hopes that this activity will one day become a source of income. She says that she is happy places like Fundacion Mujer exist - organizations that support small businesses like hers. The loan process has been a large step up for Irene. It has opened doors and opportunities for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Blanca Estrella Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Blanca Estrella” y está conformado por 15 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. Ellos se dedican principalmente al comercio de lencería, frutas, verduras, hot dogs, arreglos florales, cuadros de madera y venta de  ropa.
Paola es delegada de este banco comunal, en la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, agachada, con un ramo de maravillas (flores) en su mano y viste polera negra. Ella es florista hace 17 años, compra flores en Talca y en Santiago y hace arreglos para vender en una calle del centro de la ciudad, ya que no tiene un local establecido y está gestionando sus permisos. Invertirá este préstamo en rosas rojas y azules, papel celofán, papel de arroz, cinta y autoadhesivos.
Su sueño es tener un kiosco de flores en una esquina del centro de Talca. Su gran motivación son sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años los cuales dependen solo de ella. 
Para Paola Fondo Esperanza ha significado una gran oportunidad para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera mantener a su familia
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. La mayor parte de la población habita en el sector rural, la cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del C.. Se caracteriza  por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial.  Sus principales atracciones son la flora, la fauna, y sus viñedos. A pesar que la fuerza de trabajo se ha incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Blanca Estrella” (White Star) and is composed of 15 members, who reside in Talca. They are primarily engaged in the sale of lingerie, fruits, vegetables, hotdogs, floral arrangements, wood picture frames and clothing sales. Paola is a delegate of this communal bank. In the photo, she is in the front row, bent over with a bouquet of maravillas (flowers) in her hand; she is wearing a black shirt. She has been a florist for 17 years. She buys flowers in Talca and Santiago and makes floral arrangements to sell in a downtown street because she doesn’t have a fixed locale; she is negotiating permits. She will use the funds to buy red and blue roses, cellophane and rice paper, ribbon and self-adhesives. Her dream is to have a flower stand on a Talca corner. She is motivated by her two children, 13 and 8 years of age, who depend solely on her. For Paola, Fondo Esperanza has meant a great opportunity to continue with her work and support her family. Talca is in the Maule region located in the central part of the country. Most of the area’s population lives in rural surroundings and are engaged in commercial activities related to farming. It is characterized by its beautiful crafts and colonial architecture. Its main attractions are its flora, its fauna and its vineyards. Although employment has increased, this region continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the country’s poorest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red and blue roses, cellophane and rice paper, ribbon and self-sticking adhesives.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “SAN RAFAEL”

“SAN RAFAEL” es una alcancía comunal que trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más D. un año y medio, esta formado por 11 mujeres carismáticas, una D. ellaS es L. señora Luisa que tiene 68 años D. edad y ha logrado demostrar una gran determinación a través D. su vida, elL. nos cuenta que está felizmente casada con su pareja, él se dedica a L. construcción civil, con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes.
Luisa tiene un taller D. corte y confección D. ropa, cuenta con empleados para los procesos D. fabricación y es elL. quien se encarga D. supervisar el negocio, que le trae ingresos según los pedidos que tenga.
Al tener una casa amplia tomó L. idea D. poner el primer piso en alquiler, así que recibe un ingreso mensual fijo, también cuenta con un auto el cual alquiL. para tener un mayor ingreso mensual fijo.
Los planes D. Luisa son los D. comprar una combi para dedicarlo a L. movilidad escolar, y L. D. construir su tercer piso así también ponerlo en alquiler.
texts.en:
The San Rafael Community Bank has worked with Kiva partner Edaprospo-Prosperidad for more than a year and a half. The group consists of eleven charismatic women. One of them is 68-year old Sra. Luisa who has shown great determination throughout her life. She is happily married to her husband who works in civil construction. They have four children who live independently. Luisa has a dressmaking business. Her staff do the actual sewing while Luisa herself supervises the work. The amount of money she earns depends on the orders she gets. Once her house was built, she decided to rent out the first floor so she would get a fixed amount of rental income each month. She also has a car that she rents out to earn more money. Luisa would like to buy a combi van to use to transport students to school, and also to construct a third floor on her house to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mrs. Pok C. is 54 years old and lives in Choes village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mann Phath, are farmers who own 1.5-hectare field on which they make a living by growing rice. Mrs. Pok C. supplements their small income by selling groceries in the local village. Despite their had work, they are not able to earn enough of an income to support their family. That is why Mrs. Pok C. decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow to breed. The couple has one child, who makes a living as a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Merilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish, dried fish, and shrimp in the local community through peddling. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully paid the previous loan of 5,000 Php from HSPFI. This loan was used as additional working capital for her buy and sell business. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a wife of M. M. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years. She is a very caring lady. She performs her duties as a mother and a wife very effectively. She stays at home, manages the domestic chores and prepares the food for them.  She has given birth to three sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers. The youngest is a tailor and sews specifically gent’s clothes.  Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He sells the vegetables on his four-wheeled cart in different areas. He also supplies the vegetables to the vegetable shops and generates income. He has been in this profession for 10 years. He has a good reputation among his customers. 
Bashiran has been with Asasah for the last three years. With the loan profit, she has been able to marry off her elder son. Now she is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase seasonal vegetables so her husband can expand his business. Her husband hopes to open a vegetable shop if he earns good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Erlinda owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erlinda has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly whenever she sells a raised animal.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: We Will Try Group

texts.en:
Sam T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called We Will Try. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 months and 3 years. He is a college graduate. He cares for two siblings. 

For 3 years, he has been selling soap, dried pepper, and tomatoes at Redlight Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with 10,000 Liberian dollars (LRD) and now has 20,000 LRD as working capital.

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to buy more soap, dried pepper and tomatoes. He describes himself as an earnest and hard-working man.

His dream is to expand his business and educate his children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: to buy soap, dried pepper, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en: Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and investing in her business to make money for her family. She plans to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine with which she will make clothes. She will use the profits to purchase medicine, clothes and school supplies for her children and save up to purchase a concrete floor for her home because her floor is dirt. She thanks you all for your support. Maria's group is located in Samana – a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child. Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofai T. is 62 and married with 11 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. Sofai has many years of experience in this business. Sofai needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas per week) to improve/expand her business.

This is Sofai's sixth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sofai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en alquiler en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene 5 hijos tres están casados y vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, el esposo trabaja en transporte pesado viajando tres veces por semana; ella tiene su casita en el campo donde cría vacas, la actividad que tiene para generar su ingresos es la venta de leche, por primera vez es cliente de Impro y también de kiva.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de alimento para su ganado.
Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Julia rents a place in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are married. She lives with her two children aged 17 and 11. Her husband works in transport, traveling three times per week. Her small home is in the field where she raises cows; she sells milk to generate her income. She is a new client of Impro and of Kiva. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of food for her livestock. She qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of food for her dairy cows

loans.name: Saijmaa

texts.en: Saijmaa R. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province, in the western of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her elder child is a student and the younger one attends a local middle school. Her husband helps with the taxi service and flour trading business. Since 2005, the two have been providing transportation throughout their province and from that business, they earn 150,000-200,000 MNT net profit per month. Her husband, Battulga, manages his flour retailing business. He purchases flour in bulk from Bayan-Ulgiy, a neighboring province and resells at retail prices. The two are very hard working and creative people who wish to purchase a big truck in order to import more flour from Russia and become one of the biggest flour suppliers in their town. Saijmaa is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of flour for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of flour

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie P. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Melanie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Mr. Sophon R. (shown in the photo), is 26 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sophat Korng, 28, have been married for 3 years. They are living in a small village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophon is a construction worker. His wife is a garment factory worker. Besides these jobs, the couple are rice farmers as well. 

Sophon is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina;  La socia tiene 45 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende frazadas y colchones. La socia invertirá en la compra de mercadería (frazadas); La socia solicita el préstamo para  comprar mercadería. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Paulina belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank.  The bank is situated in the Calca district, Urubamba province, 
Cusco department.

Paulina, age 45, is married and has three children.  She is a small businesswoman who buys and sells blankets and mattresses.  
She will buy merchandise (blankets).  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en: He is a 39-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda married with five children aged 19, 17, 14, 9 and 6 years. His name is John. He lives in his own house and is into the transport business. He has a truck that is mostly hired to transport heavy things. He has been in the business for 10 years now and hopes to carry on with the hope of growth with the purchase of more trucks. John intends to use the loan proceeds to buy tires for his truck for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has been running a beauty salon for the past 4 years.  He offers different beauty services to his clients. As is common for the majority of Lebanese men, he too cooperates with his family to pay for the living expenses. He has always learned the new looks and haircuts in order to offer beautiful designs to his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new hairdressing tools. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop and grow his business operation by providing the latest beauty services to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. La ubicación de su negocio es su vivienda y de manera ambulante. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ella tiene 1 hijo que ya es mayor de edad. Inicio desde muy joven ya que ella estaba interesada en trabajar, pues necesitaba proporcionarle a su hijo lo necesario. se acercan muy temporadas en donde ya tiene ciertos pedidos y quiere este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como faldas, trajes, pantalones de vestir, vestidos y camisas.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena is 37 years old.  She has a business selling clothes.  Her business is located in her home and she also sells itinerantly.  She has had this business for more than 20 years and has one grown-up child.  She started out when she was very young since she was interested in working because she needed to provide for her child.  A season is approaching in which she already has certain orders and she would like this loan to buy items such as skirts, suits, dress pants, dresses and shirts.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata's way of living is farming. She owns and tills a plot of land in her town in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. Fortunata is glad she has the farm because it helps her family in a big way. 

Fortunata applied for a loan of Php 4000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner. She will use it to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. 

Fortunata is 55 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 22 and 18.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife A. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Marife is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothing (or ukay-ukay) in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to resell

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel C. C. tiene 44 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Segundo Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel C. C. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their five children. They live in the town of Ventenas Provincia los Rios.

The Señor de la Salud group is located Soloma and is part of the Echandia municipality. This community bank focuses on the agricultural sector specifically the cultivation of short cycle crops like corn, rice, and passion fruit. The group has been working in this area for a long time.

Segundo Manuel is a farmer and works growing corn, rice, and passion fruit. He purchases his supplies in Comercial Viscarra, a large store, and he sells his products in Comercial Escudero.

He is applying for the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to cultivate corn, rice, and passion fruit. The loan will provide economic support that will allow him to fulfill his family's needs. He faces challenges like insect infestations, plant diseases, and unpredictable weather. His dream is to purchase a plot of land. Segundo Manuel enjoys playing sports in his free time.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es: Raymunda, de 46 años, vive con su esposo  Guillermo (46) y sus seis hijos, juntos habitan  en su casa que es propia.Hace un buen tiempo atrás, Raymunda trabajaba para un productor de café, por lo cual recibía una remuneración justa, pero sus ideas no eran tomadas en cuenta. Luego de unos años incursionó en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de café, coca y cacao, y de esta manera pueda tomar sus propias decisiones, desde luego que le esta dando buenos resultados. Además su cartera de clientes aumentó y por consiguiente sus ingresos económicos se mantienen estables.  Esto se debe al constante trabajo que realiza junto con su pareja y al apoyo de sus peones. Usualmente su producto de cacao, coca y café; los vende a los comerciantes; además  labora de lunes a sábado, a partir de las siete  de la mañana hasta las seis  de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es seguir apostando en la actividad agrícola, y  quiere comprar más terrenos de cultivo con el propósito de aumentar su producción agrícola.Este es su primer  crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pagos, además se siente fortalecido con su banco comunal, ya que sus integrantes le   brindan muchos beneficios.Raymunda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en el mantenimiento de sus productos agrícolas, con la compra de abono y fertilizantes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Raymunda, who is 46 years old, lives with her husband Guillermo (46) and their 6 children, together in their own house. A long time ago, Raymunda worked for a coffee grower, and received a good wage, but her ideas were not taken into account. After some years she ventured into agricultural activities, specifically the production and marketing of coffee, coca and cocoa. This allows her to make her own decisions, and since then she has had good results. In addition, her customer base is growing, and consequently her income is stable. This is due to her constant work, along with her partner, and the support of their workers. Usually she sells her cocoa, coffee and coca to merchants. She works Monday to Saturday, from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening. Her plan for the future is to continue betting on agriculture, and she wants to buy more farmland with the intent of increasing her agricultural production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to meet her repayment obligations. She feels empowered by her communal bank, since its members have given her a lot of help. Raymunda plans to invest the requested money in maintaining her farm products with the purchase of manure and fertilizers, and in this way she hopes to continue her progress.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 44 years old. Marlita is married and has four children aged 20, 17, 12 and 3. To make a living, Marlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlita does her best to feed her family and provide her children proper education.

Marlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Marlita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four low-income people. Mrs. Son P., 29 years old, has been selected as leader by the other members of the group. Son P. lives in Siem Reap province and is a laborer who works in the busy fish market. She is hired by people to help carry their fish. Son P. has been married for many years to Mr. Ouk Vuthy, 28 years old, who also works in the same business. Together they make $6 each day. This couple has three young children who are enrolled in primary school and are dependent on their income. Son P. is taking out a loan to repair and decorate her old house.

There are three other borrowers in this group. Seng T., a cake seller, is requesting a loan to increase her business capital. Lem S., a grocery seller, needs a loan to accumulate inventory. Phach V., a fisherman, needs to buy nets for her fishing business.

loans.use: to repair and decorate her old house

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia O. T., tiene actualmente 25 años de edad de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, tiene dos hijos pequeños, en la actualidad trabaja en la Municipalidad de Tíraque que está ubicada aproximadamente a 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba.  

Asimismo también manifiesta ser productora agrícola que por motivos laborales dejo esta actividad la gestión pasada, pero tiene previsto para retomar la actividad este año, porque no puede dejar sus terrenos agrícolas sin producción, razón por la cual solicita el presente crédito para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa para la siembra que realizara en sus propios terrenos que están ubicados en la comunidad de C'uchimita - Tíraque; los productos que obtendrá producto de la siembra los comercializara en la feria semanal de Tíraque. Ella desea dar mejores condiciones de vida sus hijos porque la agricultura le genera buenos ingresos cuando se la trabaja bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia O. T., 25, is single.  She managed to finish elementary school.  She has two young children and is currently employed in the city of Tiraque which is located about 65 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

She states that she’s also a farmer but left this occupation due to labor issues last season.  She plans to resume this activity this year, though, because she can’t leave her fields unproductive.  For this reason she’s asking for a loan to buy chicken manure and potato seed for the planting she will undertake on her fields located in the community of C'uchimita-Tiraque.  She will sell whatever products she harvests at Tiraque’s weekly market.  She wants to provide better living conditions for her children because farming, when done well, produces good income.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Elibit

texts.en:
Elibit is 50 years old and has been practising mixed farming for 30 years producing and selling milk, maize and beans in her local market of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. She is married with seven children, four of whom are still in school.
Elibit has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a motorcycle. She believes the purchase of a motorcycle will ensure prompt delivery of her produce, especially milk, and will enable her to make more income and expand her dairy farming. She says the additional income will also help her meet her family's needs. Her business challenges are animal diseases and dry spells, which result in animal feed shortages.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ramon Lindor

texts.en:
Ramon is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and young daughter in the rural community of Sincape, in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Currently, Ramon and his family do not have the basic services of electricity and running water. 

Ramon makes a living by raising and commercializing farm animals such as sheep and goats. He raises his livestock in a yard near his house, and when the animals have reached an appropriate size and weight, he offers them for sale to the general public and merchants in the local market. Ramon has three years of experience in this business and has built a loyal customer base. Additionally, Ramon works as an agricultural laborer on various small farms in the surrounding area.

Ramon would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals. To achieve this goal, he has solicited a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa. This investment will allow Ramon to increase his income to continue investing in his business and cover his family’s expenses. His greatest wish is to continue improving the quality of life that he can offer to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with four children and  she owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for six years and the business is growing steadily. Her hardship is thieves who often break into the shop and  her vision is to relocate to a more secure arcade and become a wholesaler. Irene needs the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Judith C., 41, does just like that. She is married to Reynaldo, a technician, and they have been blessed with two children who are studying in public elementary and high schools nearby.  Judith works very hard to help her husband earn a living so that they will be able to send their children all the way through college. The family lives in Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Judith is a distributor of food supplements and other natural medicines such as CMD or Concentrated Mineral Drops.  She has been in this business for quite some time now. She buys these items at discounted prices and sells them at regular prices to her customers. Judith has already built up a clientele through her friends, relatives and other social connections. She earns an estimated monthly net income of around 11,000 PHP. To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan, which she intends to use to purchase more cases and boxes of natural medicines ordered in advance by her customers.  

Judith acknowledges that no challenge is too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cases of natural medicines ordered in advance by her customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old, single, and has one child. Irene still lives with her mother in a three-room house. The death of her fiancé made  her confused in life since he was planning to let her further her education. Due to poverty her parents were unable to send her to school nor make her learn a trade. All this made her join GHAPE in 2008. She took her first loan which she invested in the rearing of fowls and buying and selling of used shoes. She also assists her mother in frying and selling puff-puff (fritters) and beans.

Given another loan, she plans to buy more used shoes to resell from one local market to another. Most of the people in her community are poor and cannot afford new shoes so most of them buy only used shoes. She also plans to rear fowls with part of the loan as fowls are a fast income-generating activity because they don’t take a long time to mature.

The profit she gets from the loan shall be used to expand her business by growing fowls on a larger scale in order to satisfy more people. Part of the profit will also be used to educate her child and her nieces and nephews. 

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy used shoes and raise pigs and fowls.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, age 29, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  Sophal is a farmer and she also sells traditional cakes, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Their standard of living has improved since Sophal has had this business.  She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport cakes to resell.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and is married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past ten years, Virginia has been selling fish to earn a living. 

Virginia has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Virginia hopes that her business will provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Milluni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILLUNI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de jugos, artesanía en tejido de vicuñas, venta de comida, cerrajería.
 
La señora Rosa,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanías, que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra hilo, lana, etc.), este material lo compra de la Ceja y la 16 de julio, por mayor, posterior a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para ella, pues es soltera.
texts.en:
The “Milluni” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Rosa.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are:  games sales, vicuña wool textiles, food sales and metal shop. 

Rosa indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she was invited by a promoter.  She currently has a business making crafts that she’s had for the last 10 years.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (she will buy yarn, wool, etc.)  She buys these materials in La Ceja and at the 16 de Julio Market at wholesale.   After she completes making the crafts she sells them on order.  This way of working allows her to generate income for herself since she’s single.

loans.use: to buy yarn, wool, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for six years now. His mixed farm produces milk, eggs and maize which are all sold at the local market. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business in the same region. He is age 36 and married with four children who all attend school.

Francis has made his third loan request through Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 Kenyan shillings. He plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock of chicken and chicken feeds. The proceeds from the sale of eggs and chicken will help improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of diseases which cause massive death of poultry and this has affected his production. He hopes that in the next five years, he will have increased his poultry to 500 and acquired at least three quality dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: La señora Olga oriunda D. la localidad D. Santa Rita, Santa Cruz,  su actividad es la venta D. patasca La patasca (del quechua phatasqa, reventado o partido) es un caldo que se prepara en las zonas alto-andinas del Perú y Bolivia. El concentrado con las vísceras D. la res y la cabeza del carnero le dan un sabor peculiar a esta preparación D. alto valor nutricional ella venD. los últimos 3 días D. la semana, con el dinero del  crédito comprara ingredientes para la elaboración D. la Patasca, casada con el sr  armando el  cual es empleado en una empresa D. entrega D. agua que realiza en las comunidades cercanas a la zona tienen 5 hijos los cuales le ayudan con sus trabajos para salir adelante, persona responsable y trabajadora esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad D. vida y seguir adelante superándose.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga is originally from the town of Santa Rita in Santa Cruz. She sells “patasca” (from the Quechua word phatasqa meaning “to burst” or “to split”), a soup that is prepared in the Andean highlands of Peru and Bolivia. The innards of a cow and a sheep’s head give this soup its particular flavor and high nutritional value. Olga sells her soup three days a week.

The money from this loan will be used to buy ingredients for making “patasca”. She is married to Sr. Armando, who is employed by a company that delivers water to the local communities nearby. They have five children who help with the work so that they can get ahead.

Olga is a responsible and hardworking person. She is grateful to Emprender for the financial support it has provided so that she can have a better quality of life and continue to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making soup.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: The picture above depicts Rose showing some corn dough she makes for sale at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a chef. Rose has been selling corn dough for 10 years. She helps her spouse to pay utility bills and other household expenditures. Her loan will be used to procure additional bags of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to procure additional bags of maize.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in carpentry and the timber business for four years. He started with a capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the demand and  his vision is having a modern showroom plus educating his children.

Semu needs the loan to buy timber and already made furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy timber and   already made furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for her next bean crop and to buy firewood to increase her sales.

loans.name: La Lluvia Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "L. LLUVIA" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado D. Mexico, las clientas decidieron llevar este nombre ya que L. mayor parte del año en esta región llueve. Este grupo esta integrado por 9 clientas en el cual se encuentra L. señora Lorena quien es presidenta del grupo. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. plantas, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Desea invertir nuevamente para asi poder ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar ya que quiere brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor y educación. Con el prestamo que le otorguen va a comprar plantas D. diferentes clases y tamaños que le solicitan sus clientes y pedidos que tiene pendientes D. entregar. L. señora se siente muy contenta con L. oportunidad que le dan para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio. Observaciones: L. señora que no se ve se llama Azucena
texts.en: This group is called "L. LLUVIA". It is located in the State of Mexico. The members decided to adopt this name as for most of the year it rains in this region. This group consists of 9 members with Señora Lorena as the president. She sells plants. She is married and has 3 children. She wants to invest again so that she can help her husband with the household expenses as she wants to proviD. her children with a better future and education. With the loan you willl give her, she is going to buy plants of different types and sizes that her customers are asking for and orders she has pending delivery. She is very happy with the opportunity that she is being given to continue growing her business. Observation: the lady that you can't see in the photo is called Azucena.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of plants of different sizes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49 years old and married with six children.  She sells charcoal in Malindi town and has been in the business for the past three years.  She receives a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD, Joyce will use the loan amount to purchase additional stocks of charcoal as well as to put up a wooden structure at her business.  Her vision is to be able to better serve her ever increasing customer base. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business to support her family financially, and help grow her business by opening a water selling point in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
Ines es una persona emprendedora quien tienen su negocio de venta de comida, gaseosa y fritanaga, ella es casada con cuatro hijos dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar y una esta en la universidad solo tres dependen de ella.
ella acude a ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo prestamo para compra de mercaderia para abastecer su negocio. ha trabajado veinte prestamos con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ines is an enterprising individual who has a business selling food, sodas, and fried snacks. She is married and has four children. Two of them are of school age and another one is at the university. Only three of her children are dependent on her.

She approached CEPRODEL in order to request a new loan for buying merchandise to restock her business. Ines has received 20 loans from CEPRODEL and all of them were used for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en: Mylen, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years and earns additional income by selling frozen foods. She is now requesting a loan of  PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs. Mylen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marta es casada, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, tiene una frutería que está situada sobre una calle muy transitada de esta ciudad.
Vive con sus padres, con las comodidades básicas para una vivienda decorosa. Comenta que trabaja en el ramo hace más de 15 años, por lo que tiene una vasta experiencia en lo que hace.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, como ser naranjas, bananas, manzanas y otros, los cuales son esenciales para su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por poner su interés en ella, ya que la ayuda de ellos será muy beneficiosa para su microempresa.
texts.en:
Marta is married and lives in the city of Pilar.  She’s a merchant.  She has a fruit store on one of the city’s busiest streets.  

She lives with her parents in a house that has basic utilities for proper living.  She comments that she’s been in this line of work for over 15 years so she has a vast experience in what she does.  

She’s asking for the loan to buy fruit like oranges, bananas, apples and others which are essential for her business.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for placing their interest in her because their help will be very beneficial for her micro business.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, apples and other seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Kos Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme S.MARIE  est la représentante du groupe KOSWENDE .Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments, des céréales et du bois de chauffe  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de toécé village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de choux, 03 tines de haricots et une charrette de bois de chauffe.

Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  acheter une bouteille à gaz et aider son mari dans les charges familliales.
texts.en:
Mrs. S.Marie is the representative for the group Koswende. She is married and has two children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 14. One is attending school. She has five people under her care.

She has been selling condiments, cereals, and firewood for five years. She buys her supplies at the nearby Toécé large market in a nearby village. Her clients are composed of women from the neighborhood.

She wants to buy one sack of cabbage, three tins of beans, and a cart of firewood.

She is using the profits to increase the size of her business and improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to buy a gas cylinder and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of cabbage, three tins of beans, and one cart of firewood.

loans.name: Piga Sévérin

texts.fr:
Mr  PIGA SEVERIN est marié et n’a pas d’enfant. Il s’occupe de quelques enfants dont un va  à l’école. Il a 05 personnes en charge.

Mr est  gérant d’une boutique d’appareils radio et électronique de véhicules  depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne au  NIGERIA (pays voisin). Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les jeunes.

Il veut  s’acheter  40 appareils électroniques de voiture.

Mr  utilise ses bénéfices pour  agrandir sa boutique. Il  ambitionne  épargner et assurer la scolarité de l’enfant dont il a la charge.
texts.en:
Piga Severin is married and the father of one. His son is two years old, and he also supports a child who is at school. In total Piga Severin supports five people.

For 15 years, he has managed a shop which sells vehicle radios and electronics. He purchases his stock in the neighbouring country of Nigeria. His customers are women, men and young people.

He wants to buy 40 car electronics accessories.

Piga Severin uses his profits to expand his business. He also wants to save money to pay for the schooling of the child he supports.

loans.use: to buy 40 car electronics accessories.

loans.name: Sahity

texts.fr: Monsieur Sahity habite au Sénégal dans l’une de ses communautés ou il vit depuis plusieurs années. C’est un  homme marié de 48 ans, père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 8 et 25 ans. Il est originaire d’une région au sud du Sénégal.  Concernant son activité il est superviseur d’une auberge depuis 5 ans.  Il éprouve beaucoup de passion et de plaisir dans son activité. Les éléments qui  l’intéressent  le plus sont le contact permanent qu’il noue avec la population mais aussi les revenus que lui procure cette dernière. Il est membre  du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité en question et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour supporter les frais de voyage de ses enfants qui doivent se rendre dans leur région natale pour un séjour. Ce  crédit lui permettra de satisfaire un besoin social.
texts.en:
Sahity is originally from southern Senegal, though he has lived in a different area of the country for several years. He is 48 years old, married and the father of 3 children aged between 8 and 25. He has been the manager of a hostel for 5 years and enjoys his job greatly. He especially likes forging strong links with the community and running a profitable business.

Sahity is a member of his local UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs with which to pay the cost of a visit by his children to their native region. This loan will enable him to satisfy their social needs.

loans.use: to pay his family´s travel expenses.

loans.name: Carlos Oscar

texts.es: El señor Carlos nacido en la ciudad de Cochabamba de 24 años de edad, se dedica al servicio de protesista dental desde hace 2 años esta  actividad la realiza en su domicilio ubicado en el km 7 zona capacachi, el señor es emprendedor inicio su propio negocio cuenta con herramientas y equipos propios que le ayudan a realizar los distintos pedidos que tiene por parte de los odontólogos con los que trabaja actualmente vive en casa propia de herencia familiar; el señor es soltero es  una persona amable y responsable , el crédito que se le otorga le ayudara a reparar y compra repuestos para sus maquinas que necesitan mantenimiento, el señor nos comenta que esta agradecido por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos was born in the town of Cochabamba. He is 24 years old and makes dental prosthetics, work he’s been doing for two years out of his home located at km 7 in the Capacachi zone. He is an enterprising man and started this business himself. He has his own tools and equipment to make the different prosthetics that the orthodontists order from him.

Carlos lives in the house he inherited from his parents. He is single, friendly, and responsible. The loan he is seeking will be used to service and buy spares for the equipment which is in need of maintenance. He is grateful for the confidence shown in offering him with a loan.

loans.use: to buy spares for his prosthetic-making equipment

loans.name: Eriolyn

texts.en: Eriolyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now. She requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Eriolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 58 anos de edad es un hombre alegre y emprendedor, es casado con la Leily con quien comparte su negocio. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Jaime es la venta de refrescos  especiales de aguaje, hungurauy, coco con leche, frtuas de la region de la selva. Tiene una refrigeradora que es una herramienta indispensable para su trabajo. Esta actividad lo realiza en un parque, lleva ya 10 años realizando ésta actividad, tiempo en el cual valió para hacerse conocido en ese lugar. Y ahora lo realiza solo, pero siempre con mucha alegría. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que es fácil y le genera un ingreso económico con el cual puede tener un sustento para la economía de su hogar, se siente contento ya que ésta actividad le ha traído muchas satisfacciones. Tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio, por eso tiene planes de realizar plantaciones de yucas en su terreno que tiene 50 hectáreas de extensión, pero por falta de capital aun no se iniciará en ese proyecto. Este sería el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente contento con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará una congeladora valorizada en 1500 nuevos soles la cual le ayudará a tener mayor cantidad de productos para plantar más yuca, asimismo comprará los ingredientes para preparar más refrescos.
texts.en: Jaime is 58 years old and is a happy and entrepreneurial man.  He is married to Leily, and they have a business together.  They live in their own house.  Jaime works selling beverages that he makes with aguaje fruit, coconut with milk, and jungle fruits.  He has a refrigerator that is necessary for his business.  He works at a park, and has been doing so for 10 years, long enough to become well-known in the area.  He is currently working alone, but always very happily.  He likes his work because it is easy and generates a good income for sustaining the home.  He is happy that his job provides him with a lot of satisfaction.  He desires to keep working and expand his business, so he has plans to plant yucca on his 50 hectare plot of land, but he lacks the capital to start this project.  This will be his tenth loan with MFP, and he is happy to be able to count on a loan.  He promises to be punctual with his payments.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy a freezer valued at 1,500 nuevos soles that will help him have a greater quantity of products in order to plant yucca.  He will also buy the ingredients for preparing more beverages.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and ingredients to prepare soft drinks, as well as yucca seeds

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio owns a bakery and restaurant called Rico Pan De Bono in South Florida. He has been in business for seven successful years and is slowly expanding to diversify the products the restaurant offers. Rico Pan De Bono offers Colombian baked goods and specialties. When Julio moved from Colombia to the US, he knew he wanted to bring a bit of Colombia with him while becoming an independent entrepreneur. He is proud to be his own boss and do what he loves, as he continues to provide for his family. The restaurant employs eight people, and Julio is happy that he can contribute to the economy in a positive way by offering job opportunities. The biggest challenge for Julio in his business venture has been obtaining the funding he needs to continue making improvements to the restaurant. Without credit in the United States, it has been very difficult for Julio to find a loan. This loan from Accion USA will enable Julio to purchase tables and chairs for the bakery, build a take-out window, and renovate a bathroom. The financial assistance will have a huge impact on the business, because it will allow the bakery to bring in more customers by providing additional seating. Julio is hoping that it will become a gathering place for many, so he can share his piece of Colombia with the community. “As long as my customers are happy, I am happy.”

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for the bakery, build a take-out window and renovate a bathroom.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years. She describes herself to be diligent, honest, and trustworthy.

She operates a salon where she provides hair dressing. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a competitive area and her customers are both new and repeat customers. She will use the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to buy more beauty products. Anita's hope and dream within the next five years is to run two extra beauty salons.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson, a rural farmer, is married with seven children who are all in school.

Samson is a local farmer who deals in agriculture, alcohol brewing and also does cattle trade. His business has enabled him to cater to his family needs and also pay school fees for his children.

Samson has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 (UGX) to help him buy more materials for alcohol production so as to boost his income. He will use the rest of the money to pay the tuition for his children.

Samson's dream is to become the best farmer of coffee in the district. He also hopes to construct a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To buy bananas that he will ripen and squeeze

loans.name: Elda Lucia

texts.en:
Hi, I’m Elda Lucia. I have a used clothes store located downtown in the city where I live. I’ve been working in this type of business for several years, and it gives me income to contribute to my family’s expenses. That way, I can offer better opportunities to my family. Currently, I need to stock up my store since sales go up during the Christmas season.

Loan Use: Purchase one bulk of children’s clothes, one bulk of mixed clothes, one bulk of linens, one bulk of children’s winter clothes

Hola soy Elda Lucia, cuento con un negocio de ropa usadada, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para comtribuir en los gastos familiares y de esa forma poder ofrecer mejores oportunidades a mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que para epoca de Navidad el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Compra de un fardo de ropa para niño, Fardo de ropa Mixta, Fardo de Cameras, fardo de ropa invierno  para niño

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana Sarmento M. is 56 years old and is originally from Maputo. Her parents’ financial position allowed her to study through the 4th grade, only until her father abandoned the family. Her mother was unemployed so she had to work at a clothing sweatshop to help support her mother and six siblings. She is now married and has 5 children. When her fifth child was just a year old her husband died and she was forced to take over his business, which she continues today. She learned about HLUVUVU-ADSEMA through her neighbors and applied for a loan to grow her business. Currently her business is going well. In addition to selling basic household goods she has started a small Restaurant and Bar. The income from her business supports her family and pays the salary of 2 employees. With her savings she will build a living room for her home and buy a car to transport goods for her store. With the loan for 30,000MT she hopes to increase her stock volume to avoid constant and almost daily trips to Maputo city for supplies, a distance of 35K from Mafuiane, which will also lower her transportation costs. Her business has a large impact on the community.
