In addition to providing employment for herself and two others, she brings products closer to the residents of Aldeia de Mafuiane and every year she provides a free lunch on Children’s Day to all the kids in Aldeia.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Mariana Sarmento M. de 56 anos de idade, natural de Cidade de Maputo Província de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos Pais. A situação financeira da família sou lhe permitiu estudar até 4º classe, depois seu Pai abandonou a família e a sua Mãe era desempregada, quando começou a trabalhar numa Empresa de Fábrica de Vestuário para sustentar a sua Mãe e os seus irmãos, veio a casar e teve cinco (5) filhos e quando o seu quinto filho tinha apenas 1 ano o seu marido faleceu, foi quando então começou a dedicar-se a um negócio que dele sobrevive até hoje. Através da vizinhas teve o conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e ficou interessada em obter um empréstimo para ampliar o seu negócio. O seu negócio encontra-se neste momento num bom ritmo porque alem de vender produtos de primeira necessidade introduziu agora serviço de Restaurante e Bar. Com o rendimento da mesma actividade suporta as despesas familiares e paga salário aos seus 2 empregado. Com as poupanças do negocio esta a construir uma moradia familiar e para um futuro breve tenciona comprar uma viatura para transporte de mercadoria da loja. Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria de forma a evitar viagens constantes e quase diárias a cidade de Maputo para fazer compras, pois dista 35 Kms de Mafuiane, reduzindo assim os custos de transporte. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela própria e dois jovens, coloca o produto mais próximo da População da Aldeia de Mafuiane e anualmente oferece lanche gratuito no dia da criança para todos os meninos da aldeia.

loans.use: To increase the stocks in her shop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and has three children ages 2, 11 and 14. Her husband is a teacher but his income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. Sadly, their eldest son suffers from a brain illness requiring constant treatment and costly operations. Lucia used to work as a receptionist but she wasn't earning enough until someone recommended that she start a business selling shoes. She has now been in business for three years and is slowly winning new customers. At this time Lucia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise and meet demand. She promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. She and her family are grateful for your generous support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Lucia es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 14, 11 y 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como maestro, pero su ingreso no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, lamentablemente su hijo mayor sufre una enfermedad en el cerebro, por la que ha requerido de constantes tratamientos y operaciones costosas, a pesar de que Lucia también trabajaba en la recepción de una empresa no contaban con los recursos suficientes, le recomendaron que iniciara con la venta de calzado y así lo hizo, desde hace tres años se dedica a este negocio, y poco a poco ha estado ganando más clientes.

En estos momentos, Lucia requiere de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru:
Olim A. has been an active client of MLF Microinvest for over 3 years. He has over 8 years of entrepreneurial experience. Olim is married with 2 children. His children are in school. Olim's dream is to provide a good education for his children. He started his business selling men's shoes with $200 in initial capital. Now the value of his assets is $900. He requests a loan of $1000 to increase his inventory. He wants to use the profits for his children's education.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Акилов Олим, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Его дети ходят в школу. Его мечта, дать своим детям достойное образование. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 200$. Сейчас его активы составляют 900$. Ему необходимо 1000$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Miss Florence E. is 34 years old and is a trained hairdresser. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 325 to expand her business, selling ladies' wear, shoes, and bags as well as operating a beauty salon. She also needs another hair dryer to enable her to attend to more customers.

Florence has been a LAPO member for the past 2 years. She has been in business since 1993.

loans.use:
To buy an additional hair dryer, relaxers, shampoo, bags & 
shoes for sale

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martin is 47 years old and lives at home to care for his mother. He is responsible for the familial income. He has a small farm dedicated to the production and selling of milk. He is an incredibly hard worker and wakes up before sunrise everyday to milk and care for the cows. Afterwards he uses his horse-drawn cart to deliver his milk products to the clients. In the afternoon he feed his cows and works in his garden where he grows food products for self-consumption. He also uses part of his land to cultivate sugar cane for the market.

With this loan he plans to buy a milking machine that can milk 5 cows at once. This will ease his work load while helping him better his production.

loans.use: Purchase a milking machine

loans.name: Ada Laura

texts.es:
Mrs. Ada Laura belongs to the communal bank, "Las Fresitas" (the small strawberries). She lives in Av. Colonizacion in the Yarina district, in the Ucayali department. She is 57 years old and mother of 4 children Her children are all grown up and have not to forgotten the sacrifice her mother has maD. for them, for which they are eternally grateful and very proud of their mother. Ada Laura is married and her husband works with her, but their income is not enough to cover the household expenses. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) she was able to set up a stand to sell sodas, mineral water, beer, and at night she sells meals.

Right now she continues with this business. She and her husband get up at 6a.m. to open the store to give service to their customers. In the afternoons she prepares the food she will send at night.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 3,000 (US$ 1003.00 approx.) which will be paid in 6 months, she will stock her store with 6 packages of large sodas, 4 packages of mineral water, 5 boxes of small sodas, and maintain her store (for this she will use S/. 600.00), and with the rest she will buy the materials and supplies necessary for the daily sale of food.

Ada Laura feels very happy because her business is growing, she has more customers, and is very thankful for the support offered to her by Manuela Ramos. Thanks to this she has been able to achieve the family stability she hoped for so much.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ada Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas”, vive en la Av. Colonización, del distrito D. Yarina del departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, todos son mayores D. edad y no olvidan el sacrificio que su madre hizo por ellos, están eternamente agradecidos y muy orgullosos D. su madre. Ada Laura está casada, su esposo trabaja con ella, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos D. la casa. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00(US$ 100.00) pudo instalar una tienda D. venta D. gaseosas, agua mineral, cerveza, y por las noches se dedica a la venta D. comidas.

En la actualidad, continúa con este negocio. Ella y su esposo se levantan a las 6.00 D. la mañana para abrir la tienda y atender a sus clientes. Por las tardes prepara la comida que va a vender en la noche.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 3,000 (US$ 1003.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, implementará su tienda con 6 paquetes D. gaseosa grandes, 4 paquetes D. agua mineral, 5 cajas D. gaseosas chicas, y dará mantenimiento a su tienda (para esto utilizará S/. 600.00), y con el resto comprará insumos y víveres que necesita para la venta diaria D. comida.

Ada Laura se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo, tiene mas clientes y esta muy agradecida del apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, gracias a ello ha encontrado una estabilidad familiar que tanto anhelaba.

loans.use: Buying sodas, mineral water, supplies and ingredients. (Compra de bebidas gaseosas, agua mineral.  Compra de insumos e ingredientes.)

loans.name: Miguel A.

texts.es:
Miguel raises cattle which produces milk for PIL (local milk producing plant). He lives in the Nina Chiri community, Lajas sector. This is three hours away from La Paz. He is a single man who lives with his grandmother and three younger siblings. He offers financial support since he's the oldest one in the house.

He will use the money to purchase more cattle and thus increase milk production. This is his first credit with Impro, the evaluation he got qualified him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Nina Chiri sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., El es soltero vive junto a su abuela y a sus tres hermanos menores a quienes colabora económicamente por ser el hermano mayor. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: Mr. S. has been married for five years and has two little sons. He has been a cook in a restaurant in Phnom Penh for the past six years. His wife, Sokom, weaves at home, a skill she learned from her mother. The family is in Preak Takov commune along the Mekong River about 10 Kilometer from Phnom Penh. Their wish for the future is to open a neighborhood grocery store. Mr. S. is requesting a $1200 loan amount  for the first time to make repairs on his home.

loans.use: To make home repairs

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
I have the need of constructing a room in front of my home. I have a very small home, but because of my economic situation, it is difficult to buy a bigger house. I work in an assembly plant and this job provides me with a discounted mortgage. In order to make my home more comfortable, I am sure I need to expand my house. I request $1000 in order to construct this room in front of my home.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto enfrente de mi vivienda, como pueden ver es muy pequeña pero debido a la situación económica es difícil comprar una más grande, trabajo en una planta maquiladora y a través de ahí pude tener acceso a un crédito de vivienda la cual me descuentan de mi sueldo semanal, para que mi familia este más cómoda y segura tengo que hacer una ampliación”. Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para construir un cuarto al frente de mi vivienda.

loans.use: The construction of a room.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
Maria Delfina is married and has two daughters, 11 and 15 years of age. She started the business because her salary was not enough. Then some acquaintances offer her the opportunity to sell shoes through catalogues and she liked the idea, because where she works they also sell, and she takes advantage to offer her merchandise. She started 3 years ago to sell shoes among her friends, and little by little she started selling more because at her day job she also has customers to whom she sells her merchandise. She has never been out of customers and her prices are accessible and she offers deferred payments. in fact, her daughters also help her sell among their friends and in this way she is able to increase her orders.

She requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and be able to cover pending orders because if she takes too long her customers may cancel their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria defina es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 11 años. Inició el negocio porque con el sueldo que recibe del trabajo que tiene no le alcanza entonces unas conocidas le ofrecieron integrarse a vender calzado por catalogo y le gusto la idea, porque donde trabaja también venden y aprovecha para ofrecer su mercancía. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años a vender la mercancía del calzado entre sus amigas, y poco a poco fue vendiendo mas porque en el trabajo donde esta también tiene clientes y aprovecha para colocar su mercancía. Nunca le han faltado clientes y además los precios son accesibles y dan facilidades de pago. De hecho sus hijas también le ayudan a vender entre sus amigas y con eso logra incrementar sus pedidos.

Requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder sacar los pedidos que tiene pendientes porque si se tarda en surtirlos le pueden cancelar el pedido los clientes.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
The young Ms. S. has obtained six loans with Fundación Leon over the past four years. She has invested this capital to buy merchandise for her mobile stand. She started by selling bread and soft drinks and with much effort she has improved her small business and also managed to put herslf through law school.

Ms. S. lives with her husband in her mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven S. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos cuatro años obteniendo seis creditos los que ha invertido en la compra de mercaderia en general, cuando empezo a trabajar ella vendia pan y fresco con esfuerzo a logrado cambiar de negocio y se graduo de abogado recientemente es una joven emprendedora es casada y vive con su esposo en la casa de su madre.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her mobile stand

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria raises cattle whose milk prodution is sold to PIL Andina (in English, “Andina Milk Industrialization Plant”). She lives in the community of Pucarani, a province located in the Andes, three hours from the city of La Paz. Victoria is married and has three children. She is also the owner of a general store that carries a variety of groceries. The store is in her home that is located in the town.

The loan will be used to purchase cattle to increase the production of milk and thereby raise her income. This is the second loan with Impro. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Pucarani, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz). Victoria es casada y tiene hijos. Asimismo, es poseedora de una surtida tienda de abarrotes que esta en su casa, la cuál esta en el pueblo.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado para incrementar su producción de leche y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase milk-producing cattle of a better race to increase milk production

loans.name: Liz Tania

texts.es:
Liz is a very dedicated mother of two. She takes care of her children, who are her reason for living. In order to provide for them, she has decided to independently practice as a cosmetologist. She has set-up a small beauty parlor inside her home and she offers her services to her neighbors.

Liz requests a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest buying necessary material and a machine to cut hair. Support Liz to continue with this great project.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz es una madre de familia muy dedicada al cuidado de sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir, por el cuidado que tiene que brindarles ha decidido ejercer de manera independiente su oficio de cosmetóloga en su propia casa. Para esto, ha implementado su propio salón de belleza en un pequeño espacio de su casa donde ofrece su servicio para los vecinos de su localidad.

Liz solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles que invertirá en la compra de materiales necesarios y una máquina cortadora de cabello. Apoya a Liz a continuar adelante con este gran proyecto.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and a machine to cut hair

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela has a shop where she sells bags of cement and mould blocks.  She has sale boys who work for her and are paid on a daily basis.  Angela is a LAPO client, and she has been in this business for the past five years.  Angela is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  Angela needs the loan amount of $600 to buy materials for making blocks.  She expresses her gratitude to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement and materials for block making

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Greetings from Evariste & his wife in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Evariste is 44 years old, married with 6 children.

Evariste buys bananas in markets and sells them to a brewery company that makes banana beer, a favorite local drink. His wife operates a bar and a small shop in Gisenyi town. He earns about US$ 37 every month from his business.

Evariste is requesting a loan worth 203 620 frws (US$ 375) to buy more bananas to be sold at the brewery. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: buying more bananas to be sold to the local brewery

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: La señora Eulalia G. Bogado con su marido Rafael Giménez se dedican a la venta de ropas y calzados usados,  desde hace varios años,  con el préstamo concedido por la Fundación, hizo que aumentara las mercaderías, actualmente tienen su negocio en un lugar muy favorable, entiéndase por la ubicación, facilitando así la buena venta, son personas sacrificadas y con ganas de seguir saliendo adelante-
texts.en:
Señora Eulalia G. Bogado and her husband, Rafael Giménez, have been dedicated to selling used clothing and shoes for many years. With the loan awarded through the Fundación, it will allow them to increase their merchandise. Presently, there business is in a very favorable location, which facilitates good sales. Eulalia and Rafael are sacrificing people with desire to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Mrs. Nang T., 31, works raising pigs to sell, earning US$ 2 per day. She is married with two children, both of whom are young and stay home. Her husband, Mr. Hay Hang, 35, sells wood for carving that he finds in the forest. To improve her husband's business, Nang needs a loan of 3,000,000 Riel to purchase two buffalos to use for transporting the wood. Nang's husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalos to use as transport

loans.name: Mrs. Sokrey Choeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokrey C. is the village bank president of sixteen members who all live in Trapang Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sokrey C. is 34 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. S. Sarath, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

Mrs. Sokrey C. owns a small store in the local market. Her customers make many requests for additional goods. To fulfill her customers' needs, she is requesting a loan to buy more groceries for her store.

This is a group loan, mainly consisting of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially capable. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan's term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Momé Hounkpati, Madame A. Essi est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. C’est une femme très dévouée qui est reconnue dans le milieu pour son dynamisme. Propriétaire de mini restaurant, elle prépare des mets locaux que ses clients apprécient beaucoup. Son problème le plus crucial reste le manque de moyens financiers pour son activité. Pourtant, elle fait preuve d’une bonne capacité de gestion des affaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de redynamiser ses activités, sécuriser ses revenus et améliorer sa qualité de vie.
texts.en:
Born in Mome Houkpati in 1972, Mrs Essi A. is married and the mother of six (06) children. Essi is a very dedicated woman and known in her area as being a dynamic individual. As owner of a mini-restaurent, she prepares local meals that are much appreciated by her customers. Her major problem is the lack of adequate financing for her business. Nevertheless, she has proven to have good business skills. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to revitalize her business, secure her revenues and improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her restaurent

loans.name: Kararaka-Okurut Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty O. (far left) represents kararaka poultry keepers. She is 30 years old with 4 years of experience in poultry keeping. She basically rears local chickens, which earn her a profit margin of 25% of sales. Betty works with her group members to ensure they vaccinate their poultry and feed them well. 

The loan funds are therefore enabling these women to purchase feed and vaccines for their poultry so as to increase production. Betty in particular dreams of rearing broilers and layers. She is a loving single mother of 4 and her income helps her provide for the basic needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Ingrith

texts.es:
La señorita Ingrid pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en el Jr. pasaje los Helechos Nº 103, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años. Es soltera y estudia en una Universidad particular. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en el negocio que le dejaron sus padres comprando jabón en docenas, algunas marcas de shampoo, peines y otros. Tiene 4 años con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con un stan muy surtido en el mercado principal de la ciudad, donde ofrece a sus clientes variedad de productos, y además artefactos y artículos  para regalos. 
Esto le genera ganancias diarias para pagar el prestamo puntualmente.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara variedad de  perfumes y colonias de baño en docenas, para surtir un poco mejor el negocio.

Ingrid manifiesta su alegría de poder pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos ya que le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar e crecer como persona y mujer.
texts.en:
Ingrid belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank, and lives at No.103 Helecho Avenue, Tarapoto District, San Martin Department. She is 26 years old. She is single, and studies at a private University. With the first loan she received of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the business her parents had left her, buying soap by the dozen and some brands of shampoo, combs and other such things. She has been a bank customer for four years. Currently, she has a very well-stocked stand in the town's principal market, where she offers her customers a variety of products and also things for gifts/ This generates her a daily income so she can repay her loan punctually. With this loan of 1 100 Soles which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy a variety of perfumes and bath scents by the dozen, in order to stock her stall a little better. Ingrid makes clear her happiness at being able to belong to the Manuela Ramos family which has given her the opportunity to work and grow as both a human being and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of perfumes and bath scents by the dozen to improve stock

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Мамасолиева Карима молодая, но уже преуспевающая предприниматель. Она родилась 1978 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Занимается продажей верхней одежды на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее 4 года опыта в этой деятельности и начала бизнес со своей подругой.  В его ассортименте большой выбор одежды для молодого поколения.  Она продает пальто, дубленки, кожаные плащи и головные уборы. Закупает она товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон», иногда заказывает поставщикам из Бишкека. 
Карима хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 5000 сомони для закупа женских пальто.
texts.en:
Karima M. is young, but she is already a successful entrepreneur. She was born in 1978, is married and has 2 children. She sells outer clothing at the Korvon market in Dushanbe. She has 4 years of experience in this area and she started the business with her friend. Her product assortment includes a large selection of clothing for the young generation. She sells coats, shearling coats, leather coats and hats. She purchases her products at the wholesale market Korvon and sometimes orders from Bishkek suppliers. Karima would like to participate in the KIVA program and to take out a loan of 5000 somoni for the purchase of women’s coats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase women's coats

loans.name: Sciur

texts.en: Sciur I. lives with her husband and grandson, whose parents work abroad.  She has a booth at the local market where she sells clothing for women. Sciur brings goods in every two weeks from Odessa.  Although sales from December to February decreased compared with the same period last year, Sciur is pleased with the results.  The loan is to increase her assortment of clothing items for women in spring.  In the future she intends to work at the market and increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of clothing items for women in spring.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unidas inicia su primer ciclo con 11 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de leña, carne, frutas, verduras, comida, cosméticos, cereales.

Como es el caso de Noemí es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Noemí vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado progreso, además Noemí vende mantas que reparte a pedido.

Por otro lado Josefa es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Josefa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de sus hijas.

Mientras que Graciela es soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Graciela vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.

Las socias necesitan prestamos de 300 soles, haciendo un total de 3,300 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de mango, mandarina, detergente, jabón, aceite, fideo, cosméticos, verduras.

Los sueños de las socias son tener un puesto estable, ampliar sus negocios, tener capital propio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
United Communal Bank is beginning its first cycle with 11 members. The members carry out different businesses like selling firewood, meat, fruit, vegetables, food, cosmetics, and cereals. Like in Noemí's case, she is single, 21-years-old, and lives with her parents. Noemí sells fruits as an ambulatory vender in the Progress Market. Noemí also sells blankets that are delivered upon request. On the other hand, Josefa is married, 43-years-old and has 4 children. Josefa has a small grocery store in her home. She works in her store everyday with the help of her children. Meanwhile, Graciela is single, 35-years-old and has 1 son. Graciela sells cosmetics by sharing catalogues with friends and family. These members need loans of 300 soles, making a total of 3,300 soles to be loaned by Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of mangos, mandarin oranges, detergent, soap, oil, pasta, cosmetics, and vegetables. The members dream of having stable positions, of growing their businesses, of having their own capital, and they hope that their children will complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de mango, mandarina, detergente, jabón, aceite, fideo, cosméticos, verduras.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami S., 57 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi. Ami s’active dans l’aviculture et la restauration. Elle veut acheter des poussins à élever et acheter du pain, du lait, du café et autres pour préparer et vendre le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami S., age 57, is married and has nine children to support. She has been been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Ami is active in poultry farming and restaurant business. She wants to buy chicks to raise and to buy bread, milk, coffee, and other times to make and sell breakfast. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming and to sell breakfast foods

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 34 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. il souhaite avec ce crédit payer une nouvelle moto étant donner que celle qu’il utilise est complètement amortie. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is a motorbike taxi driver in Wome. At 34 years of age, he is married and the father of one child. He hopes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike since the one he is using is completely written off. He is counting on this chance to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Azimullah

texts.en: This is Azimullah, the son of E.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with six children, and all of his family members benefit through the income his business generates. He has a general store and in order to expand it he needs a loan. He is glad that all entrepreneurs can improve their businesses and raise their standard of living through these effective programs.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger Q. is from the village of Hilltop Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Roger owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling beverages and engaging in a variety store business. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in selling beverages as a wholesaler in their village. Roger is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 7th from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and to provide for the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Hilltop, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Judit Emeleni

texts.es:
Judit is a member of the Santa Rosalia Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Atalaya. Atalaya is the main entry point to Manu National Reserve, a major Peruvian tourist destination. Atalaya is on the banks of the Carbon River, and tourists enter Manu by boat, and usually take two to seven day trips. Judit is in the process of starting her own boat company to ferry tourists on cultural trips into the park. She plans to offer a cheaper two-day trip and more inclusive trips of five to eight days. Her husband will navegate the boat, and she will handle the administrative end of things.

Judit also has a small restaurant, where she prepares fixed-price lunch menus as well as extra dishes. She doesn’t cook every day, since some days there aren’t very many people in her small town looking for lunch, but she tries to take advantage whenever opportunities present themselves (for example, on days when large groups come through town). Most of her customers are locals, not tourists, and her specialties are fish, cakes, and gelatin desserts. 

Judit is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy a boat. She already has the motor, which is actually more expensive than the boat itself will be.  Her goal for the future is to continue to improve and expand her restaurant.
texts.en:
Judit is a member of the Santa Rosalia Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Atalaya. Atalaya is the main entry point to Manu National Reserve, a major Peruvian tourist destination. Atalaya is on the banks of the Carbon River, and tourists enter Manu by boat, and usually take two to seven day trips. Judit is in the process of starting her own boat company to ferry tourists on cultural trips into the park. She plans to offer a cheaper two-day trip and more inclusive trips of five to eight days. Her husband will navigate the boat, and she will handle the administrative end of things. Judit also has a small restaurant, where she prepares fixed-price lunch menus as well as extra dishes. She doesn’t cook every day, since some days there aren’t very many people in her small town looking for lunch, but she tries to take advantage whenever opportunities present themselves (for example, on days when large groups come through town). Most of her customers are locals, not tourists, and her specialties are fish, cakes, and gelatin desserts. Judit is requesting a loan of 3000 Sols to buy a boat. She already has the motor, which is actually more expensive than the boat itself will be. Her goal for the future is to continue to improve and expand her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a boat for tourism company

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through primary school. Joyce has been making and selling palm kernel oil in Ataabadze near Elmina since 2001. Her husband is a cleaner. Joyce uses her income to help her husband to pay for their children's school fees.

Joyce will use the loan to buy more palm kernel to make oil to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to buy more palm kernel to process and sell.

loans.use: Joyce will use the loan to buy more palm kernel

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a member of the Dodoma road,Kihesa,iringa,she is 34 years old woman,she is married and amother of 2 children,her children are aged 14 and 2 years.

Zainabu started her own shop business selling sugar,wheat,tomatoes etc,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 130,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zainabu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities to her business like sugar,rice,tomatoes.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Zainabu hopes to save more money and expand her family

loans.use: To buy more sugar,salts,tomatoes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty – eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one daughter and two sons who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her children as she dreams to give them better future. She lives with her children in a rented apartment. She sells and distributes palm nuts from to her loyal customers. Palm nuts fruits is used to produced soap, food and many others. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Agnes has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts fruits

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda T. owns and manages a small rice field which she hopes can earn sufficient profit to meet her family's food, clothing and other basic needs.  A mother of eight children, she started helping out her husband in 1995.

Currently tilling a 3-hectare farm, she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to finance the operation of her farm, including the payment of farmer workers and purchase of farm necessities. Eda hopes to make her business flourish in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
'In God We Trust' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Moses Diggs, 41 years old, married with 3 children aged 9-12 years old. Their educational levels  are 3rd-7th grade. Moses is a high school graduate but couldn't continue his education due to lack of financial support.

Moses' business is buying used shoes wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He and his family live in Old Road, Joe Bar, south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. This community is mixed, with both poor and middle-class Liberians, but Moses happens to be a poor man.

Moses has been running this business for more than 5 years and is doing well. The location where Moses transacts business is ideal in that buyers see him before other vendors. Moses is hoping to establish a bigger store in the future so as to change the lives of himself and his family.

He needs this loan to purchase more used shoes wholesale to acquire more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes wholesale

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is a village store owner. She sold snacks called pansit (noodles) by roaming around their village until she was able to put up this store. She can now offer more commodities to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for more business development; consequently, she is now asking for additional capital from Kiva lenders, amounting to PHP 7,000.  

Jene is married to Magno, who works as an all around laborer in their village. He is a good carpenter and is often hired in their village. They have three children, all of whom are studying. Jene hopes that her business will further expand so that she will be able to provide for her children, especially when it comes to their education.

loans.use: buying more goods

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora  Martha Lorena Hererra tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la Colonia 1ro de Mayo junto con su esposo han logrado poner un estudio fotográfico el cual llevan  17 años ofreciendo sus servicios, su esposo inicio ofreciendo su fotos ambulante y ella lo apoyaba en su casa también tomando las fotografías, procreo tres hijos  de 12,18 y 19 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y estudia para cubrirse sus gastos,  por gracias a Dios han logrado tener su propia casa y ayudado a salir adelante a sus hijos, los prestamos en Afodenic han venido a mejorar su vida ya que han mejorado su tecnología, comprando las cámaras profesionales, hasta una computadora para  procesar y dar una mejor visión  a la fotografía, con este  préstamo es su quinto ciclo el cual comprara una cámara sony y cada día ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor ya que la competencia es fuerte. Su meta es para con sus hijos es poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro dándole los estudios necesarios para una vida mejor. Con esta inversión esperan atraer más clientes, vender mas su producto, y mejores ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades personales de la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena Hererra is 39 years old and she lives in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood with her husband. They have been able to open a photographic studio; they have been offering their services for 17 years. Her husband started by taking photos in the street and she helped him at home by also taking photos. They have three children, who are 12, 18, and 19 years old. The oldest studies and works to pay his expenses. Thankfully, they have been able to have their own house and help their children get ahead in life. The loans from Afodenic have helped improve their lives because they have been able to improve their technology. They purchased professional cameras and even a computer to process and improve the photos. With this loan, which is their fifth, they will buy a Sony camera so they can offer their clients the best, since there is strong competition. Their goal for their children is be able to offer them a better future by giving them the education that is necessary for a better life. With this investment they hope to attract more clients and sell more of their product, so they can have improved earnings with which to cover their family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a Sony camera so they can have higher resolution photos

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo y uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 7 años tiene una tienda que implementó en su misma vivienda, la cual está ubicada en una D. las avenidas principales D. su comunidad. Todos los días atienD. en su bodega, su esposo y su hijo también apoyan en este proyecto familiar, y en especial en estas fechas que hay mayor demanda por estar cerca D. navidad.
Este negocio le ha permitido durante estos años no depender solamente D. la pensión D. su esposo como jubilado, por lo que Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer, es por ello que siempre está al endiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa.  

Esta es la octava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy perseverante y a quien le gusta promover la unidad D. su grupo, por lo que es muy apreciada en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en mercadería para su tienda D. comestibles.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64, lives with her husband and one of her sons in her own home. For the past 7 years she has run a small grocery store from her home which is located on one of the main avenues of her community. She waits on customers every day; her husband and son also help support this family project, especially during these days when the approaching Christmas season increases demand. The business has allowed her all these years not to depend solely on her husband's retirement pension for which Teodora takes advantage of every opportunity to grow. She always wants to be on the cutting egD. of innovation to improve her store and stay active. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a persevering person who likes to promote unity in her group for which she is held in very high regard in her communal bank. The money being asked for now will be used to increase stock inventory in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
SEBASTIANA M. S., DE  72 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO “PRIMAVERA” , FORMADO POR 9 PERSONAS MAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE COLLIQUE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
ELLA TIENE 10 HIJOS, QUIENES LA APOYAN ECONÓMICAMENTE, PERO COMO SIEMPRE HA SIDO UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA, ES ASÍ QUE HACE SEIS AÑOS SE INICIÓ COMO AMBULANTE EN LA VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, CON UN PRÉSTAMO QUE SOLICITÓ AL  BANCO  COMPRÓ UNA CARRETA QUE LE SERVÍA PARA COLOCAR SUS GOLOSINAS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO PUEDE MANTENER A SUS DOS NIETOS QUIENES SE QUEDARON A SU CARGO, DEBIDO A QUE SU PADRE LOS ABANDONÓ Y LAMADRE DE LOS NIÑOS TUVOPROBLEMAS POR LOS QUE NO PUEDE HACERSE CARGO DE ELLOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA AUMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA
texts.en:
Sebastiana M. S. is 72 years old and has been a member of the communal bank “Primavera” for four years. “Primavera” is comprised of nine members who are residents of Collique in the district of Comas. Sebastiana has ten children who help support her economically, but she has always been a woman who works. This is why she began to sell sweets as an ambulatory vendor six years ago. She got started with a bank loan and bought a cart to load her sweets on. This is how she is able to maintain the two grandchildren she is taking care of, since their father abandoned them, and their mother had some problems and could not care for them. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in purchase of sweets.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Carmen N. is from the village of Bayo Iguig in Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Carmen is the leader of an 11-member group loan sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Bayo Group."

Carmen is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Carmen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. She used her previous loan to expand her business. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP to buy new items to sell. This will be Carmen's seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en:
Dionalyn M. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 25 years old. Dionalyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dionalyn owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Dionalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dionalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dionalyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is fifty five years old. She is married with a four children. Currently only two of her children are in school; the others have completed school and are working. She is a food vendor and sells waakye. Waakye is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, gallons of oil, fish, etc. to enhance her food production. It is her greatest desire to expand her food business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy raw material.

loans.name: Alinyikira Kazinga Group, Mukono

texts.en:
B. Teo is 46 years old and a single mother of eight children, who also takes care of one sibling. Teo has a retail shop in Kazinga that she has had for 4 years, plus having another business of brick laying. From her businesses, she is able to make 170,000/= as profits every week, and these help her in taking care of her family, mostly the children, and recapitalizing her businesses. She hopes to expand further in business and dreams of being able to pay her children’s school fees with much ease.

Teo is a hard-working, friendly, and determined lady and would like to buy more goods for her shop as well as securing more land for making bricks and completing payments for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop and securing more land for making bricks

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Juan, pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 58 años es conviviente de la socia Isabel  5 hijos  de 23, 21, 16, 12, 10 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, él junto a su familia lo perdió casi todo, el río arrasó con las casas, chacras, animales y todo a su pasó a esto le continuó un alud que cubrió los distritos continuos,  nuestro socio desea ahora el préstamo para volver a construir su casa e implementar con las necesidades básicas, están en espera de que sus casa sean demolidas para empezar de nuevo.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Juan, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. He is 58 years old and married to our associate Isabel. They have five children, ages 23, 21, 16, 12, and 10. He buys and sells cattle. He and his family have lost nearly everything. The [rising] river obliterated homes, ranches, animals, and everything in its path. This was followed by an avalanche that covered the entire district. Our associate is asking for a loan in order to rebuild his home and meet some basic needs. They are waiting for their home to be demolished in order to start anew. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Yhiret Group

texts.es:
Yesenia se inicio en la venta D. zapatillas por medio D. una amiga  que le enseño sobre ese tipo D. negocio, compraba  zapatillas por cantidad a menor precio y luego las ofrecía casa por casa a sus amigos y familiares ella coloca el producto con una inicial y el resto lo cobra en partes, D. esa manera obtiene mas ganancias, D. esa misma forma le empiezan a pedir ropa y otros productos. Es  así que deciD. abrir una tienda en su propia casa, luego  empieza a viajar a Trujillo por que le pedían zapatos D. buena calidad. poco a poco obtiene muchos clientes y su negocio prospera mucho lamentablemente al enfermar su hija tuvo que dejar el negocio y dedicarse a su familia después D. un tiempo ha retomado el negocio pero solo venta a domicilio y le va bien por que sus clientes están conformes, con sus ingresos ha logrado estabilidad económica a la vez que ayuda a su esposo en la construcción D. su propia casa.
Mas adelante Yesenia quiere tener un restaurante D. comidas típicas, ella estudio un curso para ser chef y le gustaría ejercer, es  para eso que ahorra por que desea  comprar un terreno  adecuado donD. poner su restaurante,  ella junto a 8 socias integra el grupo  “YHIRET” ya tiene en EDAPROSPO cerca D. 4 años y se siente feliz por el apoyo que recibe D. la entidad,  ahora usara su préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene pedidos por entregar  la época escolar es una buena oportunidad para su negocio y lo aprovechara al máximo.

* Yesenia aparece en la foto con polo rojo y pantalón azul es la sexta D. las que están sentadas.
texts.en:
Yesenia began selling sneakers thanks to a friend who taught her about that kind of business; she would buy a quantity of sneakers at a lower price and then she would offer them to friends and family by going door to door. She reserves the product with a down payment and the balance is given in payments, and in this manner she makes more profit, and in this same way they have begun to request clothing and other products. This is how she decided to open a store in her own home, and then began to travel to Trujillo because they would request good quality shoes. Little by little she gained more clients and her business prospered a lot. Unfortunately, when her daughter became ill she had to leave the business and dedicate herself to her family. After some time she has returned to the business but only in-home sales and it is going well because her clients are OK with that. With her income she has achieved economic stabilty as well as being able to help her husband with the construction of their own home. In the future Yesenia would like to have a restaurant that serves traditional food; she has taken a course to be a chef and would like to serve as one. It is for this reason that she is saving money because she wishes to buy an adequate piece of land where she can build her restaurant. She and 8 partners are members of the group “YHIRET”. She has been with EDAPROSPO for close to 4 years and is happy with the support that she has received from this entity. Now she will use her loan in order to buy clothes and sneakers since she already has orders to fulfill. The school year is a good time for her business and she will take full advantage of this time. * Yesenia appears in the photo with a red shirt and blue pants; she is the 6th person seated.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and sneakers

loans.name: Ruzinga Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Lawrence, shown in the small photo, also appears in the group photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is the married father of three and also has two dependents, under his auspices.

Lawrence sells milk in Makerere village, Ruzinga, Ibanda district, to cater for his family and himself. He has been plying his trade for the last fifteen years. Currently his business brings him close to 250,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. His longevity in this business, he says, is due to his work ethic and experienced decision making.

Lawrence’s business future plans are to expand the distribution of his milk products to cover the whole of western Uganda. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan. This loan he figures will render him that help.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Mien

texts.en: Mrs. P., 43, sells a few groceries from her store in front of her home. She became a grocery seller in early 2000 and typically earns a suitable profit. She has another family member, her husband, who is a village consultant advisor. The family always takes time to plant rice crops during the whole farming season. P. has given birth to three children. Two of the children are no longer in school and work in the construction field and one is a school-aged child. P. is taking out her loan to buy a bicycle to ride. With the rest of the loan, she will buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and more groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn Ivanna

texts.es:
Evelyn I. de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es vendedor de mercadería en una empresa aun ellos no tiene hijos. 

Evelyn y su esposo se conocieron en una tienda de recargar tintas a impresoras, cuando se casaron no podían estar juntos en las tienda por políticas de ese lugar, fue hay cuando decidieron renunciar y utilizar sus ahorros para comprar tintas y envases pastitos para vender a sus conocidos. 

Su esposo obtuvo otro trabajo y ella se quedo sola atendiendo el negocio de tintas, ella comprar los galones de tintas negras, roja y verde y los llena en envases pequeños para repartirlos de Cyber. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar más tintas y envases para tener más ingresos y poder comprar un carro con su esposo. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local de tintas en el centro de Guayaquil ya que es un lugar muy comercial.
texts.en:
Evelyn I. is 28 years old and she lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil near the Perimetral highway (a very poor area; the houses of the area are surrounded by a stream where boats pass with heavy cargo). Her husband sells merchandise at a company and they don’t have children yet. Evelyn and her husband met at a printer ink re-fill store. When they got married, they couldn’t work together at the store because of the store’s policies. So, they decided to quit and used their savings to buy ink and plastic containers to sell to people they knew. Her husband got a new job while she tented to the ink business. She buys gallons of black, red, and green ink and then fills small containers to sell them from Cyber. With this loan she wants to buy more ink and containers so she can have more income and to be able to buy a car with her husband. In the future she wants to have an ink shop in the center of Guayquil because there is a lot of commerce there.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ink and plastic containers

loans.name: Abd Alkarim

texts.en:
Abd Alkaim, a 28-year single man from Lebanon, rents a shop to provide auto and motorcycle repair services. He also buys and sells spare parts. Abd has been working in auto repair since 2008 and has eight years of experience in the industry. His main customers are friends and community members, and he is proud of the quality of service he provides, saying that his work is unmatched by other area repair shops. He decided to pursue a job in auto repair to gain experience and as a way to help support his family.

Abd notes the challenge in acquiring sufficient capital to help grow his business, which is one reason he is seeking his first loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: To help grow his business.

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthal Taen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a village bank loan consisting of seventeen people in Trapeang Krouch village in Takeo province.  The members have selected Mrs. Chanthal T. as the village bank president. 

Mrs. Chanthal T. was born in 1963. She is a farmer who owns two-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support the family.  She also breeds pigs. Her challenge is that her field has infertile soil. In order to improve production, Mrs. Chanthal T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds and pesticides.  Her husband, Mr. Van Brak, is a teacher at the local school. This couple does not have children, so they live in a three person household. 

Mrs. Ra Ten and Mrs. Run Ham are group guarantors so they are also present in the photo. All the members are shown in the picture save for one of them who is blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tufube Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
32-year-old N. Betty has given this good account of herself in her general merchandise retail shop in Bugembe, Jinja. She has made a favorable impression on her clients for the last six years with her good line of conduct and efficient business operation methods. Her reputation has gained currency as a result of her hard work and good service policy.

With the financial proceeds from her business, this happy-go-lucky married mother to eight buoyant children has, in a way, extricated herself and her family from the poverty trap that so often is commonplace in Africa. Her retail shop grew out of her earlier business – a small grocery shop that existed at the threshold of 2000.

Betty has gotten herself into a satisfactory rate of progress in her enterprise and at present she makes profits to the tune of 120,000 shillings per week. With this loan, she wants to purchase more retail items like soap, maize flour and salt.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items such as soap, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Luzminia Maria

texts.es: Luzminia Maria tiene 27 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella y que están estudiando. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, por lo que ha sido difícil. Su actividad es la compra y venta de muebles que la ha mantenido activa hasta los momentos, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar y además atender su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de de madera que es muy importante. Sueña con tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Luzminia Maria is 27 years old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her and who are studying. The location of her business is in her humble home, and that has been very difficult for her. Her business is the purchase and sale of furniture, and this has supported them until recently. Every day she gets up very early to perform her household duies and work on her business. The loan she requests is for working capital for the purchase of wood, which is very important. She hopes to attain a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en:
Tuamasaga M. is 44 and married with 5 children (ages 6-25). She owns a business venture, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup). Tuamasaga has 3 years of experience in this business. Tuamasaga needs a loan of WST$1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Tuamasaga joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tuamasaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Unity Is Strength. Group

texts.en:
Samuel S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Unity Is Strength. Samuel is 29 years old, married and has one child who is 4 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. He cares for two siblings. 

For 6 years, he has been selling jeans, trousers and skirts for gents and ladies in the Redlight Market, in Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more jeans trousers and skirts for gents and ladies.

Samuel describes himself as a quiet person. His dream is to improve his business to a point where he will be able to order goods from abroad.

 In the photo that accompanies this profile, Andrew is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more jeans trousers and skirts for gents and ladies.

loans.name: Inom

texts.en:
A. Inom is 47 years old and the father of four children. His wife is a housekeeper. Inom owns a field for cultivating watermelon and grapes in order to earn a living. He also raises cattle. 

On his plantation, Inom cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 7,000 TJS. He will use part of the loan for purchasing small cattle. Inom counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, to help him improve the living conditions of his family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy small cattle, seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah Bete

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 37 years old and married to Joseph Makau. They have four children: 14, 12, 8, and 5 years old. Sarah operates a green grocer business where she earns a monthly profit of approximately 20,800 KES. Her husband earns 9,000 KES.

She has been in this business for about twenty years. This is her first loan with Kadet. Sarah wants to use the loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for her shop. With the profit she makes, she intends to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children.

Sarah hopes to improve the business and move it to wholesale. She also hopes to educate her children to tertiary level (post-secondary).

loans.use: Buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en: Mercedez C. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Mercedez owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mercedez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Mercedez is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Merle

texts.es: Merle, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy tratable y trabajadora,  vive en su casa con su esposo y su último hijo. Después de haber  trabajado por muchos años vendiendo pescados, cambio de rubro, es así que se dedica vendiendo zapatos y prendas de vestir, en un puesto del mercado más concurrido de su barrio, que queda a 40 minutos de su casa. Desde entonces, se levanta temprano a preparar el almuerzo para que así pueda llevar su ponchera a su puesto de trabajo, en donde se queda hasta altas horas de la noche. Es así que viene trabajando muy contenta y a la vez arduamente, brindado un trato amable a cada uno de sus compradores, por la preferencia que le dan. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio, que ésta mercadería de zapato, botas y ropas; no se deterioran ni tienen fecha de caducidad y a la vez le genera buenas ganancias, a pesar de las pocas ventas en el día. Para el futuro, planea poner una tienda  de venta de productos comestibles, además desea terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar varias habitaciones para alquilarlos. Es su 25avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos de vestir ya que se acerca las campañas navideñas.
texts.en:
Merle is 53 years old and is a nice and hardworking mother.  She lives with her husband and her youngest child.  

After working for many years selling fish, she changed careers and is now selling shoes and clothing in a more crowded market in her neighborhood, which is 40 minutes from her house.  Since then, she has gotten up early to prepare lunch so she can bring it to work with her, and she works until late at night.  She is very happy with her work even when it is hard, and she treats each one of her customers well.   The thing she likes best about her business, which is a market of shoes, boots, and clothing, is that it doesn't go bad or have an expiration date.  It also generates good earnings, even with few sales a day.

In the future, she plans to open a store selling food products.  She would also like to finish building her house and fix up some of the rooms to rent them.

This is her 25th loan from MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time and is ready to do so, as she's done before.

With this loan, she will purchase dress shoes since Christmas is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of shoes

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
el sr. Felix Pedro M. O. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Jeronimo, Choluteca.
Felix se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales y horchata, compra las frutas para preparar sus refrescos.
tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Felix es padre de 4 hijos los cuales ya estan grandes y le ayudan a vender sus refrescos.
Felix se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a Choluteca  a vender sus frescos.
Felix y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas, agua, leche, azucar, colorantes y saborizantes.
texts.en:
Felix Pedro M. O. is 46 years old, he lives in the village of San Jeronimo, Choluteca. 
Felix sells natural beverages and horchata (rice water).  He purchases the fruits to make the beverages and has been making them for 8 years.
Felix is a father of 4 grown kids who help him sell his beverages; he gets up at 4AM to go to Choluteca and sell his drinks.  Felix and his wife work hard to get their family ahead and in their spare time they go to church.  The loan will be used to purchase fruits, water, milk, sugar, food coloring, and sweeteners.

loans.use: Purchase fruit, water, milk, sugar, food coloring, sweeteners, and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and phone cards

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito P. is from the village of Stimson Abordo, city of Ozamiz. She is 33 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a “sari-sari’ store selling a variety of products to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

 In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Charito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Charito from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Ozamis-Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Life can be tough, but we can be tougher. This is what Sarah M., a CCT* community partner, keeps in mind as she faces daily challenges in life owing to the fact that she reached only the third year in high school. Sarah, 61, is married to Wilfredo, a hotel driver. Together, they have raised four children, of whom one is studying while the other three are already working.  They live now in Pasay City, Philippines.

Sarah manages a "carinderia" (food stall) at her home. Every day she wakes up to cook and serve delicious, healthy meals to people in their neighborhood. She also employs two helpers to assist her in the daily operation of the "carinderia". Monthly, she earns at least Php 7,000.

To help her grow her business, Sarah would like to apply for a Php 10,000 loan, which she will use to make sure the "carinderia" is in good shape to better serve the customers. She plans to buy ingredients of quality and in large quantity to gain a reputation for excellent service. Sarah dreams of expanding the "carinderia" and putting up her own store.

Tough, complaining customers challenge Sarah as well as customers who do not pay their debts on time. But for a parent who strives to see that each child graduates from college, no tough challenge can ever be impossible to overcome.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of quality ingredients to prepare food products

loans.name: Visminda

texts.en:
Visminda A. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Visminda is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Visminda owns & operates a sari-sari store buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Visminda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Visminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & biscuits. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Visminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda V. is 43-years old married woman who supports her family by operating a: sari-sari (general) store business.  She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her  sari-sari (general) store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of 5,600 PHP.  Imelda is now borrowing 19,500 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.
