Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Imelda aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.
 
About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia nacida el 5 de febrero en Santa Cruz casada con el Sr.  Santo con 4 hijos. Vive en limoncito y trabaja en la agricultura en la Paliza a 45 km de San Luis donde tiene su parcela, toda la familia trabaja en la agricultura, viven y trabajan en la misma  parcela, son una familia muy unida que se dedican a la siembra de maíz, yuca, el diento del crédito lo utilizaran  en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y en el preparado de la tierra, una ves que cosechan sus productos, lo comercializan en el mercado de el tormo, la Sra. Celia esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Celia was born on February 5th in Santa Cruz.  She is married to Santo and has four children.  She lives in Limoncito and works as a farmer in La Paliza, 45 km from San Luis, where she has her plot of land.  All Celia's family work in farming.  They live and work on the same plot of land.  They are a very close family who grow corn and cassava.  The loan money will be used to buy seeds for growing corn and in preparing Celia's land.  Once her products are harvested, they are sold in El Tormo market.  Celia is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing corn

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a member of Race-Course group in Faulu Kenya. He joined the group so as to access loans from Faulu Kenya easily. He runs a shop where he sells spare parts. He was previously working as a mechanic. He has been running his business for ten years and hopes to expand. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy starters, alternators, distributors, and winding.

loans.use: To buy starters, alternators, distributors, and winding

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 37 years old, married and blessed with two children who go to school.  For eleven years, he has been selling vehicle spare parts so as to earn a living.  So far, he has employed two people.  Martin was previously employed in butchery and opted to go into a different business so as to earn better income.  He hopes to have a stable business in five years.  With the loan of 50,000 Kes, he will buy engine parts and suspension parts.

loans.use: To buy engine parts and suspension parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tools for work

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. T. N. is 25 years old with one child. She attended a training course on  creating hair style four years ago. Receiving our first loan in 2006, she opened a  hair salon with many services such as cutting hair, designing hair styles,  and providing other hair care services.  This salon attracts a lot of customers and creates a considerable income for her.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more hair care products to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more hair care products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 40 year-old married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 22 years old.

Flordeliza is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to the people in her community. Aside from farming, she also owns a sari-sari (general) store. Flordeliza works hard to provide for her family. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Sok Heng was born in 1952. He and wife, Mrs. Neang, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice.  They sell some of the rice and they use the rest to support their family.  They are chicken and duck breeders. Through these activities they support four children.  One is a laborer,  two are seamstresses in garment factories, and the other one is studying in the local public school. 

At present, he is facing the problem of his children’s work places being far away from their home. So Mr. Sok Heng is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his children's transportation to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is from the village of Purok De Oro, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Mary is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mary owns & operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as steamed cakes (or siopao) in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mary joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & fund working capital.

Mary is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs nd ground meat. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients needed to make food for sale

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nthambi

texts.en:
Nthambi N. is married to Jimmy and they do not have any children yet. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years and earns an income of KES.17,000 in a month.

Nthambi is applying for her fourth loan which she intends to use to buy a new stock of goods like bar soaps, bags of washing powder, sugar, cooking oil and flour for resale. With the anticipated profits she will reinvest in her business.

In the future Nthambi desires to grow her business and own a big shop. She is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy bar soaps, bags of washing powder , sugar,cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella lives in the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a general store and earns about 3,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 7,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna comes from village of Zeniti, Adjara Region, West Georgia. He is 37 years old, unmarried, and lives with his mother, who is 57, and his father, who is 60. 

The family earns a living with agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell dairy products at the local market. Also they grow citrus and maize on their plot of land. Most of the harvested corn is used in the dairy farm and the other part is sold at the local market. Citrus is also sold locally. The average monthly income of the family is 600 Georgian laris. 

With the requested credit Datuna purchased a mini tractor. He will use it in his citrus farm and will cut his costs on tilling, as won't have to rent a tractor any more. Also he will be able to offer tilling services to  neighboring farms, earning additional income. 

In the future Datuna plans to save for the expansion of his dairy farm by purchasing additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor for the farm

loans.name: Dossou Gérard

texts.fr: Dossou Gérard est né le 18 Novembre 1976 au Bénin  et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Mariette. Dossou Gérard a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Dossou Gérard a un autre enfant à sa charge. Dossou Gérard et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Dossou Gérard a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire puis a appris la coiffure, activité qu'il exerce depuis une douzaine d'année. Dans le but de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l'acquisition de matériels de coiffure et de produits cosmétiques, Dossou Gérard  sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Dossou Gérard de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Dossou Gérard a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Dossou Gérard was born on November 18, 1976 in Benin and is married to a hair stylist called Mariette. he has 3 children, some of whom go to school. As well as his own children, he is responsible for one other child. Doussou Gérard and his wife live together with their children, and together they take care of the family's expenses. 

Doussou Gérard left school at the secondary level and learned hair styling, which he has been involved in for around 12 years.  In order to better equip his salon by obtaining styling equipment and beauty products, Doussou Gérard is asking for a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow him to better meet the needs of his customers. The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and beauty products

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: From Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, Mr. Lun is a 39-year-old man who has been spending most of his lifetime in the farming business. He and his wife always plant various crops to earn a living and typically generate an income of $8.75 per day. They have been married for many years and are blessed with two single children. One of the children assists them in the crop-planting business when they have time from their studies. Since the rainy season is coming, Mr. Lun will be using the loan that he requested to buy fertilizers and seed for planting. With the rest of the loan, he will buy some fish paste to stock up for future sales. Note: Mr. Lun, his wife and their young son were taken in a photo under their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fish paste

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene como principal actividad económica la elaboración y venta de chocolates artesanales, los que comercializa en la ciudad de Cochabamba, el Sr. Juan comenzó con esta actividad hace tres años, con un pequeño capital, ahora este trabajo es el sustento principal de su familia, el vive en la zona de pasankeri con sus dos hijos y regresa solo a medio año y a final de año. Es cliente de la institución desde el año 2007 y siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos, don Juan compra con el dinero del crédito el chocolate por kilo y los demás insumos por caja, elabora frutillas y mashmelos bañados con chocolate y los vende a un precio económico, trabaja toda la familia en distintos puntos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, así logran tener más ingresos. El señor Juan  en un corto plazo piensa en terminar de construir su domicilio para dar mayor comodidad a su familia cuando se encuentren en la ciudad de la paz.
texts.en:
Juan makes chocolate sculptures which he sells in Cochabamba.  He started doing this three years ago with a little capital.  Now this work provides the principal support for his family.  He lives in the Pasankeri zone with his two children and returns only mid-year and at the end of the year.  He’s been working with the institution since 2007 and has always proven to be punctual and responsible with his payments.

Juan buys chocolate by the kilo and the rest of his supply by the box.  He makes chocolate covered fruit snacks and marshmallows and sells them for low prices. The whole family works in different parts of Cochabamba and in this way they can generate more income.  Juan plans to finish building his house soon, so that his family will be more comfortable when they are in La Paz.

loans.use: to buy chocolate in bulk

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina has received a senior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a tailor.

The picture above shows Philomina selling oranges, fante kenkey, and loaves of bread at Takoradi. Her business is approximately 5 years old. Because the price of maize keeps increasing, her loan will be used to buy sacks of maize so that she can make more kenkey. She hopes to use the additional profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To make more kenkey by purchasing additional sacks of maize.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее сын рабтает кредитным офицером в микрафинасовой организации. Сама Мавлуда имеет высшее образование. Она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. В этой области она работает 15 лет. Кроме того сейчас Мавлуда у себя дома строит магазин. Она берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания и приобретения холодильника, чтобы продавать молочные продукты.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her son is a credit official at a micro-financing organization. Mavluda herself has a bachelors degree and currently works in retail: she owns a grocery store and has managed it for 15 years. Currently Mavluda is remodeling her house to open another store. She is taking out this loan to purchase additional groceries in bulk as well as a fridge so that she can sell milk and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries and a refrigerator

loans.name: Irene Amarilis

texts.es:
Irene Amarilis tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Irene se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productor en el local de Agro Insumos María y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Irene Amarilis is 25, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank San Jacinto is located in the parish of San José del Tambo in the Chillanes canton.  The members of this group make a living through agriculture, mainly by growing corn, cacao, plantains, and oranges.  They also raise animals.

Irene is dedicated to agriculture and grows corn, cacao, plantains, and oranges.  She also raises animals.  She buys her supplies at the María Agro-Supplies store and sells her products at the San José del Tambo market on the weekends. 

She is requesting this loan to buy manure, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea, and liquids to avoid having her crops get pests and to keep them in good condition.  She will also buy food for her animals that she raises to later sell them at a better price.

This loan will support her to supplement her economic needs and to improve the quality of her products and agricultural activities.  She faces challenges like falling prices for the products that she sells as well as the middlemen.  Her dream is to be able to buy land so she can plant a little more and obtain get more utility for the well-being of her family. 

She is known for being an honorable an very responsible person.  She is punctual with her payments.  She likes to go out for drives or walks, and she likes celebrations, especially Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, supplies, fertilizer, urea, liquids, and food for her animals

loans.name: La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the group called La Fe 3 & 4, "Faith". This group is located in the city of Samana, in a rural community surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. These 10 entrepreneurs are running their businesses in their community or in others nearby. 

Juana makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and their two children. This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start up a business and with her first loan she started clothing sales. After six loans she has expanded her business into a grocery store. She has had her business for almost three years.

Juana is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to proviD. her family with their needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Beatriz fue amante a la música y así descubrió su talento como cantante desde entonces se ha dedicado a cantar como una forma de generar ingresos para su hogar, desde sus comienzos hace 14 años se ha sentido una mujer afortunada por tener un negocio propio el cual le ha permitido estar al pendiente de sus 3 hijos, ya que trabaja sólo fines de semana y eventos especiales.

Hoy a sus 48 años de edad le apasiona su trabajo, por lo cual procura hacerlo con la mayor calidad posible, es este el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo, ya que debe comprar un micrófono de mejor calidad ya que en los eventos los clientes acostumbran a coger sus herramientas de trabajo y no le dan el mejor uso, ella debe estar constantemente haciéndole mantenimiento a su micrófono y esto cuesta bastante dinero, Beatriz no cuenta con ese capital necesario para comprar el micrófono y pagar el mantenimiento, y espera poder recibir el crédito ya que así podrá asegurar un mejor servicio, sus ingresos se incrementarán y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida mejorará.
texts.en:
Ever since she was very young, Beatriz has been a music lover and that is how she discovered her talent as a singer. Since then, she has been singing as a way of getting an income for her home. Since she first started, 14 years ago, she has felt like a very fortunate woman for having her own business. Her business allows her to devote herself to her three children, because she works only on weekends and special events.
Today, at the age of 48, she is passionate about her work, which is why she strives to perform with the highest possible quality. That is the reason why she requests a loan, since she must purchase a microphone of better quality, because during events, her customers are used to taking her work instruments and not giving them the best use. She has to constantly do maintenance on her microphone and that costs a lot of money. Beatriz does not have the capital that is necessary to purchase the microphone and pay for its maintenance. She hopes to get the loan because that way she will ensure a better service, increase her profits and, in proportion, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a microphone and do maintenance on her work instruments.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Don Fermín vive  una  localidad muy bonita ya que celebran la fiesta del santo domingo y san marcos y es muy apreciado por las ferias de ese lugar, el es casado con  la señora Teodelinda  con  quien procreo un hijo que ya está casado.
 
   El solicito el préstamo o para invertirlo en la compra de  madera para la elaboración de muebles, en donde lleva practicando veinte  años en la que le va bien  ya que ha visto mucha mejoría en su  trabajo que  tanto le gusta realizar.
 
    Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  desde muy pequeño ya que su padre también se dedicaba a  lo mismo y decido practicar lo mismo ya que vio que es un buen negocio que da resultado y gracias a dios le va bien.

    Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo pueda incrementar mas su negocio y salir adelante con su esposa que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
Don Fermín lives in a very pretty area where they celebrate the Fiestas of Santo Domingo and San Marcos.  He is very appreciative of these festivals that take place here.  He is married to Señora Teodelinda, with whom he has one son, who is himself married.

He is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing some wood for making furniture.  He has been doing this work for nearly 20 years, and it's going very well for him. He has seen great improvement in his work, which makes him very happy to do it.

His inspiration for this activity began when he was very young, as his father also worked in this field.  He decided to practice it himself as he saw that it was a good business which would give results, and thanks be to god, go well for him.

What he most wants is to increase his business further though his efforts and the loan, and to move forward in life with his wife.  She is the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 58 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
To earn a living, Tessie has a snack business selling items such as puto (filipino rice cake shaped like american muffin), conchinta, hotcake and suman. She earns about PHP 1000 each month doing this type of work. Tessie has requested a loan of 14,900 to  purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Tessie would like to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed. He is married and his spouse is a trader whose income is 200,000 SLL every month. He has no children.   

In 2006, Mohamed inherited his electronics business. He began his business because he lost his father when he was in form III/grade 10. His elder brother asked him to assist him doing business. After a year his elder brother died and he took over the business.  

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,368,000 SLL every month from this business.   

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to purchase the following: tapes (6 batteries) 10 @ 125,000 SLL, tapes (4 batteries) 6 @ 55,000 SLL, tapes (10 batteries) 3 @ 250,000 SLL, radios 25 @ 47,000 SLL, digital radios 10 @ 60,200 SLL, radios (mps) 5 @ 75,000 SLL. The balance of 18,000 SLL will be used for labor.  

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.  

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house and educate his children yet unborn. His feeling about taking this loan is that he can get more income and business will grow. This loan will help him to achieve his future plans. He serves 12 customers each day.  His business is popular because of his good customer care. He is hard-working and trustworthy. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his electronics business.

loans.name: Jafarkhan

texts.en:
Jafarkhan is a 59-year-old trader who sells products very popular for usage as dowries. He sells kettles, electronic goods, tableware and other items that are very popular among fiances. He has six years of experience in this field. His monthly income from his business is 200 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN).  

Jafarkhan is married and has five children. His son helps him to sell products. 

Now he would like to diversify his range of  merchandise, and for this purpose, he applied for 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to cover market demand.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  She sells food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan, which she has been doing for six years.

Christine is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase sugar and cassava to sell. The extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Three years ago, Martha came to the United States from Colombia to find a better education and future for her children. Knowing how independent and motivated she was, she knew she would start a business in the US. With her savings, she decided to buy a cleaning service franchise because it would be a perfect fit for her and she would still have time to dedicate to her family. In 2010, Martha received a loan from Kiva partner Accion USA, which helped her grow the business. She now has three part-time employees and hopes to expand by starting another cleaning service at a different location.
Martha’s second loan from Accion USA will enable her to sign a new cleaning contract with a major local company as well as buy new cleaning supplies.
Martha says, “My vision for the future is to continue being an enthusiastic entrepreneur, to find more success in my work, and remain a good mother to my children."

loans.use: to pay for new cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé  de 42 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse et ont ensemble 03enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 14ans et le dernier 06ans.
Kodjo travaille comme tailleur et revendeur de matériaux d’électricité depuis 2001. Il vend seul à la maison et sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Kodjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin de répondre plus à la demande de la population.
Dans les prochaines années, Kodjo voudrait agrandir en ajoutant d’autre activités. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille bien éduquée et heureuse.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a 42-year-old man, married to a retail merchant. They have three children who attend school: the eldest is 14 and the youngest is six years old.

Kodjo has been working as a tailor and dealer of electrical products since 2001. He sells by himself from his home and says his main difficulty is the competition.

Kodjo is requesting his first WAGES credit loan to purchase more goods. He wants to reinvest in the business in response to the population's requests

In coming years, Kodjo wants to expand by adding other activities. He said that with the profits he expects to have a well-educated and happy family.

loans.use: Buy electrical products

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Rosa Beatriz; La socia tiene tiene aún su terreno de cultivo de maíz, y tiene algunos animales vacunos, la socia también continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pescado, pollo, la socia desea invertir su credito en la compra de pollos para criar y en la venta.
texts.en: The borrower, Mrs. Rosa Beatriz, is still growing corn and raising cattle on her land.  She also continues to buy and sell fish and chicken.  With the loan she will buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Gloria Elida

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Gloria tiene 34 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 18, 11 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un camión de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Gloria se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito), actividad que la realiza hace 12 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne, salchichas, papas, cebolla, aceite, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the communal bank Cristo del Consuelo. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is part of the December 1999 Cultural Heritage of Humanity. It’s a city that’s a mix of colonial and modern, where the people observe the culture and traditions of their parents. 

Gloria is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has had 3 children who are 18, 11, and 5 years old. Her oldest son works to support himself, and her last two children study in a small school in the city. Her spouse is a chauffeur and works by hiring out his services in a van that he owns. They don’t have their own home and for that reason rent. 

Gloria sells chuzos (meat on a stick). She’s been in this business for 12 years, and she work from Monday to Saturday from 4 in the afternoon until 7 at night. 

She’s been a member of the bank for 3 years, and she will invest her new loan into the purchase of meat, sausage, potatoes, onions, oil, etc for her business. 
 
Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausage, potatoes, onions, oil, etc

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad, casado con Teofilo de 46 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. JUntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Tarancato del distrito de Pichari. Rosa es una madre luchadora que dio todo por el bienestar de sus menores hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de café y cacao que se encuentra ubicado a media hora de camino de su comunidad. Ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo de manera coordinada, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requiere de personales para que le puedan facilitar en la recolección de sus frutos. Rosa está contenta con esta labor que realiza, porque en estos últimos años su producto le esta dando buenos ingresos económicos, por lo que podría construir su vivienda de material noble, en un lote propio. Este seerá su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está feliz y contenta con su banco comunal por que todos son buenos trabajadores y solidarios. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, is married to Teofilo, 46 and they have four children.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Tarancato in Pichari District.

Rosa is a tenacious mother who gave everything for her minor children’s wellbeing.  She grows coffee and cocoa beans on fields located half an hour from her community.  She works in a coordinated way alongside her husband but during harvesting she always needs extra staff to help facilitate picking the fruit.  Rosa is happy with the work she does because in the last few years the products have been generating good income which allowed her to build her house out of substantial building materials on a lot of her own.

This will be her second MFP loan and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She’s happy and content with her communal bank because all of them are good, supportive workers.  She will use the 2000 new soles to provide maintenance to her fields for which she will hire day laborers.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman, and she has five children. She describes herself to be God fearing. 

Lydia operates a retail business where she sells dried fish (omena type). She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Lydia will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a big fish supplier within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his butcher business, which deals in meat.

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more animals, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and improve his business. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his income.

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more animals for his butcher's shop..

loans.name: Juana America

texts.en:
My name is Juana M.. I make and sell tortillas. My daughter helps me with the packing and sales. I’ve had my business for five years. With my income, I am able to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to have a higher production, so I can remodel my store, and provide better education to my daughter.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, salt, lime, water, wood, matches, charcoal.

Mi nombre es Juana M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo la ayuda de mi hija para el empacado y venta del producto terminado, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, este me genera ingresos para sustentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y darle un mejor estudio a mi hija.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, agua, leña, fosforos, carbon.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh's husband has died, and she must support her 4 children. Unfortunately the youngest one, Nghia, just 7, is mentally retarded. Trung, the eldest, stopped going to school to take care for his little brother.

Linh is running a small shop with a daily profit of almost 1$. When she can she also makes bamboo baskets, which brings an additional 70 cents/day.

loans.use: 50$ to increase the capital of her little shop

loans.name: Oishahon

texts.en:
Oishahon has been trading at the central market for several years. Her business is small, but it gives good income. In summer she and her daughters deal with processing fruits and vegetables. Vegetables and fruits are cheap at that time and the cost of canned ones is low. In the winter period, all these things are brought to the market and income from the sale is enough for their life, more or less.

Near to spring, canned products have been sold out and the time of young spring greens begins. At this time, Oishahon goes over to selling greens. Her daughters help her.

She spent the first loan she received ($ 300) to buy vegetables for sale. She is working seriously with MicroInvest and intends to continue working with them.

Oishahon hopes to receive another loan and spend it to buy glass jars for the new season of processing fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase of glass jars

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Srey Mao has been married for 16 years and has 3 children. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor when she was 15 years old. Then, she started making her living by weaving silk. Her husband is currently serving as a police officer in the local commune. He has been a policeman for more than 6 years. One of their children is a construction worker in the commune.

Srey Mao has requested a loan of $150 from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread. She is able to earn enough to support her family and repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread

loans.name: Aliakbar

texts.en:
Mr. Aliakbar S. lives on a low income, which is vulnerable to the local economy. He is 40, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Mr. S. owns and operates a mini shop in the Saatli town. But, as you see in the picture, the inventory he has is very limited and he has no opportunity to diversify his assortment of goods to sell. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro, Saatli branch, for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Thomasa is involved in a personal struggle to move her life forward, and today she is realising her dream with the help of her husband, who has always helped her in everything she does and with the things she likes, namely decoration. Ever since she was small she used to draw attention to the arrangement that were made for weddings and girls’ fifteenth birthday parties that she used to attend.

After her marriage, they asked her to be to be the “protector of the wine glass” (a Mexican wedding tradition). She decorated the cup and they liked it some much that the people ordered one for the following month. Her business thus grew by word of mouth and as a result of the good work she delivered, she began to have more and more customers.

Unfortunately, this business is seasonal, and at the moment it has been a long time since any orders were placed and as a result she withdrew capital from the business. However, she has just received an order and as a result she needs a loan in order to be able to push forward and return to the business with greater force. Tomasa needs a credit of $750 USD which she intends to pay back within six months. With your help Tomasa will be able to buy more and better quality merchandise in order to be able to offer her products at a price which will provide her with greater profits and as a result her house will no longer lack anything.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Tomasa lucha por sí misma, para salir adelante, y hoy ve realizado su sueño, con ayuda de su esposo, quien siempre la ha apoyado en todo lo que ella hace y en lo que a ella le gusta, la decoración. Desde pequeña le llamaban la atención todos los arreglos que hacían para las bodas y las fiestas de 15 años a los que asistía.

Después de casada le pidieron ser madrina de copa, y ella la decoró, le gustó tanto a la gente que le hicieron un pedido para el siguiente mes. Y así se fue pasando la voz y con los buenos trabajos que realiza comenzó a tener más y más clientes.

Desgraciadamente, este negocio no es constante, en este momento lleva largo tiempo sin tener pedidos por lo tanto se descapitalizó, sin embargo le acaban de hacer un pedido y por lo tanto necesita un crédito para poder sacarlo adelante y volver con más fuerza a este negocio. Tomasa necesita un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Tomasa podrá comprar más mercancía y de mejor calidad para poder ofrecer sus productos a un precio que le rinda más a ella y así en su casa no falte nada.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nyai

texts.en: Nyai is 32 years old and a mother of a child, aged 15. Together with her husband Wawan, she has been running her business by collecting and selling waste and scrap materials. They also sell spare parts and usually earn US $20 per day. She needs a loan to expand her business by completing her inventory, so that she can sell more goods and earn more income. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru:
Amonullo H., who is 52, has high school education, is married and has 6 children. Amonullo has been in the business of selling fuels and lubricants in his home village Havobod during the past 15 years. Since the oil prices are on the rise, he is planning to purchase a large amount of fuels and lubricants for future sales. Because during the winter months in the most distant areas of the village, the electricity is only available for a few hours, residents are using kerosine lamps for that purpose. This loan will give local people an opportunity to purchase benzine and kerosine for lighting and heating of their houses. Amonullo is planning to repay his loan over the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Амонулло, возраст – 52 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Амонулло занимается продажей горюче-смазочных материалов у себя дома, в кишлаке Навобод, уже в течение 15 лет. Так как цены на бензин ежедневно растут, на полученный кредит он хочет приобрести большое количество горюче – смазочоных материалов для дальнейших их реализации.. Так как в зимнее время в дальних районах подача электоэнергии производится по несколько часов и основным источником является керосиновые лампы, жители кишлаков получат возможность приобретать бензин и керосин для освещения и обогрева своих жилищ. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ni Ketut Winastri

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Winastri and her husband live in a village. Her husband, I Made Weneh is an elementary school teacher. They have three children. The oldest works in Denpasar. The other two are still in elemantary school. Ni Ketut Winastri raises one sow from piglet. Now the sow has nine 3-weeks-old piglets. Ni Ketut Winastri borrows from Dinari for 3,600,000 IDR (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). She spent 1,500,000 IDR for constructing a more permanent shed. Prior to that Ni Ketut Winastri raised the hog in a much traditional way, by tying it to a tree. The rest is spent for another hog for 300,000 IDR and animal feed. The nine piglets are sold after 2 month old for a total of 2,430,000 IDR. She spent 500,000 IDR for animal feed so she netted 1,930,000 IDR each time she harvests.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Winastri dan suaminya tinggal di desa . Suaminya, I Made Weneh, seorang guru SD. Ni Ketut Winastri memiliki 3 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah bekerja di Denpasar. Dan 2 anaknya lagi masih bersekolah di SD. Ni Ketut Winastri memelihara 1 induk yang dipelihara dari mulai kecil hingga sudah besar dan menghasilkan. Sekarang induk babi Ni Ketut Winastri sudah memiliki 9 ekor anak yang baru berumur 3 minggu. Ni Ketut Winastri meminjam modal dari Dinari Rp. 3.600.000.- Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp.1.500.000.- sehingga kandang babinya lebih permanen dengan atap genteng, sebelumnya Ni Ketut Winastri memelihara secara tradisional di ikat dipohon. Sisanya untuk membeli calon induk babi seharga Rp. 300.000.- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan induk dan anaknya. Setelah berumur 2 bulan, 9 ekor anak babi dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp. 2.430.000.- Untuk biaya pakan menghabiskan Rp. 500.000.- jadi keuntungan bersih Rp. 1.930.000.- per panen. .

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and piglets

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat I. is 47-year-old mother of five children in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past five years, Malohat has run a children's clothing business with her family. They sew the clothing and sell them in nearby cities and even Uzbekistan, a country that neighbors Tajikistan.

Malohat is requesting a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to purchase more fabric and other goods. Because the profits are her family's main source of income, she hopes to expand her business. Because Malohat is a hard worker and has an excellent credit history, she's certain she will be able to pay the loan back within three months.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and goods for a children's clothing business

loans.name: Sayu Putu Narmi

texts.id:
Income of a farmer is not certain. It is not daily or monthly, but depends on the yield resulted. That’s why, Sayu Putu Narmi, a wife of a farmer, is required to help her husband to fulfill their family’s daily needs. She uses her skill to sew that she got before she got married to open a tailor. She deployed Rp 1,000,000 as the initial capital to purchase a sewing machine and several pieces of cloths. She started by sewing “kebaya” and “kamen” as ordered by the customers. With limited capital, Sayu Putu Narmi only earn small income, which can only be used for buying kitchen supplies. Even though they oly have one child, they need more than Rp 20,000 a day for living.

Usually, Sayu Putu Narmi receives more orders before Galungan and Kuningan celebration. She sometimes has to refuse orders because she does not have enough resource to purchase clothes, for the costumer do not want to bring their own, but to purchase from Sayu Putu Narni. Fortunately, Dinari Foundation is willing to help by giving loan that enable Sayu Putu Narni purchase more materials so she is able to provide clothes with various color and printing. With the loan, Sayu Putu Narni hopes that her business can be improved, that she can hope for increased income she can save for her future.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Mempunyai suami petani tentu saja penghasilannya tidak menentu ,karena pengasilan petani tidak bisa setiap hari atau setiap bulan,ini tergantung dari panen berhasil atau tidak.Oleh sebab itu Sayu Putu Narmi dituntut bisa menambah pendapatan keluarga makanya ketrampilan yang dibawanya sebelum menikah bisa diterapkan setelah Sayu Putu Narmi menikah. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.000.000 ,Sayu Putu Narmi memulai usahanya sebagai seorang penjahit,dengan membeli 1 buah mesin jahit dan beberapa lembar kain,ia membuat baju kebaya maupun kamen jadi sesuai dengan pesanan masyarakat. Dengan modal yang sedikit tentu saja keuntungan yang didapat juga sedikit dan itu hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Walupun hanya mempunyai satu orang anak ,namun biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup banyak yaitu Rp.20.000 hanya untuk dapur saja,belum keperluan yang lainnya. Biasanya usaha Sayu Putu Narmi akan ramai saat menjelang hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan,Sampai ia tidak mampu melayani pelanggan karena kekurangan modal untuk membeli bahan baku seperti kain kebaya atau kamen,karena yang menjahit tidak mau membawa sendiri,dan langsung membeli kain pada Sayu Putu Narmi. Untunglah Yayasan Dinari membantu memberikan pinjaman modal sehingga Sayu Putu Narmi bisa tetap menjalankan usahanya dan sekarang bisa menyediakan kain dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak dengan motif dan warna yang beragam.Dengan pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Yayasan Dinari Sayu Putu Narmi berharap usahanya semakin ramai dan berkembang,sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh menjadi meningkat, karena Sayu Putu Narmi rindu untuk bisa menebung sebagai bekal di hari tua nanti.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and equipments for tailor business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna is married and lives in the Hialeah, Stage IV neighborhood of Managua. She's 52 years old and has five children, all of whom work and send money home. Her husband is a prison guard and also contributes to the family's expenses. Reyna is a housewife but her husband and children pitch in to maintain the house and pay daily expenses.

With the loan, she wants to build a 12-meter long wall. For the future, she hopes to improve her house for the good of all the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Reyna es casada y vive en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa, tiene 52 años de edad y procreo cinco hijos, los cuales todo trabajan y importan a los gastos de la familia. Su esposo es Celador y también aporta a su familia. La Sra. Reyna es ama de casa pero todos sus hijos y esposo aportan los gastos del hogar y las necesidades cotidianas. Con el préstamo desea construir un muro de 12 mts, de lineales, a futuro espera construir mejor su casa para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Nusurat

texts.en: Nusurat I. lives at Isheri Olofin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells baby clothing, and she has been in this business since the year 2006. She is 25 years old and married with a child. Nusurat sells her products door to door. This is not an easy task, as she has to take her baby along with her. She is, however, determined and enthusiastic to succeed in her business. She is asking for the loan of $425 to buy more baby clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baby items to sell

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa T., 25, is married with two children.  She's the mother of two sons, her husband resides in NZ and sends money to help her support their sons. She has 4 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the passin traffic 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~$145 USD). SPBD loans are Orepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Orepa would like to purchasing a new canoe, torch, spear and more fishing gears.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hard working businessman. He is 43 years old and married with two kids. He sells bananas and fresh eggs. He buys his supplies from Volta in the south eastern part of Ghana and from poultry farms around Tema. He enjoys his trade very much but the prices of his commodities and transport have gone up due to the current fuel crisis. This has rendered his capital inadequate so he can't purchase appreciable quantities to sell. He therefore needs the loan to inject additional capital into his business so he meet the demands of the market. He wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of bananas and fresh eggs for an increased profit. Richard hopes to increase savings to pay for his kids education. He is a member of the community group called Platinum Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supply of banana and fresh eggs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. sells foodstuffs like garri, a tapioca like food made from cassava, cocoa yams and vegetables. She has been in this business for a long time. Regina is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She is a LAPO client. Regina is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sale  for business expansion and for profit maximization.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alicia tiene 43 años de edad. Esta en pareja y juntos tienen 3 hijos, todos menores y cursan la educación escolar básica.
La sra. Alicia posee una despensa en un populoso barrio, esta actividad tiene hace 3 años.
Se inció con la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, solo lo necesario para el día a día, poco a poco fue ampliando hasta llegar a ser una despensa con variedad de productos y precios, ya cuenta con clientela formada.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como: azúcar,yerba,arroz,panificados,fideos,bebidas en general y otros.
texts.en:
Alicia is 43 years old, married, with 3 children, all young and in elementary school. Alicia has owned a convenience store in a very populated neighborhood for 3 years. She began selling basic needs products, items needed day to day, and little by little she expanded evolving in to a convenience store with a variety of products and prices, with a well-established customer base. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as: sugar, tea, rice, baked goods, noodles, beverages and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise such as: sugar, tea, rice, baked goods, noodles, beverages and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timbers to repair her house.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem H. is a villager in Trapaing Tra Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. Her husband, Mr. San Phany, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. She is 56 years old and the mother of seven children.  Three help their mother in the current business while two others are farmers. The remaining two children are laborers. Her husband is presented on the left of this photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Né en 1978 dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur S. Koami est un menuisier de renommé qui est sollicité par beaucoup de gens et même les entreprises et établissements installés dans le milieu. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il arrive difficilement à satisfaire leurs besoins à cause de ses moyens financiers très limités.
Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients qui ne cessent de le solliciter, il demande un financement pour acheter des bois et des planches dans les grands champs de production, ce qui lui coûterait moins chères. Ceci lui permettra de fabriquer des meubles à vendre et de vite répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Vo Prefecture, Mr. Koami S. is a renowned cabinet-maker who is in demand by many people and even commercial enterprises established in the area. He is married and the father of four children, whose needs he has a difficult time meeting due to very limited financial means. To satisfy his ever-demanding customers better, he is asking for financing to buy wood and planks from the major producer areas, where the prices would be cheaper. This will enable him to make furniture to sell and to meet the demands of his customers quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and planks to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa propia que ellos poseen. Ella administra su propio negocio de transporte desde hace 8 meses, le costó mucho esfuerzo poder tener su propio bus, la ruta que cubre abarca casi toda la ciudad, por lo que asegura la afluencia de pasajeros, el trabajo es todos los días, durante todo el día, para ello ha contratado a un chofer y en ocasiones ella misma es quien cobra los pasajes. La responsabilidad de Ana es mantener su carro en perfectas condiciones, para lo cual, lo lleva constantemente al taller mecánico para un mantenimiento periódico. Esta actividad le ha permitido ser un sostén más en su casa y ayudar a su mamá en la economía, además que considera que esta actividad es rentable y no tiene pierde, puesto que siempre existen personas que necesitan de este servicio. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque han visto en ella la responsabilidad con que maneja sus propios ingresos en beneficio de su casa. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en el mantenimiento mecánico que le harán a su movilidad para que trabaje en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Ana is 28-years-old, single and lives with her mother and siblings in the home that they own. She has run her own transportation business for 8 months, which requires a lot of effort to be able to have her own bus. The route that she covers spans almost the entire city so that she can ensure a large number of passengers. The job is all day, everyday. For that reason she has hired a driver and on occasion she she covers the routes herself. Ana’s responsibility is to maintain her bus in the perfect condition. For this she consistently takes it to a mechanic for periodic maintenance.

This activity has permitted Ana to be more of a support in her home and to help her mother economically. Additionally she considers this activity to be profitable and to have low risk for money loss because there are always people who will need her service. It is the first time that she asks for a loan with MFP. She was invited to form part of her communal bank because they had seen in her the responsibility with which she conducts her own business to benefit her home. The solicited loan will be invested in the maintenance of her bus so that she may work in perfect conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance of her bus

loans.name: Pazzy

texts.es:
La señora Pazzy pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Brisas” , vive en Jr. Bolognesi 7ma cuadra, distrito y provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 1 hija mayor de edad que no depende de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros y motos. Pazzy con el primer prestamo recibido de S/ 300.00 decide empezar un negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas en el mercado. Tiene 3 ciclos con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño local en su propia casa  de venta de refrigerios, lo que le permite generar ingresos para pagar el prestamo puntualmente.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1, 500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara gaseosas de todos los tamaños y sabores, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, harina etc. Para la preparación de sus refrigerios que vende a todos los trabajadores de su cuadra y transeúntes.

Pazzy esta muy contenta con el banco ya que le permite tener amistades y realizar lo que siempre quiso desde su juventud.
texts.en:
Pazzy belongs to “Las Brisas” (“Breezes”) Community Bank and lives in the Bellavista district of San Martín. She is 63 years old and the mother of one grown daughter. She lives with her partner, who sells spare parts for cars and motorcycles.

This is Pazzy's third loan. With her first loan, of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95), she decided to start a business selling soft drinks in the local market. Now, she has a small shop in her home where she sells snacks. The steady income from her shop will enable her to repay her loan on time.

With this loan, of 1,500 nuevos soles (US $475), she will buy a variety of soft drinks, one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, flour, and other ingredients necessary to prepare the snacks that she sells to the workers on her block and other passersby.

Pazzy is very happy with her association with the bank, not only for the new friends she has made but also because it has helped her to realize dreams she has had since her youth.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of soft drinks, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, flour, and other ingredients necessary to prepare snacks

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is a 27-year-old man living in Hay el Selloum in the Beirut suburbs. He is specialized in IT and computer repair in addition to his full-time job as an office helper. Marwan wants a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy new hardware and expand his passion.

loans.use: Buy new hardware

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Felicitas  es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos. Felicitas tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, además tiene un puesto de verduras en el mercado 12 de Abril, mientras que su esposo tiene un taxi con el cual realiza transporte.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y mercadería para su tienda.
El sueño de Felicitas es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Felicitas is married, is 38 years of age and has 4 children. Felicitas has a store in her house where she sells groceries and also has a vegetable stand in the 12 de Abril market. Her husband has a taxi with which he provides transportation. Felicitas needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and merchandise for her store. Felicitas' dream is for her children to advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Marlene del Socorro R. es una muy reconocida dama en su localidad del municipio de Chichigalpa porque se ha destacado en la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales son elaboradas por ella y son muy vendidas ya que a sus clientes les agrada mucho.

Una necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Marlene es que requiere de la compra de maíz, cal, leña y carbón para la elaboración de las tortillas y por esto ella espera en Ceprodel ya que ha solicitado un crédito para continuar con la elaboración de dichas tortillas en su municipio.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro R. is very well-known in her town in the municipality of Chichigalpa because of her tortillas, which she makes and sells to her satisfied customers. A difficulty that Marlene is currently going through is that she need more capital to buy corn, mineral lime, firewood and coal for her tortilla production. For this reason she waits to hear back from Ceprodel, as she has requested a loan to continue making her famous tortillas in her municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Maï Astou

texts.fr: La dame Maï Astou S. est âgée de 52 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de mil, d’arachide et de haricot. Les revenus générés vont lui permettre d’assurer de meilleurs conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maï Astou S., 52, sells millet, peanuts, and dried beans. The revenue generated by this little business will allow her to ensure better living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling millet, peanuts, and dried beans

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est propriétaire d’un magasin d’alimentation générale à Wome. Agé de 26 ans, Kokou est marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements du précédent crédit ont été bien exécutés. Kokou désire avec accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Kokou A. owns a grocery store in Wome. At 26, Kokou is married and the father of a little boy. He is on his second loan and the repayments on the first loan were made in a timely manner. Kokou wants to expand his business by buying more merchandise for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying inventory for his general store

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
En instance de divorce et mère d’un enfant, Madame Salimata D. a 34 ans. Elle vit actuellement chez ses parents dans le quartier Kouloukoro de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région du Mali)
N’ayant pas eu la chance de continuer ses études primaires par manque de moyen de ses parents, Salimata n’a pas pris du temps à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Salimata évolue seule maintenant  depuis 10 ans. Elle a choisi comme créneau l’achat vente d’articles divers tels les pagnes wax,  les bijoux,  les chaussures etc. Cette  activité lui est  très rentable, car elle est très sollicitée par les femmes de la ville de Koutiala. 
Dans le souci  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  et satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité, Madame décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso en  2007.  Après 2  prêts  solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous payés correctement, elle est à son premier  prêt  individuel. 
Elle compte acheter, 40 colliers et 10 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et souvent au Sénégal  et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée  de jeunes filles et de femmes mariées  au comptant et à crédit.  
Salimata espère réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des d’intérêts du prêt,  entretenir son enfant  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Filing for divorce and the mother with a child, Ms. Salimata D. is 34 years old and currently lives at her parents' place in the Kouloukoro district of Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to continue in primary school because her parents lacked the means, she wasted no time going to work at her mother's side to earn an income. Salimata has been advancing on her own now for ten years. She chose as her niche the buying and selling of various goods, such as Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), jewelry, shoes, etc. This is a very profitable business for her because she is in high demand by the women of Koutiala City. Concerned about augmenting her working capital and satisfying her customer demands for quality, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2007. After two solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy 40 necklaces and 10 bolts of Wax pagnes. Supplies are procured in Bamako and often in Senegal. Sales are made in Koutiala City to customers composed of girls and married women, cash or credit accepted. Salimata hopes to realize a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to make loan interest payments, to care for her child, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana Y. is from the town of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has one school-aged child. Juana owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Vanegas

texts.es: Alfonso Vanegas M. tiene la edad de 50 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de mecánico. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfonso tiene que trabajar desde muy temprano, hasta por la noche por que solamente así puede ofrecerle a su familia el pan de cada día. En algunas ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan en el taller, por lo que ellos estudian. Alfonso es una persona muy responsable y es un buen cliente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos de vehículos. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alfonso Vanegas Munoz is 50 years old. He is married with three children who still depend on him. He earns a living as a mechanic, work he has been doing for more than 30 years. Alfonso needs to work long hours, from early morning until late at night just to put food on the table for his family. Sometimes his children help him in the shop when they are not at school. He is a very responsible person and a good client of the communal bank. He will use the loan he is requesting to purchase spare parts. His dream is for his children to be able to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Adom Wo Wiem Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all currently in school. She is a petty trader.

Sylvia runs a cold store. She supplies mostly to food vendors. Sylvia is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom wo wiem’ which literally means 'Grace is from Above'. She is seated in front in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work very hard to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the market square in the community they live in. Some trek to other towns to sell their products.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods and raw materials to be able to expand their businesses and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette dame pour apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer, s’est lancée au cours de cette année dans la vente de produits alimentaires de toute sorte ; elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour agrandir son stock de marchandises avec l'achat de 05 petites boîtes de tomates, 10 grandes boîtes, 10 bidons d’huile, 25 litres de lait, 05 cartons de spaghuéti, 03 cartons de sardines. Elle exerce son commerce au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est convaincue que ce financement apportera un changement dans sa vie et dans son foyer.
texts.en:
Viviane M. is married and the mother of 2 children. In order to contribute to her family's finances, she launched a business this year selling all sorts of food products. She is requesting a loan from the micro-finance organization WAGES in order to increase the stock of her merchandise. She will purchase 5 small crates of tomatoes, 10 large crates of tomatoes, 10 canisters of oil, 25 liters of milk, 5 boxes of spaghetti and 3 containers of sardines. She does business in the large market in Lomé. She believes that this financing will change her life and her home.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Los Artesanos Group

texts.es:
Gloria del Carmen M., Dina Ruth C. R. y José Humberto G. L. son los integrantes del grupo Los artesanos. Originarios de la comarca las Flores ubicada a tres Kilómetros de la Ciudad de Masaya, característica por la manera como sus habitantes trabajan la artesanía de Cuero.

Gloria M. de 31 años de edad, es artesana de familia. Inicio su trabajo desde muy joven, ya que sus padres y abuelos trabajaban en esto. No obstante, nos dice Gloria que después de casarse decidió empezar a trabajar en la Zona franca de Tipitapa; Pero se dio cuenta que eran mejor los ingresos en sus artesanías y decidió salirse e iniciar el negocio.

Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y pretende seguir invirtiendo, actualmente elabora bolsos y fajas de cuero y los vende en el mercado turístico de Masaya. Pero no cubre la demanda que tiene de dichos bolso. Por tanto su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima.

Dina Ruth C. R. posee una pulpería la cual administra desde hace 9 años y José Humberto G. L. trabaja en la elaboración de Artesanías de cuero desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen M., Dina Ruth C. R., and José Humberto G. L. are the members of the group “Los Artesanos” (The Artesans). They are originally from the region of Las Flores, which is located three kilometers from the city of Masaya. Most of the residents in that area design leather handicrafts.

Gloria M. is 31 years old and comes from a family of handicraft artists. She started working at a young age, just as her parents and grandparents did. After she got married, she decided to get a job at La Zona Franca (an industrial area where companies hire laborers to process goods for export) in Tipitapa. She realized that she earned a better income making handicrafts, so she quit her job and started her own business.

Since then, she has done very well and intends to continue investing in her business. She currently produces leather purses and belts and then sells them in the tourist market in Masaya. However, she is not able to keep up with the demand for leather purses. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials.

Dina Ruth C. R. has a grocery store that she has managed for 9 years. José Humberto G. L. also makes leather crafts and has been in business for 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for the past six years. She hopes for a loan of N100000 to purchase more drinks and provisions. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia Irma, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, ella tiene 20 años es soltera y trabaja con su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de chanchos, negocio que inicio a raíz de lo aprendido por su madre, nuestra socia compra de la feria de Inquilpata que se realiza todos los viernes y los cría, cuida y llegado el debido tiempo ella los vende o también realiza potajes con la carne y lo vende en la feria de Inquilpata, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder tener capital de trabajo y así comprar mas chanchos.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a diligent business woman. She is married to Florante who works as an all around laborer in their village. The couple helps one another to meet the daily needs of their family. They have two children. Nova, 20 years old, is an entrepreneur and college graduate now employed at Green Hornet Enterprises. Harrieth, 18 years old, currently attends college. Annie hopes that her youngest will also finish her college education.

Annie makes a living by selling homemade products such as longganisa (Filipino sausage), tocino (pork marinated with sweet sauce), and embutido, among others. For additional income, she also sells personal products made by Avon, Natasha and Sarah Lee.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP8,000 for the maintenance and growth of her businesses. Annie has already borrowed from KIVA once before. She saw how the loan allowed her to grow her income and her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for maintenace and growth of her businesses

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
VERONICA DURAND M., (A QUIEN APRECIAMOS SENTADA EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA) TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVE  CON SU PAREJA Y TIENE UNA HIJTA PEQUEÑA DE  5 AÑITOS. ELLA INTEGRA  Y ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO “MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS”, JUNTO A 7 INTEGRANTES MAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA EL CARMEN, EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. VERÓNICA, ES ESPECIALISTA EN LAS VENTAS, APROVECHA LOS PRODUCTOS DE TEMPORADA PARA HACER SU NEGOCIO. DURANTE TODO EL AÑO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, Y AHORA QUE ESTAMOS CERCA DE LA NAVIDAD, NVERTIRÁ EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO EN COMPRAR PANETONES, EL CUAL OFRECERÁ A SUS FAMILIARES, AMIGOS Y COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO DE SU PAREJA.
DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA ELLA EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR, A LOS 5 AÑOS AYUDABA A SU MAMÁ EN LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS, SIGUIENDO SU EJEMPLO , A LOS DOCE AÑOS SE INDEPENDIZA EN EL NEGOCIO Y COLOCA SU PUESTO DE JUGOS, CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA PUDO AYUDAR A SUS PADRES ECONÓMICAMENTE PARA LACOMPRA DE SUS ÚTILES ESCOLARES CUANDO ERA ESTUDIANTE.
HOY EN DÍA SUS VENTAS LE PERMITE CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE EDUCACIÓN DE  SU HIJA QUIEN ESTUDIA EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR.
texts.en:
Veronica D. M., who we see seated in the photograph, is 31 years-old and lives with her partner and her young, 5 year-old daughter. Veronica forms a part and is the treasurer of the group "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Winning Women), along with 7 other members. The members of the group are all residents of the El Carmen area in the district of Carabayllo. Veronica specializes in sales, and takes advantages of seasonal products to earn money. During the whole year she sells beauty products, but now that we are near Christmas time she will invest the loan funds in the purchase of small cakes, which she will then sell to relatives, friends, and her husband's coworkers. Victoria has been working since a very young age.
