At the age of 5 she helped her mother sell sodas, and then, following her example, at the age of 12 had her own independent business and added a juice stand. With this job Victoria helped her parents with the purchase of her school supplies when she was a student. Today her sales pay for the cost of education for her daughter who studies in a private school.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of small cakes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Hilda Beelaida

texts.es: El Señora Hilda G. tiene 23 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su familia, ella y su familia  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, llevan 8 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella y  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Garcia is 23 years old, single and has been dedicated to the craft and loom knitting business for 8 years. She has 2 looms in her workshop and two employees.

Mrs. Garcia lives with her family in the “Caserío la Libertad, Vasquez village, Totonicapán state- Guatemala. The demand of her products has grown, but her economic situation is not good enough to increase the production. She is asking to ASDIR Association for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of materials that will allow her to increase her sales and keep supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Baasanjav D. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a house in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. Her oldest son is a university student, her second son and both of her daughters attend secondary school and her youngest son is one year old. Her husband currently works as a construction worker during the summer and looks after the children during the winter.

Baasanjav operates a small grocery business from a booth in her town. She is a cook by trade but runs the grocery in her spare time to supplement her income. Her business is very important to her and she says, "I must work hard to feed my big family.” She is requesting a loan of 400,000 tugrug to purchase grocery products for her business and make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for her business and to repair her house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is 29 years old. Her husband is a soldier and he also supports the family.

She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells cooking oil to make a living. She also has a machine that she uses to grind tomatoes and peppers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Simon Antonio

texts.es: El señora Simon Antonio V. H. nacido en managua el 20 de abril de 1963, es soltero pero mantiene una relacion con la señora Maria Elsa Lopez, ellos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, la señora se dedica a los trabajos de la casa tiene tres hijos los cuales, dos le ayudan en su negocio, pero el menor depende completamente de los señores. El plan principal del señor V. es realizar mejoras en su vivienda, cambiar su medio de transporte y la carreta del caballo. El señor Antonio se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de leña compra las pilas derribadas y las hace manojo y en rajas para su posterior venta, se le han presentado problemas para las temporadas de lluvias, debido a que cuesta sacar leña por las condiciones de los caminos pues se hace intransitable el paso, es por esto que ha planeado para un futuro la compra de un camión , pero para eso primero necesitaría de una mejor estabilidad económica y para eso solicita de este prestamo para la compra de madera, para rajarlos y venderlos, esto le aumentaria la ganancia y  le permitiría una mejor estabilidad para la familia y el progreso para nuevos proyectos.
texts.en:
Señor Simon Antonio V. H. was born in Managua on April 20, 1963. He is single but maintains a relationship with Señora Maria Elsa Lopez, They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. Señora Maria Elisa works in the home. He has three children, of whom two help him in his business, but the youngest depends completely on the adults. Señor V.'s main plan is to make improvements in his house and change his means of transportation, his horse-drawn wagon. For 15 years he has sold firewood. He buys piles of cut-down wood, splits it into smaller pieces, and makes bundles to be sold. For his last sale, he had problems because of the rainy season, because it was difficult to get firewood because of the conditions of the roads, which became impassable. For this reason, he has planned the future purchase of a truck, but for this he would first need better economic stability, and so he is applying for this loan to buy wood, to split it and sell it. This would increase his earnings and would allow his family more stability and progress toward his new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood to split and sell for firewood

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Fatim S. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans le Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD et y a reçu successivement 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle développe diverses activités, d'une part elle fait de l'élevage de mouton et de volaille, d'autre part elle développe un petit commerce dans une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre etc. Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatim S. is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a two year history with Banc Villageois of South Santhiaba, having received four consecutive loans from them which she always repaid on time. She is developing different types of work, from raising sheep and poultry to building a small business in a shop where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. Her goal is to increase her capital and to contribute to taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase investment capital

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: Fausto D. A. es un hombre preocupado por el bienestar D. su familia, el va por su cuarto crédito en esta institución en el que esta agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha dado por que es D. la única manera que ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Fausto y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora para el sustento D. sus gastos familiares. Ellos tiene 2 hijos a los cuales quieren ofrecerles comodidad y un patrimonio. La casa que ellos tienen fue construida con dinero que aquí mismo se les otorgo y ahora quieren poner vitropiso en uno D. los cuarto acondicionarlo  para poderlo habitar y así tener mas espacio.
texts.en:
Fausto is worried about his family’s well-being. He is requesting his fourth loan through this institution for whose support he is very thankful because this is the only way he has been able to realize his projects. Fausto and his wife work in a machine shop in order to support their family. They have two children to whom they want to offer comfort and parenting. Their home was built with money from a grant and now they want to install a tile floor in one of the completed rooms so that they can have more living space.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install tile floor

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio V. Ramirez posee un comercio de venta de bebidas en el barrio Arroyo Pora de la ciudad de Encarnación esta casado con la señora Paulina Aguilar Silva y tienen tres hijos viven en casa propia en el barrio Pacu Cua de esta cuidad, el destino del crédito fue para aumentar su stock de mercaderías.
El negocio es atendido por el y por su señora, el comenta que el negocio ayuda muchísimo con los gasto de la casa para la alimentación y vestimenta.
Agradece el préstamos concedido por la Fundación y Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Ignacio V. Ramirez has a business selling beverages in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood in the city of Encarnación. He is married to Señora Paulina Aguilar Silva and they have three children living in their own home in the Pacu Cua neighborhood of the city. The purpose of this loan is to increase his stock of merchandise. He and his wife attend to the business; he says that this business helps a lot with the household food and clothing expenses. He is very grateful for the loans provided by the Foundation and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages for resale

loans.name: Minex

texts.es: La  Sra. Minex Méndez R.  su profesión es  de Maestra de educación primaria tiene veinte y tres años de ser maestra, es madre  de dos hijos uno en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno
texts.en:
Sra. Minex Méndez R. has been a primary school teacher for 23 years. She has two school age children and is currently married. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL and each one has made it possible to make improvements in her home. By means of these loans she will finish building her house, They are her only means of obtaining a decent dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhum H. and her husband, Mr. Den Kem, have been married since 1979 and have two daughters. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Besides being a weaver, Sokhum has started a new business selling Khmer noodles and other food in the local market.  Her husband is a mason and boat repairer. She hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $300 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of smoked fish

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy K. is 49 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom and makes a living by selling fritters and raising animals. Her income is about $2.50 per day. She is divorced and has five children, four of whom are employed, while the youngest is still in school. Khy K. is applying for a loan to buy a piece of land, on which she will build a new house in which she and her family will live.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land on which she will build a new house.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya T. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 56 years old. Ligaya is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ligaya runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ligaya joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ligaya from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Beatrice B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Togetherness. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children who range from 9 to 26 years old. She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to poverty but all of her children are attending school.

For ten years, Beatrice has been operating a tailoring shop where she sews garments and children’s clothes at Red Light Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Beatrice plans to use her 20,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 72,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cloth to sew more garments and children’s clothes. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Beatrice’s goal is to improve her business, build a house, and educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sew more garments and children's clothes

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 39 años de edad, él es un hombre muy trabajador, él comparte su vida con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, quien es su razón de salir adelante. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a brindar servicio de trasporte por las diferentes calles de la zona en la que vive. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo pudo adquirir un carro, que hasta el día de hoy es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por otro lado su esposa aporta con los gastos del hogar pues se dedica en la venta de objetos artesanales. Desde entonces juntos trabajan para progresar y sacar adelante a su querido hijo. El Trabajo de Julio se prolonga durante todo el día dándose tiempo solo para almorzar, pues si quiere obtener los ingresos deseados debe trabajar muy duro y sin parar, en tanto su auto del tanto uso que tiene, sufre algunas averías, es por ello que quiere dejarlo óptimo para poder trabajar con total tranquilidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura seguirá cumpliendo con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere refaccionar su auto para así dejarlo en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old and a very hard working man. He shares his life with his wife and their young son, his reason to keep going, in their own house. He has offered a taxi service for over six years in the different streets where he lives. Thanks to his efforts he was able to purchase a car, which up until now has been the main source of income. His wife helps with the household expenses by selling artesanal objects, and they have been able to work together to progress and bring up their beloved son. Julio’s work keeps him busy all day long, only allowing him time to stop for lunch, because if wants to earn the income he dreams of he must work very hard without stopping. Because he uses his car so much, it has suffered some breakdowns and Julio would like to improve its condition so he can work with total peace of mind. This is his second loan with MFP and he assures lenders that he will continue to make his repayments. With this loan he hopes to refurbish his car to bring it up to optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa D. is from the village of Blanco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Marisa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products (firewood) to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products (firewood) to sell

loans.name: Claudia Janeth

texts.es: Claudia Janeth tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y semilla de jícaro. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta medio de vida, pues siempre está pensando en lo que su familia necesita, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo por lo que su esposo no tenía un trabajo estable fue así que ella deicidio sacar adelante a su familia, a pesar de las diferentes dificultades que atraviesa por lo que tiene que recorrer distancias muy lejanas para ofrecer sus productos a diferentes clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Claudia Janeth is forty-two years old and sells clothing and jicaro (gourd) seeds for a living. She has made her living this way for more than thirteen years, since she is always thinking about what her family needs. She has a seven-year old son to support. Her husband did not have stable work, so she decided to help her family get by in spite of the difficulties she faces like traveling long distances to sell her products to her customers. The loan she is taking out is to buy raw materials needed to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Narantsatsral

texts.en:
Narantsatsral S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Central province of Mongolia. Narantsatsral and her husband have four children, one of whom is adopted from their sister who died. 

Narantsatsral participated in a vegetable-pickling training organized by Development Solutions NGO, and she has decided to operate her own business with the cooperation of her friend who grows vegetables and fruit in a greenhouse. The co-workers are planning to produce partially processed vegetables by pickling and preserving, and provide them to the local market as labeled products.  This is permitted by the local inspection authority.  

Her husband works as a shoemaker in a local private company with a monthly salary of 250,000 MNT. Narantsatsral is a very hard-working and modest woman who would like to expand her business even further in the future. She is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary tools and materials for her vegetable pickling process.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and materials for her vegetable pickling process

loans.name: Benkadi  Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Benkadi VIII sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne 32 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide, le sésame et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJELIKA S., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi VIII Group are married women who are on average 32 years old with two children. Most live in polygamous families in N’Gala, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro region in the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI with the intent of better organising their wintering activities. Their cash crops are among others millet, peanuts, sesame and beans. This is their second loan request, the first having been fully reimbursed. With this new loan Djelika S. –the group’s president- intends to buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately one hectare (2,5 acres) of millet and peanuts. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to both consumers and retail merchants. By end of season group members hope to attain average earnings of approximately 35,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertiliser, herbicides and small farming equipment

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Tabon. She is 50 years old. Josephine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Las Mariposas De Rafael Alvarado Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Angélica Rebeca C., una integrante del grupo Las Mariposas de Rafael Alvarado, que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras en el lugar donde doña Angélica prepara su comida. Ella se dedica a  la venta de comida que inicio hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mobiliario como mesas y sillas para el negocio, también quiere comprar algunas cacerolas que le hacen falta. Sus clientes  la consideran una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, y  con un sazón muy bueno. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues va a reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 53 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato, es soltera y tiene en total 2 hijos (1  varón y 1 mujer). Quiere este crédito para comprar mobiliario y así dar un mejor servicio. También espera mejorar sus situación económica y poder realizar mejoras a su casa para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Angélica Rebeca C’s house, a member of the Las Mariposas de Rafael Alvarado (Rafael Alvarado’s Butterflies) group located in the Mexican state of Veracruz.  The women can be seen in the place where Angélica prepares her food.

She has sold home-made food for 7 years.  She is asking for funds to buy furniture like tables and chairs as well as some pots she needs.  Her customers consider her to be a very responsible, hard working woman with a good talent for cooking tasty food.

At the time of requesting the loan she feels happy because she will reinvest in her business.  She is 53 years old and finished high school.  She is single and has two children (a boy and a girl).

She wants the loan to buy furniture to provide better service.  She also hopes to improve her economic situation and do some home improvements in order to provide her family with an improved quality of life.

loans.use: To buy furniture and pots and pans for her business.

loans.name: Gustavo Victoriano

texts.es:
Gustavo de 45 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. tiene un taller de ebanista y vende y comprar caña y madera.

El comenzó hace varios años con su taller de ebanista para tener dinero suficiente para mantener a toda su familia, poco a poco haciendo muebles pudo comprar cañas para venderlos en la construcciones. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 17h30 haciendo muebles. Una parte de el lugar que alquila el lo utiliza para dale trabajo a jóvenes y que practiquen haciendo muebles. Uno de los inconvenientes con su negocio es que todas las noches tiene que regresar a las 23h00pm para cuidar el la madera hasta las 04h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera y libros para la librería que tiene su esposa. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para tener bien asegurado su negocio.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 45 years old and lives in a canton called Playas ["Beaches"].  It is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and is known for its wide range of seafood.  He has a cabinet-making shop and he also buys and sells cane and wood.

He started his cabinetry shop several years ago, in order to have enough money to sustain his whole family.  Little by little, by making furniture, he was able to buy cane to sell.  Nowadays, he works from 7:30 AM until 5:30 PM making furniture.  He uses one part of the space he rents to give work to young people, who practice making furniture.  One inconvenience of his job is that every night he has to return to guard his lumber from 11:00PM to 4:00AM.

He wants to use this loan to buy wood, as well as books for his wife's bookstore.  In the future, he would like to buy a piece of land in order to assure the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and books

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo Antonio es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Reynaldo posee  la administración de renta de apartamentos. Este negocio está ubicado contiguo al instituto Juan José Rodríguez,  en donde llegan un sin número de clientes él está muy feliz con su medio de vida ya que habla con mucha personas. Reynaldo dio inicio a su negocio hace 20 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue heredado por su mama, ya que ella tenía dos casas y Reynaldo siguió con esta actividad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mobiliarios, ropa de camas, y otras cosas para brindar un buen servicio. Su meta principal es llegar a construir un hotel, que pueda servir como fuente ingresos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Antonio is married and has 3 young children. He manages rented apartments. The apartments are adjacent to Instituto Juan José Rodríguez, which provides him with a steady number of tenants. He is very happy with his way of life and the opportunity to interact with to many people. Reynaldo started his business 20 years ago; it was passed on to him by his mother, who already had 2 houses and left the apartments to him to manage. 

This loan will be invested in furniture, bed linens, and other items to furnish the apartments well. Reynaldo's goal is to build a hotel, which will provide him with a good source of income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna S. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Sam-an Oeun is 27 year old. They have been married since 2005. They have two young sons of whom one attends school. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vanna is a tailor, a skill she learned from her aunt. Her husband is a fisherman and raises ducks at home. Vanna is asking for her first loan of US$ 350 to purchase additional ducks for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase ducks for her husband to raise

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group-Mpigi

texts.en: Patrick M. is a 28-year-old diligent and tirelessly focused businessman who has been selling bananas in Mpigi Market for 6 months. It's a profitable business that he started on his own initiative with modest savings from one of his various odd jobs. Patrick is a single man who has one child. Each week, his profits total 140,000 shillings. Patrick is affliated with the Tukolerewamu Group. He says that, with this loan, he will purchase more bananas to resell.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Nena owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nena is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aquelina

texts.es: Aquelina, D. 62 años, es una mujer que siempre a luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Epifanio D. 60 años y su querido hijo Gilmer D. 27 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Aquelina a logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su papa y alverja los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más arveja. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Aquelina, 62, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Epifanio, 60, and her beloved son, Gilmer, 27, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life.

Working hard Aquelina has managed to grow her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to water and proviD. proper care for the potato and pea crops that she will subsequently sell in the city of Tarma since that’s where she gets the best prices for her products.

What she enjoys the most about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working out in the fields.  She has been farming for 20 years and considers tilling the land to be the most difficult part.  In time she’d like to make the fields adequate for more pea planting.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She knows that the loan will help quite a bit to develop her business’ progress so she is willing to repay all her installments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well liked.

She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers to improve the quality of her farmland.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Arista

texts.es: Arista, D. 66 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia.DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería y  durante más D. 20 años esto le ha servido para  asegurar la alimentación D. su familia. En la actualidad tiene vacas, toros, burros y caballos a los que  cuida diariamente brindándoles alimentación y un ambiente D. descanso que es su propio establo. D. vez en cuando comercializa  sus animales y después adquiere otras D. mejor calidad, siembra paralelamente maíz y papa D. las cuales después D. varios meses pueD. ver sus ganancias por lo que desea incrementar más la cantidad D. animales D. su establo.Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su actividad económica.Arista tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito  en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono ya que sembrara alfalfa y pastos para  el alimento D. su ganado, D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en: 66 year old Arista lives with her husband in their own home. She has been working in agriculture and livestock raising since she was a child, and for more than 20 years this occupation enabled her to feed her family. She currently has cows, bulls, donkeys, and horses, which she cares for daily, giving them food and a relaxing environment in her stable. Every now and then she sells her animals and then buys others of greater quality. At the same time, she grows corn and potatoes, and after several months she sees the profits and so she wants to increase the number of animals in her stable. This is her first loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and she is grateful to the people who will fulfill the loan that she is requesting, which will be very useful in developing her economic activities. Arista plans to use the money to buy sacks of fertilizer for her crops of alfalfa and fodder to feed her livestock, and in this way she hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her alfalfa crop

loans.name: Turdaly

texts.en:
Turdaly A. is 53, married and has four children. He lives in the town of Naryn, where he makes a living by breeding cattle. His wife earns a living by baking bread, but also helps her husband in his livestock business. Turdaly went into business in 1998 to earn a living and support his family. With initial capital of 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms, he worked hard to make his business successful. He was able to pay for the education of his daughters and today owns two cows, 15 sheep and one horse. 

Turdaly has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to expand his business by buying bull calves and sheep. With the revenues from his investment, he plans to rebuild his house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable people and is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that increase employment and help people meet the needs of customers and investors.

loans.use: to buy more more cows and sheep

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya, 52, is widowed and lives with her three children in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in an apartment and her youngest daughter attends college. She began selling cosmetics in 2005 and her oldest daughter helps her with the business. They are distributors of the brand "Oriflame", a popular Swedish cosmetic manufacturer. They work very hard for the company and make commissions from their sales. Her daughter takes orders from their customers and sends the list to the branch office through the internet. 

Narantuya has become a reliable and certified member of the company and she receives different bonuses in addition to her commissions. She is a hard-working and brave person who says, "I now earn money and support my family thanks to this business and  I want to increase my customer base which will give me more orders." She is requesting a loan of 900,000 MNT to purchase some more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es: La Señora Mirian R. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales una hija ya está casada, de modo que sólo depende de ella su hijo de 15 años. La señora Mirian lleva 5 años dedicandose a la venta de ropa y ahora desea invertir también en cosméticos, comenta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho ya que con ellos ha sacado adelante a sus hijos siendo madre soltera, dado que gracias a que su negocio es trabajo independiente, no descuida su hogar ya que sus ventas son en su localidad y se dedica sólo las tardes a vender. Miriam se siente muy contenta pues también puede cuidar de sus papás ya que vive con ellos y el no tener un horario de trabajo de todo el dia, le permite tener tiempo para su familia. Observaciones:las integrantes que no se alcanzan a ver del todo bien en la fotografía son las Sras: Julia Muñoz A., Clara B. Hernández  e Isabel T. M. (orden de izquierda a derecha, quedaron mal colocadas al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en: Sra. Mirian R., 44, is a single mother with 2 children.  Her daughter is married and lives apart, but her 15-year old son still lives at home.  Sra. Mirian has operated a business selling clothing for 5 years and now she wants to sell cosmetics, as well.  She says that past loans have helped her tremendously because she's used the money to build a business that has allowed her--though a single mother--to support her family.  She likes owning her own business because she can work when she wants, in the neighborhood, and be close by to take care of her family.  In addition to her son, Sra. Mirian cares for her parents so it's doubly important that she be able to work nearby and still have time for family matters.  Notice: the members who aren't clearly visible in the photograph are (from left to right, out of plain sight) Sra. Julia Munoz A., Sra. Clara B. H. and Sra. Isabel T. M..

loans.use: Clothing and cosmetics sales.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
K. Mukaddas is a teacher of secondary school in Shahristan town. At the same time, in order to earn additional income, she is growing different vegetables with the help of her father. They work hard at growing vegetables, which they sell in the market. 

Last season was very good and after much effort, they achieved a big harvest. Her father went the market to sell the crop they had labored for. Currently Mukaddas’s family has a financial problem and she needs the help of all of us. 

The family’s desire is to continue planting vegetables and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seed and fertilizer. For this purpose, Mukaddas and her family are requesting a loan of $1800 USD, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Sangimo

texts.ru: Чагирова Сангимо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж занимается торговлей. Дети, учатся. Сама Сангимо занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Она в основном занимается продажей зелени. Кредит берет для покупки зелени и фисташек. Она хочет взять в аренду еще одну торговую точку рядом со своей точкой и начать торговлю фисташками. Так как сейчас сезон торговли фисташек.
texts.en: Sangimo C. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is in trade. Her children study. Sangimo trades in the central market of the area. She primarily sells greens. She is taking out a loan to buy greens and pistachios. She wishes to lease one more shop near the first and begin to trade in pistachios. This is now the season to sell pistachios.

loans.use: to buy greens and pistachios

loans.name: Mamajon

texts.en:
R. Mamajon is 52 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Mamajon is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising large livestock and selling them at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from farms in the adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Today Mamajon is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd is not enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest a loan of 7000 Somoni into his business. In order to obtain this amount, Mamajon has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Raghierd

texts.ar: رغيد عمره 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في محل لبيع الاقراص المدمجة والافلام وتعهد حفلات له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله ويرى فيه طموح كبير بان يصبح منسق حفلات يريد دائما ملاحقة كل ما هو متطور ومتجدد يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته خاصة انه يساعد اهله لكي يتمكن من استمرار العلاقات الاسرية فهو جدي في العمل طموح يتميز بحبه لعمله وابتكاره فيه لا يعاني من منافسة في محيطه لكن ما ينقصه هو بعض المادة ليتمكن من دعم عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جهاز عرض للانارة وتقوية المحل وايضا شراء جهاز يستعمله في الحفلات وهو ( mixer) له زبائن كثر من المناطق المجاورة لقريته ومن قريته واصدقائهله شغف كبير في عمله وذلك ايضا من دعم من اهله
texts.en: Raghierd is 22 years old and unmarried. He works in a store which sells movies and CDs, and organizes parties. He has seven years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and sees in it the possibility to realize his aspiration of becoming a party planner. He continuously follows developments and whatever is new in his field. He is trying to secure a good future for himself and for his family, particularly because he helps to support his family and thereby maintain his relationship with his family. He is ambitious and serious about his work, and he stands out in his field through his love for his work and his innovation. He isn't having problems from competition in his community, but he does lack certain material resources which he needs to support his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy display lighting equipment to improve his store, as well as a mixer, which he uses in putting on parties. He has many customers from his own town, from neighboring towns and from among his friends. He has a very strong passion for both his work and for supporting his family.

loans.use: buy display lighting equipment for his media store and a mixer to DJ at parties.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 33 years old and she runs a salon to earn a living.  Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she is able to attract more customers because of her good services.  She has employed one person to assist her in her business.  In the future, she hopes to open other business outlets and employ more people.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy a hair dryer and combs.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and combs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 30 years old and has a five-year-old child.  He runs a hardware shop to earn a living.  He started the business four years ago.  He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to keep business records.  This has helped him to run his business well.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs 50,000 Kes to buy pipes and padlocks.

loans.use: to buy pipes and padlocks

loans.name: Sumeth

texts.en:
Sumeth, 32 years old, sells groceries at home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and they are living in Battombong Province. 

Their income is $10 per day. They are married and have two children, 15 and 12 years old. Both are in school. 

Every month, they have to spend $83 on food, $10 on electricity, and $75 on school fees for their children. 

Sumeth would like to a request loan of $500 to buy more canned goods and other things for her grocery shop to sell. Before, her grocery shop was very small and there were not enough things for her costumers to buy, so she expects that after this loan, she can offer her costumers the things they need. 

She also plans to enlarge her shop when she gets more income and she will send her children to school until they are finished and get a good job.

loans.use: To buy more canned goods and other things for her shop.

loans.name: Manuel Maria

texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old. He is from Colombia and lives in the city of Tulcán, Ecuador, along the Ecuador-Colombia border. He is single and lives with his family which includes two children, aged nine and 13. Manuel is a happy person of strong character. He is reliable and, above all, a very responsible parent. 

Manuel runs a store where he sells music CDs and movies. He began his business with a small stall at the entrance to the central market of Tulcán with a borrowed tape recorder and a small amount of CDs. Thanks to a previous loan from FODEMI, he purchased his own tape recorder and more CDs. “Now I can say I have my own business,” he reports. His business is going well because it is his own and he has many customers. 

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his store. He is thankful for his loans because they have opened many doors for him and he has been able to prosper. Manuel is especially thankful because no other institution would give him credit because he is Colombian. His past loans have helped him increase his income. His dream is to expand his business to give him the ability to forge a better future for his children.  

In this photo, Manuel is wearing a blue shirt and is posed with two of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, including CDs and movies, for his shop

loans.name: Sokmeng

texts.en: Sokmeng, aged 25, is an animal feeder. Her husband is a soldier; their income is $6 per day. She has one child and he is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land with a small house in which to stay. That property will cost more than she has borrowed; she already has some money but needs a bit more to complete the purchase. She wants to feed more animals to sell and to be able to save money to repair her house so it stays in better condition. In addition, she will work harder to send her child to study to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land with a small house in which to stay

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE JESUS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de humintas, venta de electro domésticos, respoteria, comerciante de verduras, quemador de CD’s y DVD’s, peinadora y peluquería, venta de ropa, y tienda.

La señora Rosario,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el que aprendió de su amiga 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra aumentar su capital (compra de fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.) que comprará por mayor de la calle Garita de Lima y que posteriormente lo venderá en esa misma calle. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “CORAZON DE JESUS” community bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors headed by Rosario. The businesses that the association's members have are varied. Among them, we have: selling humitas, selling appliances, pastries, selling vegetables, burning CD's and DVD's, hairstyling and hair cutting, selling clothes, and a store.  

Rosario indicates that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and she joined via invitation. At present, she has a small store, which she learned about from a friend.  

The loan that she is taking out now is to make purchases and increase her capital. She will buy pasta, sugar, rice, etc. She will make her purchases wholesale on Garita de Lima street and later she will sell them on the same street. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family. She is single and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and health trainings.

loans.use: to buy pasta, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene la edad 52 de  años, está casada y vive con sus 2 nietos solamente.  Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los materiales para la mejora de su hogar en la parte de la cocina. Ella cuenta con la casa propia y quiere darle una mejora a su cocina pues se encuentra en mal estado. Ella lo que quiere es darle  una mejor presentación y mayor seguridad a sus electrodomésticos que se encuentran en ella, pues son muy importantes para la realización de las tareas de cocinar para su bienestar y la de sus nietas. Ella tiene como meta tener su hogar seguro y con el mejor mantenimiento posible y así mantenerla en el mejor estado de la vivienda. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miriam, 52, is married and lives just with her two grandchildren.  She intends to use the loan to buy materials to do some home improvements in the kitchen area.  She has her own house and she wants to improve the kitchen which is in bad condition.  What she wants to do is make it more attractive and provide security for her home appliances that are located in it because they are very important for the food preparation tasks for herself and her granddaughters.

Her goal is to have a safe home and with the best possible maintenance so that she can keep it in the best possible state.  This is her first loan from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Genecita

texts.en:
Genecita is 39 year old widow with 1 child.

Genecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a used clothing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Genecita has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the used clothing business for 6 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Genecita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 51 años es una mujer trabajadora, convive desde hace un tiempo con Dionisio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos mayores y realizados. Ahora ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista – Huaracayo. Los días de está valiente mujer se centran en el trabajo arduo. Hace 33 años comenzó su camino por la agricultura. En todo ese tiempo logró adquirir, gracias a su esfuerzo, sus propios terrenos agrícolas, su pequeña casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante, los que según cuenta; le ayudan en mantener sus sembríos de papa, alverja y demás hortalizas en buen estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia. “A pesar de no vivir con mis hijos mayores, siempre nos ayudamos. Ellos también son agricultores”, afirma muy alegre Justina. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, por lo que comenzó a incorporarse con el banco comunal de su zona, donde está segura; podrá lograr su objetivo de sembrar en mayor cantidad. Ahora ella desea incursionar en la siembra de maíz y alverja, donde espera obtener nuevas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Justina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de alverja que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Justina, aged 51, is a hard-working woman.  She has lived with her husband Dionisio for some time, and they have four grown children together.  Now they live in their own home, located in the hamlet of Bellavista – Huaracayo.

The days of this valiant woman are centered on hard work.  33 years ago, she began her path in agriculture.  Over this time, she has managed to acquire, thanks to her effort, her own farmlands, her small house, and to move her children ahead in life. According to her, her children help her maintain her crops of potatoes, peas and other vegetables in good order.

What she likes most about her work is being able to spend most of her time with her family.  "Even though I don't live with my grown children, we always help each other out.  They are also farmers", says Justina, very happily.

Her main difficulty is the lack of working capital, which is why she started to work with the communal bank in her area.  She is sure that with this, she will be able to achieve her goal of increasing crop quantity.  She now wants to move into growing corn and peas, from which she will obtain new earnings.  

She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” Communal Bank, and this is her first loan through MFP, from whom she is hoping for a small loan to achieve her goals.  She also promises to be punctual with her repayments.

On receiving your help, Justina will invest the requested money in purchasing several bags of natural fertilizers to spread on the pea crops, which have shown little growth.

loans.use: to buy several bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Belgica Margot

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora es Bélgica es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los créditos adicionales que les da la institución a las socias que son muy buenas pagadoras. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella junto  su esposo han formado una empresa de seguridad, mientras él ofrece el servicio junto  a otras siete personas que ellos han contratado y a quienes les pagan un sueldo mensual por sus servicios, ella se encarga de la parte legal y administrativa de su empresa, mientras que su esposo se encarga de la supervisión y vigilancia. Nos cuenta que llevan ya 8 meses que comenzaron a ofrecer este servicio, que los contratos han aumentado y que su empresa está creciendo con el pasar de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar chalecos y uniformes.
 
Sus metas son que su empresa crezca y seguir ofreciendo sus servicios no solo en su cantón sino también en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is well-known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned on a national and international level.  This is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

Señora Bélgica is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes for the additional loans that the institution gives to members who are good payers.  She is 33 years old and married; she has three children from this relationship aged 12, 10 and 8.  The eldest attends secondary school, and the younger two are in primary school.  Her husband is a security guard.

She and her husband have formed a security business.  They provide service together with seven other people whom they have hired and whom they pay a monthly salary for their services.  She is in charge of the legal and administration side of the business, while her husband is in charge of security supervision and surveillance.  She tells us that they started this business 8 months ago; with their hired staff they have expanded and the business is growing by the day.

She will use this loan to buy vests and uniforms.

Her goals are for her business to grow, and to continue by offering her services not only in her own canton, but also in other cities.

loans.use: to buy vests and uniforms.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Blanca se considera una mujer emprendedora, pues desde hace mucho tiempo se ha rebuscado la manera de sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente tiene un negocio de comidas a las afueras de su casa en donde trabaja los fines de semana y alterna este negocio con la confección, pues durante 10 años ha prestado estos servicios a sus vecinos y personas mas allegadas, sin embargo comenzó con el negocio de comidas por sus ingresos cada vez eran mas pocos. 

Blanca sueña con un mejor futuro, con llegar a tener un taller de confección muy reconocido, y con hacer crecer su negocio de comidas, y para ello sabes que debe mejorar algunos aspectos del lugar como las parrillas, las herramientas de cocina, e insumos para la producción de alimentos, sin embargo la suma de dinero es muy alta para ella, por lo que solicita un crédito de inversión para su negocio, así sus productos tendrán mas calidad y sus ventas se incrementarán al igual que sus ingresos.
texts.en:
63-year old Blanca considers herself an enterprising woman, as for a long time now she has managed to get together enough resources to allow her six children to get ahead. She now runs a business selling food outside her home at weekends. As well she has a sewing business providing services to her neighbours and people who live further away. She started the food business as she didn't earn enough  from sewing.

Blanca dreams of a better future where she will have a well-known sewing workshop and an expanding meal business. In order to achieve this, she knows that she has to improve some aspects such as the grill, kitchen tools, and supplies. However, this all costs more than she can afford so she is seeking a loan so that the food she produces will be of higher quality, sales will increase, as will her income.

loans.use: to buy items for her new business selling food

loans.name: Orión Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama orión y se integra D. tres señoras quienes cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad, quien se le tomo L. entrevista se llama María Olga  elL. es viuda y su responsabilidad tiene a dos hijos.

 
      ElL. solito el préstamo para invertirlo en L. compra D. ingredientes para L. elaboración D. comidas en donD. lleva trabajando seis meses y le va bien  ya que se siente muy cómoda con su actividad pues lo prepara en su domicilio.

      ElL. se inspiro en esta actividad para tener sus propios ingresos, así apoyarse para darles lo  más necesario a sus hijos quienes están a su responsabilidad y sigan  estudiando para que logren terminar  una carrera.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda  aumentar sus ingresos para así rentar un local en el mercado y poder vender más cómoda los alimentos que elL. elabora.
 
     Las personas que se integran en el grupo son las señoras: Macarena quien solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en L. compra D. perfumes D. L. marca fraiche y L. señora Adalea invertirá en L. compra D. cosméticos D. L. marca Avon, jafra, blondi y fuler.
texts.en:
Three women belong to Orión Group, each working in her respective job.  María Olga is the one who was interviewed.  She is a widow and is responsible for two children.

María Olga requested the loan to buy ingredients to make food, work she has been doing for six months.  It's going well for her, since she feels very comfortable with this work because she prepares the food in her home.

She was inspired to do this work to have her own income, and so support herself to give the necessities to her children, who are her responsibility and continue studying so they will be able to finish their academic studies.

What María Olga most wants is that this little job and the loan increase her earnings so she can rent a place in the market to be able to sell the food she makes more easily.
 
The members of this group are Macarena, who requested the loan to buy Fraîche brand perfumes, and Adalea, who will buy Avon, Jafra, Blondi, and Fuller cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Tehmina's Group

texts.en:
Tehmina is 39 years of age and married. Her husband operates a shop selling herbs. He also prepares herbal medicines, which he sells to his customers. He is very much an expert in his work and has obtained good knowledge about herbal medicines. 

Tehmina is also a working woman who operates a boutique at her home. She sells stitched and unstitched clothes to her community clients. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month. She has given birth to four children. Three of the children are studying and one works with his father at his shop.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties that will help her make more profits from her business. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that after the loan investment, it will grow further.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tehmina.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique business

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is married with three children. She is 56 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Crisanta sells canned goods, toothpaste, and noodles to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, toothpaste, noodles, etc. Crisanta has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Crisanta hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as canned goods, toothpaste, and noodles

loans.name: Melva Albertina

texts.es: Melva, nuevamente necesita  otro crédito, porque quiere seguir aumentando  en sus ingresos y por ese motivo comprara más maíz, leña, el propósito D. ella es tener lo suficiente para atender a los clientes y seguir mejorando su negocio. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar en sus ventas y los ingresos esto le permitió tener una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en: Melva needs another loan again because she wants to continue increasing her income, so she will buy more corn and firewood.  Her goal is to have enough to take care of the customers and continue improving her business.  The previous loans helped her to increase her sales and income.  This allowed her to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
At the age of 18, Jonathan learned to manage a rice farming business with his parents. When he got married, he managed his own rice farming business. Now Jonathan is 38 and has three children who are going to school. He desires to send his children on through school and that they will hold a degree someday. 

Jonathan could not afford to finance both the daily allowances for his children and his farm as well. He decided to request a loan of P35,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he will use in farming. 

In the future, Jonathan would like to see his children as professionals someday through the profit he gained from farming. He will be grateful to get the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he will use in farming.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 59 years old. He is from the village of Bashi, West Georgia, where he lives with his wife Mzia. He works as a repairman, fixing car and tractor motors in a small workshop at his home. Otar is also actively involved in his family's agriculture business: they have three milk cows and they produce and sell an average of 50 kg of cheese per month. They also have 1.25 hectares of land, where they grow maize, cucumbers, tomatoes, and watermelons to sell to local retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris.

Otar has requested a loan to purchase a mini-bus so he can take his products to nearby towns and villages and sell them for higher prices. According to Otar’s calculations, he will earn a much higher profit this way, even taking into account the transportation costs. With their increased income, the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for transporting green grocery products.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y una hija él se dedica a la venta de pan, que distribuye en una bicicleta a los lugares cercanos, además tiene dos empleados que le ayuda a recorrer por otros lugares donde tiene clientes.
El que solicita préstamo para la compra de latas para hacer pan y compra de estantes, dicha inversión le ayudarán a mejorar la panadería aumentando los utensilios necesarios para mejorar la producción.
La aspiración de Luis es un día lograr la compra de su propia vivienda y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and daughter. He sells bread and distributes his goods by bicycle in places nearby. In addition, he has two employees who help him by traveling to other places where he has customers.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy baking tins for making bread and shelves for storing his goods. This investment will help to improve his bakery and increase the number of necessary utensils that he needs to improve production. His aspiration is to one day purchase his own home and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy baking tins and shelving for his bakery.

loans.name: Juana Natividad

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica la compra y venta de patos, ella también desea invertir su credito en la compra de productos como son papas al por mayor, salchichas, un carrito salchipapero para incursionar en la venta de salchipapas, la socia esta muy anciosa por empezar y vera como le va el negocio, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea seguir creciendo y dar a sus hijos un buen ejemplo y calidad de vida; la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos como papa, salchichas y un carrito salchipapero, ella prepara para la venta.
texts.en: Currently she is a duck merchant but she wants to use the loan to buy products like potatoes and sausages at wholesale and as well as a food cart to start selling ‘salchipapas’ [fast food consisting of fried potatoes and fried sausages].  She is very anxious to get started and see how she does in the business.  She is a very hardworking woman who wants to continue to grow to set a good example for her children and provide them with a good quality of life.  She is asking for the loan to buy potatoes, sausages and a food cart to get ready to start selling.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sausages and a food cart.

loans.name: Yerson Jose

texts.es:
Yerson Jose tiene 22 años de edad, él vive en Ica, vive en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, tierra generosa que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y más conocida como: “La tierra del sol eterno”,  ya que aunque sea invierno siempre se puede divisar el sol, además sus pobladores son muy amables y hospitalarios, asimismo se cosecha la mejor uva de la región con la que se elabora uno de nuestros productos bandera: “ el Pisco".  

En su tiempo libre disfruta de escuchar música con ello se relaja mucho y según Yerson lo ayuda a trabajar mucho mejor;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que le agrada mucho a Yerson es el riquísimo “lomo Saltado”,  Yerson solo estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenían muchos ingresos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser  Profesor.  Yerson es soltero y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi por las calles de su barrio, se dedica a este trabajo 10 horas diarias. En un día Yerson puede transporta alrededor de 20 pasajeros diariamente y esto le permite ganar gana aproximadamente un promedio de S/. 50 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar S/. 100  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, porque ha aumentado las personas que necesitan este servicio. 

Yerson esta infinitamente agradecido ya que gracias a la ayuda de lo prestatarios Kiva, podra pagar los traites para adquirir su licencia de conducir y  dar un mejor mantenimiento a su mototaxi.Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a mejorar sus ingresos ya que los clientes tendrán mas confianza en utilizar la movilidad que el maneja y porque evitara tener multas por conducir sin licencia y así poder en algunos meses cumplir su gran sueño: "Comprarse un automóvil."
texts.en:
Yerson Jose is 22 and lives in Ica, in La Tinguiña District, a generous land characterized by its warm climate and better known as “The Land of Eternal Sun” since even in winter you can always see the sun. Moreover its people are very friendly and hospitable and harvest the best grapes in the region, with which they make one of their flagship products, “Pisco” (grape brandy).

In his free time Yerson enjoys listening to music, which is greatly relaxing and, he says, helps him to work much better. As is well known, Peru is acknowledged as having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Yerson likes a great deal is the very delicious “Lomo Saltado” (beef stir fry with onions and potatoes).

Yerson only studied until the fifth grade of secondary school because his parents lacked sufficient income, however he would have loved to have studied to become a teacher. He is a bachelor and works carrying passengers in a motor tax through the streets of his district. He works 10 hours a day. In one day he can transport around 20 passengers and this enables him to earn an average of approximately 50 soles a day and on a good day up to 100 soles, which helps with additional expenses maintaining his vehicle since the number of people needing this service has increased.

Yerson is infinitely grateful because, thanks to help from KIVA lenders, he will be able to pay the fees to acquire his driver’s license and keep his motor taxi better maintained. This will enable him to improve his earnings since passengers will feel more confident using the vehicle he operates. In this way he will also avoid fines for driving without a license. Moreover in a few months he will be able to realize his great dream of "buying himself an automobile.”

loans.use: to acquire his driver's license.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria Leonila se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos. Desde hace poco más de 12 años, Maria Leonila se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogos, y de esta manera se gana los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. Debido a que es separada de su pareja, Maria Leonila debe garantizarles el sustento a sus 5 hijos, y es por esto que siempre trabaja con más dedicación y con más esperanzas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Maria Leonila sueña con que su negocio crezca, con que le genere mayores ingresos y que pueda darle a sus 5 hijos todo lo que necesitan, empezando por la mejor educación posible. Maria Leonila, con esperanzas de aprovechar una promoción de su proveedor de productos de uso personal, busca un préstamo que le otorgue el capital necesario para realizar una compra por volumen que le garantice los precios bajos.
texts.en: Maria Leonila can be described as a very hardworking person and dedicated to doing the best for her 5 children. For a little more than 12 years, Maria Leonila has been selling cosmetics, shampoos, etc, from catalogs. This brings her the income she needs to support her family. Because she is separated from her partner, Maria Leonila has to ensure the livelihoods of her 5 children and this is why she always works with such dedication and so many hopes for improving their quality of life. Maria Leonila dreams that her business will grow so that she can increase her profits and be able to give her 5 children everything they need, beginning with the best possible education. Maria Leonila, hoping to take advantage of a promotion offered by her supplier, is looking for a loan that will give her the capital she needs to buy in bulk for a low price.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Elineliko

texts.en:
Elineliko is a thirty-four-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He practices farming as his main source of income where he mostly grows bananas although he also rides a boda boda to earn extra income. He started this business for development. He hopes to become a prominent businessman. However his main challenge is price fluctuations of agricultural products.
