Elineliko is requesting a loan to meet operational costs of his farm like paying workers.

loans.use: to meet the operational costs of his farm like paying workers.

loans.name: Andrei And Angela

texts.en: Andrei C. is the village of Pruteni\'s veterinarian. The village of Pruteni is a farming community, spread out over a vast area. With a population of 1,000 people, almost all with family farms, Andrei has a great deal of animals to care for. While Andrei is working he relies on Angela, his wife, to take care of their 2 children and their animals. They have many animals and look to raising and selling animals to supplement the family income.  Around their house they have 1 horse, 3 cows, 3 sheep, 4 pigs and 50 chickens and ducks. They would like a loan to repair their barn to shelter the animals for the coming wintertime.

loans.use: To repair a barn to shelter their animals from the wintertime.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: I am a widow and mother of 5. My husband died of HIV/AIDS. I sell household equipment for a living. I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Jesua

texts.en:
Jesua and her husband Felix have a small cheese factory and they sell their product at wholesale quantities in La Paz. They have 3 sons ages 20,18 and 16, all three help take care of the milk producing cattle. The family lives in Achica Baja community, located in Ingavi province, La Paz (2 hours away from La Paz city). Jesua has one employee that helps making cheese. She will use the loan to buy a milk cow to produce more cheese, with which she'll be able to earn more income. This is the first time she has applied for a loan and our evaluation determined that she is eligible for it.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Jesua, trabaja con su esposo Felix tienen un pequeño taller de elaboración de queso de leche de vaca, comercializan al por mayor en la ciudad La Paz, tiene tres hijos de 20, 18 y 16 de edad, los mismos que ayudan con el cuidado de las vacas que producen leche. Viven en la Comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi de La Paz (a 2 horas de la Ciudad d La Paz). Tiene un empleado que ayuda con la elaboración del queso. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permitirá producir mayor cantidad de queso, lo cual le redituará un mayor ingreso. Es el primer crédito que solicita y la evaluación que se realizo lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Compra de ganado

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
I would like to invest in purchasing parts for computer repair, since I haven't been able to make any repairs due to a lack of many parts. My work has decreased, and my earnings as well. I am requesting $1200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

"Me gustaria invertir en la compra de piezas para la reparación de computadoras, ya que no he podido hacer algunas reparaciones debido a que me faltan gran variedad de piezas y mi trabajo ha bajado y por lo tanto mis ganancias". Solicito $ 1,200.00 para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing computer parts

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Mr. A. earns a low income. He is 30 and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He has leased a butcher shop and pays for the rent. Each day he goes to Saatli villages to buy animals. Then he sells meat in his shop. He works long hours.  "If I had more capital, I would increase my turnover and income. Than I could afford to provide necessities of my life and life of my parents," he said. For this purpose, Mr. A. has applied for a $500 loan from Normicro Saatli branch.

loans.use: To expand volume of butcher shop business.

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
Miss Diomith belongs to the Women in Action Communal Bank. Her business is located at San Jose de Sisa, El Dorado province, San Martin state. She sells groceries, fresh fruits and vegetables. She also sells appetizers such as cassava starch donuts and other wheat and corn flour candies. These products are highly esteemed amongst Diomith's clients. She's been working in this business for 20 years.

With the recent loan of S/. 1,500.00 ( US $500.00) received from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 quotas, she will purchase more products such as: rice and sugar (1 bag of each), packages of varieties of candy (8 different product packages), boxes of eggs (10 boxes), cookies and crackers (3 boxes each), soaps (1/2 box of each brand) and various brands of liquid detergent. She will also purchase wheat flour (2 bags) and 2 bags of starch to elaborate her appetizers.

Diomith is married and has two children, both of which are still under her care. The oldest one is about to finish high school and the second one just started high school. Her children are her main impulse to continue, next to her husband, to contribute in their schooling expenses. She considers herself to be very hardworking and to have solidarity with her family. She always supports her brothers when dealing with delicate situations.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres en Acción, tiene ubicado su negocio en la Localidad de San José de Sisa, provincia de El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras frescas; además complementa su negocio con la producción de bocaditos como son las rosquitas de almidón de yuca y otros dulce de harina de trigo y maíz, que son muy requeridos por sus clientes; se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500.00 ($ 500.00), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará más productos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 saco de cada productos), variedad de glolosinas en paquetes (08 paquetes de diferentes productos), huevos en jabas (10 jabas), galletas (06 cajas, entre dulces y saladas), jabones (1/2 caja de cada marca), detergentes de diferentes marcas, además comprará harina de trigo (02 sacos) y 02 sacos de harina de almidón para la elaboración de sus bocaditos. Ella está casada y tiene 02 hijos, ambos aun a su cargo, el mayor está por terminar sus estudios superiores y el segundo acaba de iniciarlos, son su principal impulso para continuar y junto a su esposo contribuir en los gastos de sus estudios. Se considera muy trabajadora y solidaria con su familia, ella siempre apoya a sus hermanos para afrontar situaciones delicadas.

loans.use: Purchase various products (groceries)

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: I need a loan of $250 for my stitching business and my husband’s cloth dying business. With this loan I plan to buy an additional stitching machine and my husband will buy additional materials required for dying clothes. Both of us work very hard to uplift our family’s financial status. Eid, a muslim religious festival, is around the corner and we hope to generate higher profits by taking on bigger orders for the festival.

loans.use: Buy a stitching machine and materials required for dying clothes

loans.name: Umsiah

texts.en: Umsiah, 51, is a seamstress who works at home, earning US$26.5 every two weeks. She will get more orders during the festive season. Her husband, E., has no fixed job, so their family depends on her income. She is asking for a loan of US$150 to buy dress-making supplies and increase business capital. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy dress-making supplies

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim B., a of six, has lived her entire life in Chichawatni, a small town in the Punjab region of Pakistan. She leads a group of five women who all live in the same neighborhood. Each one has the same dream: to invest money in their families' small businesses so they can build a better life for themselves and their children.

With her share of the $1,475 loan, Shahim would like to expand her husband's pharmacy; Saleh wants to buy a donkey cart. Jameela will invest it in her family's restaurant; Nusrat hopes to buy sheep for livestock trading; and Suriya will put the money in her family's barbershop.

loans.use: Buy medicine and supplies to grow a family pharmacy

loans.name: Kikabala East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business selling fish and is requesting a loan to uplift her business. Ruth is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a poultry business.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Margret A., Sylvia K., Sulaina K., and Aisha Naheria. Margret A. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Sylvia K. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to boost business. Sulaina K. operates a business selling fish and wants to add working capital. Aisha Naheria is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To add more capital to fish business

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 25 years old and is a single woman who owns a small salon which she started in 2006. Every day, Zainabu works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $68 from her services.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Tabrey

texts.en:
Ma B. is married to a polygamist. They are blessed with six children, all of whom go to school. Ma B. could not afford to study in school when she was younger, which has made life very difficult for her. Because of this, it is hard for her to work and assist her husband in caring for the family. Additionally, her children are unable to study freely in school because of the fees. They also cannot afford three square meals a day.

Ma B. was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her husband, who became a GHAPE member in 2001. Since she joined, Ma B. has successfully borrowed and repaid loans six times. The profit from these loans has helped her to pay her children's school fees and provide some basic needs, like food, for the family.

Given a new loan, Ma B. plans to buy drugs, chemicals for the production of momo (which is used for washing dresses), and planting seeds. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training in finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. Also, she has been doing this business for several years.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase drugs, chemicals and planting seeds

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Don Guillermo is an honest worker who has installed a small corral so his animals can live adequately as he used to keep them in the kitchen where they interrupted the activities within the home. As it is his wish to be able to make selections and take care of them properly, he built a small environment where they can live and procreate adequately so he can later separate them and maintain the breed of his guinea pigs. Now he is thinking of building a proper environment next to his home with wider divisions allowing the animals to mate and increase their number without obstacles.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

DON GUILLERMO, es un noble trabajador que instaló en su casa en pequeño corral para que sus animalitos puedan vivir adecuadamente porque anteriormente los tenía en su cocina e interrumpían de cierta forma las actividades dentro de su hogar. Es por ello que con el anhelo de que pueda seleccionarlos y cuidarlos construyó para ellos un pequeño ambiente donde puedan vivir y procrearse adecuadamente para luego separarlos y mantener la raza de sus cuyes. Ahora tiene pensado construir un ambiente más adecuado a lado de su domicilio para ampliar sus separadores para que así puedan aparearse y aumentar sin ninguna dificultad su número.

loans.use: Build divisions to increase breeding of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: 62 year old Marina A. is married, with 12 children. She owns a general store which is open to the general public four days per week. She earns a weekly net cash flow of 500 Tala (~208 USD).    SPBD loans are Marina’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for a loan from traditional banks.  She has received seven previous loans from SPBD.

loans.use: Purchase purchase box of lamp flaps, chicken, sausages, tin fish, biscuits etc

loans.name: Edith Fanny

texts.es:
Edith is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her two children. Unfortunately, her husband works far from home. She has had an apiary for 4 years. This business was the idea of her in-laws, who motivated and guided her with everything related to beekeeping. She collects almost 130 liters of pure honey. Every three months, she travels to the city of Lima in order to sell the honey. She also fills orders for her friends and neighbors. She usually attends to her mother’s shop, where she seizes the opportunity to sell honey. Her sales increase during festivities. On occasion, she even sells the honey as a street vendor in the local markets. Edith likes this job because it allows her enough time to look after her children. Her business gets into financial trouble during flower shortages in the area. Flowers are indispensable nourishment for the bees, which means she has to invest more in them during this type of situation.

She believes that her reason for working is to increase profits and her children’s well-being, since her husband’s salary is often not sufficient.

She is requesting a loan in order to obtain beehives, containers, and food for her bees. In the future, she would like to sell wholesale honey in a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Edith tiene 33 años y vive con sus dos hijos, su esposo, lamentablemente y por necesidad trabaja lejos de casa. Desde hace 4 años, tiene una colmenar, se inicio por idea de sus suegros que la animaron y orientaron en todo lo referente a la crianza de abejas, reúne cerca de 130 litros de miel pura, cada tres meses viaja a la ciudad de Lima para venderla y también cubre pedidos vecinos y amistades, generalmente atiende la bodega de su madre, donde aprovecha para vender la miel, sus ventas se incrementan durante las festividades, en ocasiones, la ofrece de manera ambulante en los mercados.Edith gusta de este trabajo porque le permite tener tiempo y atender a sus hijos, su negocio se complica cuando hay escasez de flores en su zona, estas son el alimento indispensable para sus abejas, por lo que entonces, tiene que invertir más en ellas.

Ella considera que el motivo de su trabajo es para acrecentar sus ganancias en bienestar de sus hijos, ya que mucha veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza.

Solicita un préstamo para adquirir colmenas, envases y alimento para sus abejas, en un futuro le gustaría vender miel al por mayor, en una gran tienda.

loans.use: Purchase beehives and food for bees in order to continue honey production

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.en:
The Nueva Semilla (New Seed) group bank consists of 14 women and one man who live in Villa Adela, Sensata, Cruz del Sur, Huayna Potosi, and other neighborhoods close to the Viacha Highway in the city of El Alto. The group's leadership board is headed by Maxima T. A., Clara Elena M. D. A. and Irene Q. Y..  

The women in the group work in a variety of businesses, including selling maca (Bolivian root vegetable) juice, clothing, food, sweets, pickled vegetables and other foods. 

This is the group’s first loan cycle and its members are very excited to work with AgroCapital because of the collaboration's potential benefits, especially the opportunity to expand their businesses. Since the women already know each other from having worked together in group banks at other financial institutions, they know how to support one another. According to the group evaluation done by their loan officer, they are very united and hardworking, so good results are to be expected.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe A. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa la Sra Eulalia Duarte de A. de 55 años de edad, tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad y todos casados.

Don Felipe se dedica a relizar trabajos de jardineria por la Ciudad de Benjamin Aceval, hace ya más de cinco años que trabaja en dicha profesión, tiene clientes ya formados a quienes les brinda sus servicios.

La ayuda de su esposa para los ingresos es muy importante ya que la Sra trabaja como empleada doméstica y asi aporta para los gastos de la casa

Don Felipe solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina electrica de cortar cesped, para poder realizar con más rapidez sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Mr. Felipe A. is 56 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife, Mrs. Eulalia Duarte de A., who is 55 years old. They have three children, all married adults.

Mr. Felipe has worked as a gardener for the City of Benjamin Aceval for more than 5 years, and has regular clients for whom he does jobs.

The help his wife gives him with income is very important. His wife works as a domestic employee and helps contribute to the household expenses.

Mr. Felipe requests a loan to buy an electric lawn mower so he can do his jobs faster.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an electric lawnmower

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat S. is 26 years old and single. She now lives in Pour Tamok Village in Takeo Province. She is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fishnets to support her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina G. con gran entusiasmo en su negocio de venta de ropa usada, todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana abre su establecimiento en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es visitada por los clientes vendiendo la ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Actualmente ella atraviesa una necesidad y es que requiere comprar la ropa para su respectiva comercialización y es por esta razón que ella ha buscado el apoyo incondicional en Ceprodel el cual le brinda financiamiento por medio de los créditos. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Early every morning Luz Marina G. enthusiastically opens her used clothing business at the La Terminal market in León. Customers go to her to buy clothing for women, men, and children. She currently needs to buy clothing for her business, and to do that she seeks Ceprodel's wholehearted support since they offer financing through loans. Her clothing business will benefit greatly from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 27 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. He has been working as a barber for five years. 

Mhamad has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase shaving equipment, a seat and gel. Mhamad has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid his loans on time. His previous loans helped him expand his business. 

Mhamad is successful in his work because he is the only barber in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he wants to change his salon’s decoration.

loans.use: Purchase barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos y su hermana en la casa de su madre. Años atrás trabajaba como empleada doméstica en una casa en la ciudad de Lima, tuvo que regresar a Tarma por la enfermedad de su hija. Por el momento, desde hace 4 meses está ayudando a su tío en su puesto de venta de comida, empieza a las 6am hasta las 4pm y le pagan diario 15 soles incluidos el almuerzo. La meta de Soledad es sembrar en los terrenos de sus familiares con el apoyo de su hermana, porque sabe que la agricultura es rentable; pero su dificultad mayor es el dinero, para realizar la compra de fertilizantes, pero tiene la convicción de sembrar frutos cítricos y café, paralelo a ello, realizar trabajos eventuales mientras llega la primera cosecha de su café, es consciente que tiene que esperar. Soledad pese a sus dificultades, ha tratado de pagar sus cuotas en forma muy puntual, y todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad, asiste a todas las reuniones programadas por el asesor, de crédito y este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantas de café, y la compra de fertilizantes para que pueda efectuar su sembrío.
texts.en:
Soledad is 26 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her two children and her sister in her mother's house. Years back she worked as a maid in the city of Lima. She had to return to Tarma because her daughter was sick. For the moment she decided to help her uncle out for 4 months in a restaurant. She starts work at 6 am and gets off at 4 pm. They pay her daily 15 Soles (about $5) and also give her lunch.

Soledad's goal is to plant on her family's land because she knows that agriculture is profitable. Her sister will help her to work the land. Her only problem is that she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. She is convinced that planting citrus fruits and coffee is the best choice. She will have to wait for her coffee to grow but in the mean time she will do other jobs. She know that it will take time for the coffee to grow.

Despite all of the difficulties that Soledad has faced, she has worked hard to make payments on her previous two loans on time. She has never been late on a payment and she attends all of the meetings and workshops to learn more about operating a business. This will be her third loan with MFP. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy coffee plants and fertilizer to promote a productive crop.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Coffee Plants and Fertilizer

loans.name: Ayaovi Amenyona

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce depuis 2005 le commerce de vêtement, le commerce de vêtement marche bien à lomé, parce que les jeunes aiment beaucoup s’habiller à lomé, il a une clientèle élevée c’est pour cela qu’il s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un crédit en vue de satisfaire la demande. Il  est marié et père de trois enfants, c’est avec ce qu’il gagne qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has been in commerce since 2005 selling clothing. Commerce in clothing does well in Lomé because young people like to dress up a lot in Lomé. He has a large number of customers. That’s why he is enquiring with WAGES for obtaining a loan, so as to satisfy the demand. He is married and the father of three. With what he earns, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Slra Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the SLRA (Sierra Leone Roads Authority) Makeni. SLRA was established in 1993 by an Act of Parliament charged with the responsibility of constructing and rehabilitating all roads, bridges and ferries in Sierra Leone. It is a civil engineering institution. SLRA Makeni is responsible for roads, bridges and ferries in Bombali, Koindadugu, part of Tonkolili and part of Kambia districts, in northern Sierra Leone. SLRA Makeni has a total of twenty-one staff. Over the years, SLRA Makeni has been able to construct many roads in the township of Makeni, making the town accessible to vehicles.  

This will be the second loan members of SLRA Makeni are requesting from SMT. Previously, only nine staff members applied for a loan from SMT. With the success of the previous loans to staff, six new members of staff were encouraged to join their colleagues in applying for a loan this time around. With a loan, staff members will be able to invest it in something needed and out of their monthly salaries, they will repay the loan. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs, other will use theirs to invest in business, some will invest theirs in a house-building project and others will use the loan to pay for their children's schooling.

Anthony S. K. (first from left) is a member of the three-man loan recovery committee and also head of security for SLRA Makeni. Anthony was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. He is age fifty-five, married to a teacher and they have four children together. Two of his children are in class six, one is in class five and the last is in class two. Anthony will use this loan in a house building project, to buy house building materials.

loans.use: To buy house building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of metal grilles on the doors and windows

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba N. est membre du groupe depuis 7 ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de commerce de mil, d’arachide, de poudre de tatouage et de haricots. Elle participe aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dieynaba N. has been a member of the group for seven years. She's requesting this loan to bolster her commerce in millet, peanuts, tattooing powder, and beans. She's helping to cover day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell millet, peanuts, beans, and powder for tatooing

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 11 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women who are members of this group have been linked by ties of neighbourhood for a long time. They are in a federal group made up of all the women in the town of Thiès. This group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to make administration easier. These sub-groups are created by the women themselves, based on affinity. They run various revenue-generating activities and support their husbands in taking care of their respective family expenses. The group finances itself through an internal tontine, but a loan through IMCEC allows for more significant financial means and a shorter delay in financing their businesses. The majority of them of have small displays at the central market in the town of Thiès, where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, fabric, etc.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local products at the weekly rural markets and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Ngorogoro Group

texts.en:
J. M., age 30, is married with two children, ages six and three and a half months. He has a furniture mart business which he started three years ago. He works daily from 7am until 7pm and he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $746.

This will be J.’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his business by buying more wood for his furniture business. He has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to increase his capital to buy more materials, like leather for sofa sets and vanish for wood.

J. will share this loan with his group, "Ngorongoro" which totals 18 members. Members will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, J. is second from right, in blue.

loans.use: Buy leather, cloth for sofas, vanish for wood.

loans.name: Arsacia

texts.en:
Mrs. Arsacia Z. D. R. is a small entrepreneuer who is 57 years old; she has been married for almost 40 years to Gumercindo R., who is a self-employed construction worker. Together they have 12 children, one of which passed away, leaving them with 11 – seven have their own familias, and the other four live with them. The youngest, 20 years old, is studying accounting at the National University. 

They moved from Asunción to the interior of the country about 20 years ago in seach of better opportunities and well-being for their family. They now are located in Villa Elisa, where Arsacia opted to work for herself and to open a small grocery store in her home. This way, she would be able to raise her children as well as work. 

Arsacia has a very well-established clientele, as she was one of the first grocery stores in the area. The loan she has taken out will be invested exclusively in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, rice, yogurt, cheese, meat, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a fabricar canaletes, las cuales que colocan en los techos de las casas en época de lluvia. Aprendió esta actividad de unas amistades cuando trabajaba como obrero y hoy, junto a su esposa (quien aparece en la foto) las fabrican y llevan a localidades aledañas para venderlas. Como primer paso, busca a sus clientes por las mañanas, mientras que su esposa va almacenando lo que se ha fabricado para tenerlo listo en el momento que se necesite llevarlo al cliente. Asimismo, ofrece sus canaletas a las principales tiendas ferreteras  de su barrio pactando cobrarles de manera semanal. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Jorge hacer progresar económicamente a su familia, por lo que ha decidido comprar más materia prima para seguir produciendo en mayor cantidad sus canaletas. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecho de formar parte de un grupo humano donde se siente bien integrado e identificado como es su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de fierros y calaminas que son los principales materiales que utiliza para la fabricación de las canaletes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house he owns. For the past six years, he has dedicated himself to fabricating gutters/water channels. These are placed on the roof of a home during the rainy season. He learned the trade from a friend, during a time when he worked as a laborer. Today, together with his wife (who appears in the photograph), he manufactures them and transports them to neighboring towns to sell. He first tries looking for customers in the mornings, while his wife organizes their goods and readies the product to be delivered to a customer at a moments’ notice. Likewise, he offers his product in his neighborhood’s hardware stores agreeing to charge on a weekly basis. This activity has allowed Jorge to support his family financially, a reason why he’s decided to buy more raw materials to produce his gutters in greater quantity. This is the third time he has taken a loan with MFP, and he is very gratified to be part of a group where he feels well-integrated as he does with his cooperative bank. The funds he is requesting will be used to buy metals and mill scale, the principal materials he needs to fabricate his product.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es madre de un niño de 5 años que ya empezó a estudiar, vive con su esposo, quien es contador y trabaja en una institución privada. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, negocio que no le era muy productivo porque lo hacía en su casa y ésta no estaba ubicada en una zona comercial. Por ello decidió empezar a vender productos de belleza y ropa, negocio que también duro poco tiempo, porque Yeny decidió ejercer la profesión que había estudiado, que es de secretaria ejecutiva y es en lo que actualmente se desempeña desde hace un año. Gracias a sus remuneraciones mensuales, pudo ahorrar, y hace 6 mese emprendió el negocio de la compra y venta de madera trabajada (listones y tablas), el mismo que se encuentra a cargo su hermano, quien es el encargado de comprar la madera en las riberas, traerla a un aserradero para la corten y esté listas para la venta. Yeny se siente muy contenta, porque puede trabajar y tener un negocio propio al mismo tiempo, donde le está yendo bien. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, aunque algunas veces tiene discrepancias con algún compañero, pero se logran superar. Sin embargo, un factor importante en el progreso de su grupo, es que son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más madera para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeny has a five year old son who has already started school. She lives with her husband, an accountant who works for a private institution. She previously sold food. The business was not very productive because she did this at her house, which is not located in a commercial area. She decided to start selling beauty products and clothes. That also lasted a short time because Yeny decided to practice the profession that she had studied. She has now been an executive secretary for one year. Thanks to her monthly salary, she was able to save. Six months ago she started a business of buying and selling lumber (batten trim and paneling). Her brother is in charge of the business. He buys the wood by the waterside, takes it to the saw mill to be cut, and then it is ready to sell. Yeny feels very happy because she is able to work and to have her own business at the same time. It is going well for her. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She likes working with her community bank. At times there are differences between members, but they are able to overcome them. Nevertheless, an important factor in the group’s progress is that they are punctual with their payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy wood to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en:
“Money from firewood”... Industry and hard work are the capital for Mrs. Lourgen M. who is 29 years of age, married, and a resident of P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with two children, both of whom are now in their elementary grades. Her husband is a poultry worker with an average income of not less than P150 a day.

Because of this situation, Lourgen decided to go into business in order to help her husband to raise their family. Now, she is earning an income from the sale of coconut sticks, “paluwa” in our local dialect, used as firewood. She started this business in January 2008 with an initial capital of P1,000 from her husband’s daily income and with the help of her neighbors as suppliers of the coconut firewood sticks. Now, she is earning an average net income of P1,000 a month which is very helpful for their family needs.

As a new member of Paglaum MPC, Lourgen is applying for a loan of P3,000 to add to her business capital. She is hoping that someday all her children can finish their studies up to college level.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una madre muy trabajadora, tiene 46 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña bebé, en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, actividad que consiste en arrendar sus máquinas de lavado a las personas que se lo solicitan, quienes se las llevan a sus casas para lavar sus prendas, por lo que le pagan a María un monto determinado, según el tiempo de alquiler y luego se la devuelven. Posteriormente, con un préstamo de MFP, María logró comprar otra lavadora y ahora tiene 5, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha, pues su negocio le resulta mucho más rentable. María está feliz porque sabe que poco a poco sus sueños se van haciendo realidad y ella espera poder alcanzarlos todos, por el bienestar de su pequeña hija y de su familia. Esta es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos, tal como lo hizo en el ciclo anterior. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará otra lavadora para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working mother of a small baby. She lives with her partner and father of her child in her own home. For the past 4 years she has rented washing machines. This activity consists in her renting washing machines to those who request them who take them to their homes for a determined amount of time and pay an agreed rental fee according to the time they will use them and then return the machines to her. With a previous MFP loan, Maria purchased an additional washing machine bringing her total to 5 which has brought her much satisfaction and increased profits. Maria is happy because she knows that her dreams are little by little coming true and she hopes to reach all her goals for the well-being of her daughter and her family. This will be her second loan with PRISMA Microfinances and she promisses to be very punctual with her repayments such as she was with her previous loan. With these funds she will purchase yet another washing machine to further grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: K. Véronique est née vers 1954. Véronique n’est  jamais allée à l’école ni appris un métier. Véronique vendait avec sa mère la pâte de maïs appelée localement akassa. Après son mariage, Véronique s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité. Mais en plus de la pâte de maïs, Véronique vend également le pétrole lampant. Véronique veut mieux développer son activité et la diversifier à la vente des articles chinois.  C’est pourquoi Véronique demande un crédit à ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Véronique K. was born around 1954. She has never been to school nor learnt a craft. Véronique and her mother sold corn paste, known locally as “akassa.” After her marriage, Véronique started her own business in the same line. However, in addition to corn paste, Véronique also sells kerosene. Véronique wants to expand and diversify her business by selling items from China. This is why she is asking for a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn, drums of kerosene and a few items from China

loans.name: Sandra Oralia

texts.es: Sandra Oralia L. C. de 47 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos en el departamento de San Salvador. Sandra es madre soltera tiene una hija llamada Flor de María quien es el orgullo de Sandra, Flor estudio un técnico y actualmente trabaja como organizadora de eventos, para Sandra ha sido un logro ver a su hija crecer y hacer de ella una mujer honesta y responsable, Sandra ha sacado a su hija adelante a través de su trabajos realizados de la confección de ropa a la medida, la cual tiene ubicada desde su casa, el crédito que Sandra solicita es para comprar tela para la producción de ropa.

loans.use: Comprar tela

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and she is married to Robert, a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Joey- 28 years old, a pastor; Janice- 26 years old, an Overseas Filipino Worker; and their youngest Jessa- 20 years old, a full-time house wife. They are residing in the village of La Paz, a rural area approximately two kilometers from the national highway of Cabatuan, Isabela.

Gloria has been a vendor of soy sauce and vinegar for almost two years, and she can earn a weekly net income of PHP3,500. Aside from that, she has also managed a junk shop business for almost three years with the help of her tribike (bicycle with a sidecar with three wheels). She wants her business to improve and for this reason, she is now asking to borrow PHP10,000 from KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great help for the maintenance and development of her two businesses.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending and junk shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chicken and traditional Mayan blouses

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
L. señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, tiene 64 años, es casada,  tiene 2 hijos, quienes cursan estudios superiores.  ElL. tiene estudios D. secundaria incompleta (tercero D. secundaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento ManueL. Ramos desD. hace 2 años, se dedica a  L. compra y venta ovinos desD. hace 10 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 con el que compró 02 ovinos, como esta actividad no es diaria también se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno y a L. agricultura para autoconsumo.

ElL. requiere un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa comprar 02 ovinos en L. feria D. Pilcuyo para luego venderlo en Ilave.

Le gusta ir a las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque tiene L. oportunidad D. ahorrar y compartir con sus compañeras.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios y sean útiles para L. sociedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira is a member of the Community Bank “Miraflores,” of the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 64 years old, is married, and has two children who focus on advanced studies. She completed part of her secondary school education (through the third year of secondary school). She has been working with the ManueL. Ramos Movement for 2 years, and has been dedicated to the buying and selling of sheep for 10 years. Her first loan was for $175 (500 Nuevas Soles) with which she bought 2 sheep. As this activity isn’t daily, she is also dedicated to the raising and selling of cattle and farming for her own family's consumption. She requires a loan of $225 (600 Nuevas Soles) in order to buy 2 sheep at the Pilcuyo fair that she will then resell in Ilave. She likes to go to the meetings of her Community Bank because she has the opportunity to save and share with her friends. Her greatest desire is that her children finish their studies and become useful contributors to society.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sheep

loans.name: Micaela Villegas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL MICAELA VILLEGAS
La Alcancía Comunal Micaela Villegas está ubicada en distrito del El Agustino, se encuentra representada por la Sra. Rossangel que es un socia muy optimista y responsable al igual que sus 10 integrantes.
La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, ya que por diversos inconvenientes aun no ha podido alquilar un puesto en el mercado, pero eso no se da por vencida, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo la cual ofrece a sus muchas clientes, eso la ayuda con sus gastos familiares. 
Vicente es un socio del grupo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de prendas de vestir hace muchos años, empezó desde muy joven, labor por el cual le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, ahora tiene un taller de confecciones en el cual trabaja con su familia, Como siempre el es muy entusiasta, desea continuar su trabajo para brindarle lo necesario a su familia aunque hay mucho camino por recorrer aún. 
El grupo se destaca por tener socios puntuales en sus pagos  ya que todos se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio y/o servicios con el cual pueden sustentar a su familia que es lo más importante para ellos. El crédito recibido será destinado para la compra de productos e insumos que le ayudan  a incrementar sus ganancias, además aprovechar la campaña navideña, siempre se vende un poquito más, manifiestan los integrantes.
texts.en:
The Micaela Villegas Communal Bank is located in the district of El Agustino. The group is led by Sra. Rossangel, one of the 10 members who display optimism and responsibility.

Rossangel sells clothing by order. Due to several setbacks, she still has not been able to rent a stall in the market. However, she does not give up. She also sells beauty products by catalog and offers her merchandise to many of her customers. The income she generates helps with the family expenses.

Vincent is a member of the group who has been manufacturing and selling garments for many years. He started working at a young age. His jobs have brought him much satisfaction. He now has a clothing shop where he works alongside his family. Vincent is always enthusiastic and desires to continue working so that he can meet his family’s needs. However, there is still a long road ahead.

The members of the group are known for making their payments on time. They all engage in various trades and services in order to support their families, who are of great importance to them. The loan they receive will be used to purchase products and supplies to help boost their profits during the Christmas season. During this time of year, the members say they sell a little more than usual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Jullian

texts.en:
Jullian T. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 27 years old. Jullian is married with children. To make a living, Jullian owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jullian earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Jullian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jullian is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jullian from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rasida

texts.en: Rasida is 42 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband sells tires to make a living. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs like elubo (yam or plantain flour). Elubo is made from dried yam or plantain. It is used in the preparation of amala, which is a local delicacy that is eaten with Nigerian soup. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Group

texts.es:
15 son las integrantes del grupo Nueva Asunción, que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Panamericana, liderizadas por su presidenta, Luisa M., su tesorera Silveria H. y la Secretaria de Actas Nelly S.,  llevan adelante su reunión poniendose de acuerdo en el reglamento interno. Se agruparon recientemente por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita incrementar su mercadería en los negocios que se dedican a la comercialización. Comprar materia prima en el caso de negocios de producción o algún activo fijo.
Todas esperan estar mucho tiempo junto hasta lograr ahorros considerables.
texts.en:
Fifteen of the members of the group “Nueva Asuncion” belong to the Panamerican Focal Center that is lead by their president, Luisa M.. The treasurer is Silveria H. and the secretary is Nelly S.. The members are moving forward with their meetings by establishing internal group rules. They recently established their group because of their common need to raise working capital that will allow them to increase the inventory in their businesses. The members that produce a product would like to buy more raw materials. They all hope to be together for a long time, until they achieve a lot of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw material.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Nelida vende DVD, en un local propio, además vende útiles escolares, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD y útiles.
Los sueños de Nelida son implementar una sala de grabación y surtir con otros productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is 42 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children. She sells DVDs in her own place of business. In addition, she sells school supplies, and she carries out this activity every day along with her husband. Nelida needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of DVDs and school supplies. Nelida dreams of being able to establish a recording studio, and being able to stock her business with other products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy DVDs and school supplies

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn C., age 25, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has a young child. She is employed at a local garment factory in the province, earning approximately $2.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2005. Her husband operates a business of transporting goods to sell everywhere in the province, earning an income of $6 per day. The standard of living has been improved since C. has been with this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her husband's business. 

C. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more goods for her husband to expand his business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expand the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita L. Fernandez es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya, ella es una mujer trabajadora, posee una despensa en donde invierte los créditos que le otorga la Fundación para mantener constantemente con todas las mercaderías que el cliente necesita.
Ella vive en el Barrio Arroyo Pora del distrito de Cambyreta de la ciudad de Encarnación. El destino del crédito fue para la compra de mercaderías para aumentar su stock de su despensa, ella administra muy bien su despensa ya según ella es prácticamente el sostén de la casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita L. Fernandez is a repeat client of the Fundación Paraguaya. She is a very hardworking woman who owns a general store in which she invests the loans that receives from the Fundación in order to keep a steady flow of goods that her customers need. She lives in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood of the Cambyreta district, in the city of Encarnación. This loan will be used to purchase goods to restock her general store. She manages her shop well because according to her, she is practically the household's only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, bread, cooking oil, sausages, and other goods

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María Cruz tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo ya a sus tres hijos en el sector Muy Finca, una zona rural netamente dedicada a labores agrícolas y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especificamente aves de corral. Ella cría mayormente pavos en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitan regularmente el lugar. Este negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos diarios del hogar, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

María Cruz desea mejorar la calidad de las aves que comercializa para así poder obtener mayores ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y que siempre entrega todo de si para sacar adelante a los suyos. Las personas que la conocen la estiman mucho y la consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
María Cruz, 40, is married and living with her husband and their three children in the Muy Finca area, a rural community dedicated to agricultural work, located in the Mochumí district, Lambayeque Province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Her business is raising and selling small animals, specifically penned birds. She mainly raises turkeys in pens located in the rear part of her house, and sells them to the businesspersons who come regularly to this place. This business helps her to take care of the daily household expenses, since her husband's income as an agricultural worker are not sufficient to cover them. María Cruz hopes to improve the quality of the birds that she sells, in order to earn greater profits. For this reason, she sees the need of requesting a loan of $300 for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to purchase a balanced feed in order to achieve her objective. She is quite a responsible woman who always gives 100% of herself to get her family ahead. The people who know her think very highly of her, considering her somebody they can put their trust in.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Ednalyn Macabasag Group

texts.en: "Health is wealth" is the principle in the life of Ednalyn M.. Ednalyn owns and operates a store selling food products including fish and snacks in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Isca Gonzaga, Cagayan. Ednalyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ednalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ednalyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. Ednalyn is the leader of a 13 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Ednalyn M.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou D. est une commerçante qui exploite de l'huile de palme venu de la casamance sa region natale situé au sud du Sénégal pour être revendu dans le marché mbourois .Elle est a son second crédit ainsi celui ci va entrer dans lerenforcement de ses activités pour générer davantages de profit ce qui lui permettrait de soutenir son mari  dans la gestion familiale
texts.en:
Madam Aissatou D. is a retailer who trades on palm oil from Casamance, her native region located in the south of Senegal to be sold in the Mbour market. She is on her second credit which will go into strengthening her business inorder to generate more profit which would enable her to support her husband in managing the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of palm oil

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mamie D. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called United Sisters. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who range from 13 to 18 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because of poverty.

For a year, Mamie has been selling charcoal at the ELWA community in Paynesville, Liberia. Her nice manner of approach keeps her customers returning. Mamie started selling charcoal with a little cash that was given to her by her husband. However, she sometimes faces problems with a shortage of capital to buy more charcoal.

Mamie plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to expand her business and cater more to her children in their schooling, medical needs and nutrition.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Yeng Nhanh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people who are located in Roliek village in Takeo province. Mrs. Yeng N. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yeng N. is a farmer who owns two hectares (5 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Korn Keov, is a rice middleman and he alS. charges batteries for a fee.

Since her husband’s business is going well Mrs. Yeng N. wants to expand it. S., to improve his business, she is requesting loan to buy more rice to resell.

Mrs. Yeng N. is the mother of two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her husband's business

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
Annie N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Success. She is 36 years old, married and has five children, who range from 3 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to financial constraints. All of her children are attending school.

For more than six years, she has been selling oil, salt and onions at VOA Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more gallons of oil, salt, onions and rice. She describes herself as a quiet woman.

Her plan is to improve her business and move from selling on a table to a shop.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil, salt, onions and rice

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Hayde C. is a widow who lives in Shopping, Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  RTW (ready-to-wear) and frozen foods businesses. 

Hayde joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she wished for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Hayde has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy additional frozen foods and stocks for her RTW businesses so that she can continue to save up for expanding them. Hayde C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Keom E's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keom E V. is 48 years old and is a group leader of the loan having been selected by its four members which located in Preak Run village, Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this group will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose. 
Mrs. Keom E V. is farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate vegetable and rice. Aside from farmer, she is also vegetable seller in the local market who is able to earn a small income to support her four children. Mrs. Keom E V. now will uses the loan that asked from AMK to buy more vegetable to sell and to buy Zinc for her roof. Mrs. Keom E V. is widow with four children, three are seamstresses in the garment factory while another one is student.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to sell and to buy Zinc for her roof. Mrs.

loans.name: Mahanaim Group

texts.es:
Mahanaim es un grupo conformado por 14 personas que aparte de llevar una buena amistad tienen algo en común, todos dedican su vida a Dios. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Víctor Fidel R. C. (Taxi), Beatriz O. C. (Venta de Piñatas). Raquel C. Álvarez (Representante-Perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo), Leticia García C. (Tratamientos Faciales por catalogo), Aquilina Z. Hernández (cosméticos por catalogo), Juan José R. C. (Venta de playeras y pantalones), Olivia García C. (Renta de madera), Alejandra Sánchez O. (Venta de Dulces y Frituras), Zeferina Hernández Hernández (Venta de arreglos florales), Rosa María B. Juárez (Venta de Piñatas), María Magdalena Juárez L. (Venta de carne), Sara Z. Hernández (Venta de macetas y plantas), Catalina Z. Hernández (Tienda de ropa) y Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (Venta de dulces).

Rosa María de 33 años de edad con una familia conformada por sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas, ya que su familia se ha dedicado a este oficio durante mucho tiempo y a ella le fue gustando el trabajo. Al principio le fue difícil hacerse de sus clientes ya que iba comenzando, así que decidió armar un catalogo con las diferentes figuras para mostrarlas y así la gente fuera conociendo su trabajo, con su perseverancia ha logrado que sus piñatas sean vendidas en los centros comerciales y en dulcerías, sus ventas incrementan en las fiestas decembrinas y  bajan un poco a principios de año pero para ella esto no es motivo como para dejar de echarle ganas y seguir trabajando. Sus planes son poder expandir su negocio y que mas gente conozca el trabajo que realiza. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de materiales como; papel de diferentes colores, pegamento, cartón, etc. Y obtener un poco mas de ganancias para invertir en los estudios de sus hijos.

Mahanaim agradece el apoyo brindado que recibe de Kiva por parte de Fundación Realidad ya que esto les ayudara a cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
Mahanaim is a group of 14 people who, along with a great friendship, have something else in common: they all dedicate their lives to God. The group is located in the community of Valle de Chalco in the State of Mexico. The members are: Víctor Fidel R. C. (taxi service), Beatriz O. C. (piñata sales), Raquel C. Álvarez (perfume and cosmetic sales by catalog), Leticia García C. (facial treatment sales by catalog), Aquilina Z. Hernández (cosmetic sales by catalog), Juan José R. C. (t-shirt and pants sales), Olivia García C. (wood sales), Alejandra Sánchez O. (sweets and fried food sales), Zeferina Hernández Hernández (floral arrangement sales), Rosa María B. Juárez (piñata sales), María Magdalena Juárez L. (meat sales), Sara Z. Hernández (plant and flowerpot sales), Catalina Z. Hernández (clothing store), and Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (candy sales). Rosa María is 33 years old, with a family made up of three school-age children. She has been making piñatas for four years, as this was something her family has been doing for a long time and she enjoyed the work. At the beginning it was difficult to bring in customers since she was just starting, so she decided to equip herself with a catalog of the different figures, which she could show to customers. This way, people could get to know her work. Through perseverance, she has succeeded in having her piñatas sold in commercial centers and candy shops. Her sales increase during the December holidays and drop a bit at the beginning of the year, but for her this is no reason to lose motivation and she keeps working. Her plans are to expand her business and to have more people know her work. She will use the requested loan to buy materials like different colors of tissue paper, glue, cardboard, etc., and to bring in a little more income to invest in her children's education. Mahanaim is grateful for the the support offered by Kiva through Fundación Realidad, as it will help them to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tissue paper of various colors, glue, cardboard, ribbon, sweets, fried foods, flowers, and cosmetics

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Shakir

texts.ru:
Shakir Jivet v Fuzuli Regione. Shakir M. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , Doch 18 let uchitsya v universitete i sin 13 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya nacionalnimi tancami. 

Shakir uje 8 let kak rabotayet v etom maqazine. Etomu biznesu eqo nauchil brat kotoriy toje imeyet svoy maqazin po eqo sovetu i Shakir otkril sebe maqazin. Seychas Shakir nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi uvelichit pomesheniye v svoyom maqazine. Po eqo slovam maqazin malenkiy i on ne mojet pomeshat tuda noviye tovari.
texts.en:
Shakir M. lives in the Fuzuli region. Shakir is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. His daughter, 18 years old, studies at the university, and his 13-years old son goes to school and also learns traditional dancing. Shakir has been working in this store for eight years already. His brother who keeps a store taught him this business, and it was on his brother’s advice that Shakir opened his own store too. At present Shakir needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to expand his store space. He says that that the store is too small and space for new goods is lacking.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding the store space

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en:
Philiph has a dairy farm on the outskirts of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been managing his farm for four years and has employed one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local hotels. He also earns income from the sale of tea and from his masonry business.

Philiph has requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his income will increase and enable him to meet the needs of his family. He plans to acquire more dairy cows, going from the current three to five, and build a modern dairy unit in future. His primary challenges have been animal diseases and the lack of good markets for milk.

Philiph is 49 years old. He is married with 6 children who are between the ages of 2 and 24. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fikiri

texts.en:
Fikiri C. is a 24 year old single man who operates a retail shop in Kilifi. Fikiri has been doing this business for two years and it has been doing well. He also owns a motorcycle for transport purposes and has employed someone to operate it.

This marks his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more stock of sugar and rice for his shop. He hopes to use the anticipated profit for restocking and for his daily living costs. His transport business is also doing well and operates in Kituoni village in Kilifi. He hopes to fully expand his business to cater for his needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra se dedica a una pulpería. Ella dio inicio hace más de 8 años comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo muy pocos productos por lo que además se dedica a la venta de guirilas con cuajada por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de interactuar con sus diferentes clientes que llegan a su vivienda. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para lograr sacar adelante su vivienda.  Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas entre otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Sandra is dedicated to a small retail store. She started more than 8 years ago when she began the effort selling a few products. She also sells guirilas, a pancake made of corn, because she has always liked to be a hard worker and enjoys interacting with her different customers who arrive at her home. This is not the first time she requests a loan to improve her house. This credit is for the purchase of raw material such as basic grains, detergents, and candy, among other necessary things.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sergio Ali

texts.es: El Señor Sergio Ali se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, este negocio le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. Este negocio lo inicio por una hija que le ayudo con esta actividad, pues ha sido con mucho esfuerzo que ha logrado seguir adelante. El señor aduce, que gracias a Dios su negocio ha estado muy rentable, por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que han atacado a su familia y a él ultimadamente. Actualmente, su sueño más anhelado es tener su propia granja de crianza de cerdos.
texts.en: Mr. Sergio Ali works buying and selling pigs. This business has helped him earn money to supply the basics for his family. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy more pigs. He started this business with the help of his daughter and with a lot of effort he has been able to get ahead. Mr. Ali says that thanks to God his business has been very profitable and his only problem has been the illnesses that he and his family have suffered. His greatest dream is to have his own farm where he can raise pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 53 años, su actividad económica es un pequeño kiosco. Hace más de 8 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 2 hijos que ya son independiente y ayudan a Maria en lo que pueden con el negocio, por lo que las compras de sus productos tiene que hacerlos en el mercado pues así los compra a un precio más accesible. Con el financiamiento comprara golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos, helados entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora is 53 years old and her business is a small kiosk.  She has been working at her kiosk for more than 8 years.  She began in this business because she didn't have a job and wasn't earning a wage which would help her to cover her household expenses.  She also has 2 children who are no longer dependent on her and help Maria as much as they can with the business.  For this reason, products have to be purchased in the market as that way they can be bought at a more affordable price.  With this loan she will buy candies, bread, cookies, juice, soft drinks and ice creams amongst other things.  She dreams of improving her business activity and getting ahead.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea H., a 46-year-old married woman, is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members. They are living in Lvea Sa Kraom village, in Kandal province. With the loans, the members will use the money to support their different purposes.

Chea H. and her husband, Mr. Kong Rorn, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. They need assistance with this venture, so Chea H. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and oil for cultivating rice. 

This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other one is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and oil for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna A. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Reyna is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Reyna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of bananas & coconuts in the local community. Reyna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Reyna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reyna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Reyna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Reyna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for resale

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra S. is from the village of Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Isidra is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Isidra owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice and cassava cakes in the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Isidra is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour & eggs. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Isidra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand  her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients like  flour & eggs

loans.name: Viriginia

texts.en: Viriginia R. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bungtod, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general store) and a boarding house. Her husband, Elpidio R., age 48, works as a construction worker to earn his living. They have six children who are 9 to 27 years old. Two of her children are working and four are currently going to school. Viriginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Viriginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Viriginia R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Emmanuel 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Guillermina is the coordinator of her group, Emmanuel 1, 2 & 3.
