Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Guillermina's group is located in the rural communities surrounding El Seybo, a rural town where agriculture dominates the economy and where running water — none of which is potable — and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband. They have raised four children together.

Guillermina is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business considerably. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing sugar, coconut, and milk to produce sweet, local candies. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business with the dream of one day owning her own candy shop from which to sell home-maD. candies and pastries. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, and coconut for candies

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma A. is married and has four children, two of whom attend school while two graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a coconut and mango selling business for the past 11 years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. With the 20,000 KHS loan, she wants to pay rent for her shop and purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay rent for her shop business and purchase sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 33-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: buying and selling firewood. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

 Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to purchase more firewood to sell so that she can continue to save up for future for her child and family needs. Alma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy colored stones

loans.name: Khayralah

texts.ar: خيرالله في عمر 24 سنة يعمل في صنع وبيع مواد التنظيف له في عمله 8 سنوات متجول يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لتصنيع مواد التنظيف وزيادة البضائع له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه عمله متقن وجيد يحب ان يطور عمله بحيث يستطيع ان يبيع بالجملة
texts.en: Khayrala is 24 years old and works in the selling of cleaning materials. He has 8 years experience from other various places of emploment. He loves his business and wants to develop it and secure a good future for himself. With this loan he wants to buy raw materials to make cleaning products as well as purchase more stock. He has customers from his locality and from his neighbours and relatives. He does his work well and with excellence and hopes to develop and expand to enter the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and purchase more stock for his cleaning products sales business

loans.name: Maysoun

texts.en:
Maysoun is a young woman from Jineen, married to Hmaza and the mother of three daughters and three sons. Maysoun wants build an extension and make it a room for the sons as the house is becoming small for a big family.

Maysoun took out a loan from FATEN to pay for part of the building expenses. Maysoun's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Maysoun appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to build a room next to her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and is married without children. Christine sells shoes in her market, and her business is well-organized. Christine employs one person to help her and she works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. She has ten years of experience.

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes for sale. With the profits, Christine will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Kezie

texts.en: Kezie is a mother of 3 children who are between 1 and 3 years old.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Kezie sells different kinds of fish, including both big and small fish. This business has enabled her feed her children as well as buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to  make more profit and enable her to develop herself.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
ClotilD. madre D. familia D. 68 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijas; que son independientes, la cual cuenta con el servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito La Matanza que pertenece a la provincia D. Morropón y está a una distancia D. 20 minutos, y a una hora aproximadamente del departamento D. Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

ClotilD. se dedica a la comercialización D. chicha D. jora (bebida realizada a base D. maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla) y D. harina D. maíz, lo prepara en su mismo domicilio, actividad que realiza desD. hace 10 años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, D. esta manera ella se ayuda a tener más ingresos económicos, su esposo es agricultor, su jornal es diario y poco, por eso necesita otras formas para tener dinero.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando la chicha D. jora que venD. y la harina D. maíz, los pedidos  que le hacen le permite tener mayores ganancias, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente,  para poder pagar su cuota mensual y D. paso mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.  ClotilD. desea que más adelante su negocio crezca para seguir ayudando a sus hijas y brindarles mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
ClotilD. is a 68 year old mother and wife. She lives in her own home with her husband and daughters, who are grown. Her house has electricity and running water and is located in the district of  La Matanza, which belongs to the province of Morropón and is approximately an hour an 20 minutes from the department of Piura.  In this area, there is a lot of farming activity, cattle raising and artisanal crafts. 

ClotilD. sells chicha D. jora (a beverage maD. with a corn meal base, fermented and later mixed with other ingredients until its ready for consumption) and corn meal. She prepares the drink in her own house, and has done it for 10 years. She offers it to people who know her and in this way is able to have more income. Her husband is a farmer and he works daily, but not very much. That is why she needs other ways to make money.  

She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 nuevos soles in order to buy ingredients to keep making the chicha D. jora that she sells as well as corn meal. The orders she is making are so she can have more earnings, since her clientele has increased considerably. It is also to be able to make her monthly payments and improve her family's quality of life. In the future, ClotilD. wants her business to grow to keep helping her daughters and to offer them better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make chicha de jora, as well as corn meal.

loans.name: Analle

texts.en:
Analle Limbas is from the village of P-4 Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analle runs a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. 

Analle has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Analle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Analle is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase more products for her general store. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Analle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI II est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de NIKANKAN sous préfecture  de Kimparana région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du haricot.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne.
HAWA, debout au milieu, compte utilise  son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels  des frais de labour et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de KIMPARANA  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de MORIBILA  SAN,  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 32000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en: Benkadi II is a group of married women from the village of Nikankan, in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana of Segou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They live in traditional families.  They are 38 years old on average and have at least 4 children.  They cultivate peanuts and beans.  With the intention of making their agricultural concerns profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program four years ago. After having fully repaid their previous loans, they are on their fourth country loan.  Hawa, standing in the center, expects to use their loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, some light equipment, labor costs and agricultural fertilizers for cultivation exclusively at the big market in Kimparana city.  After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for a certain amount of time so that they gain value before being sold at the big market in Moribila San and in the surrounding markets at retail (or often wholesale) for cash to a customer base generally coming from the big cities.  The members of the group expect to each make a profit of 32,000 to 35,000 FCFA after the harvest of their agricultural products, which will be used to pay the interest on their loans and their families' current expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, light equipment and labor.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Tiene educación secundaria. 
La señora trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de ovinos y vacunos.
También se dedica a la artesanía con hilos de alpaca natural, a la fabricación de chompa, chalina, accesorios y animalitos.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, dinero utilizará para comprar una vaca premiada o siete corderos, dice  que a veces lo compra y lo vende al instante, otras veces las compra para su engorde.
En el negocio le ayuda su esposo, quien trabaja en construcción.
Su sueño es salir fuera de la ciudad, llevar carne a otros departamentos y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Tatania is a member of the Virgen de Concepción Communal Bank located in C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the district of Acora, province and department of Puno.  She is 24 years old and is in a common-law relationship.  She has two children and has a high school education.  

Tatania has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  She invested her first loan of S./ 500.00 nuevos soles in her sheep and cattle selling business. She is also an artisan and uses natural alpaca yarn to make sweaters, scarves, accessories, and stuffed animals.  

Now, she is requesting a new loan of S./ 1500.00 nuevos soles and will use the money to buy a prizewinning cow or seven lambs. She says sometimes she buys the animals and sells them instantly, and other times she buys them for fattening.

She helps her husband, who is in the construction business.  Her goal is to bring her meat to other departments outside the city, and in this way, improve her profits.  She likes the Communal Bank because of the punctuality and responsibility among the members.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
She is 28 years old and married. She has five children and her children go to school. 

She is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapples and apples. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her small business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Luis Leonardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 70 años de edad el es casado y vive con su esposa y su hijo los cuales viven en casa propia, ellos residen en el distrito de José Leonardo O. un distrito tranquilo , a pocos minutos del centro de Chiclayo.

Luis se dedica a la venta de carnes en el primer sector del mercado Mochoqueque un mercado mayorista del distrito y uno de los más grandes de toda la provincia   de Chiclayo. El cuenta con una experiencia de  más de 8  años y un  buen manejo de su negocio 

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar continuamente carne en mayores cantidades, de esta manera aumentar su nivel de distribucion y por consiguiente obtener mayores ingresos

Luis es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por las personas que le conocen, pues lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis is 70 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son.  They live in their own home, in José Leonardo O. district.  This is a quiet district, a few minutes from the center of Chiclayo.

Luis sells meat in the first division of Moshoqueque market.  Moshoqueque market is a wholesale market in the district.  It is one of the biggest in the whole of Chiclayo province.  Luis has more than eight years experience and he runs his business well.

Luis is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can continually buy meat in larger quantities in order to increase his distribution level and, consequently, make more income.

Luis is quite a well known person who is liked by the people who know him as they consider him to be a responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy meat in larger quantities

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 52 years old, married and has two children. She owns a clothing sales business at Thika. She has been running this business for four years now and has two employees. Rahab intends to use her loan to purchase more clothes to grow her business while meeting the demands of her customers. She hopes to open another clothing sales business within Thika town. She describes herself as focused and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past four years Agnes has had a small shop where she sells soft drinks, water and other daily use items.

Agnes is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC which will be used to purchase more shop inventory for resale.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and so pay school fees for her children. In the future, Agnes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shop inventory for resale.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: La Sra. Juana  es casada, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Juana  trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de prendas de vestir ( polos, pantalones, camisa, blusas) este negocio surge porque Juana tenia 4 hijos y el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos , alimentación, educación y pagos de servicios,  es así que Juana empezó vendiendo ropa a  domicilio y con el tiempo puso  una tienda de ropa,  Juana nos cuenta que nada fue fácil trabajo muy duro para obtener lo hoy en día tiene  ,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos fueron a la escuela, ha construido su casa, y su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería(polos, pantalones, camisa, blusas), Sabemos que Juana  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Juana  is married and has 4 children. She is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank made up of 7 members who work in diverse activities as merchants. For 15 years, Juana has worked selling clothing (t-shirts, pants, shirts, and blouses). She started the business because Juana has 4 children and her husband's salary wasn't enough to cover basic expenses such as food, schooling, and utilities. That's why Juana started selling clothes door to door and after a while she opened a store. Juana tells us that it wasn't easy getting what she has today. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has been able to have better income. Her children have gone to school, she built a house and her family has a better quality of life. In order to keep growing, she has asked for a new loan to buy merchandise (t-shirts, pants, shirts and blouses). We know that Juana will meet her goals with a lot of work and dedication and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pants, blouses and t-shirts).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, esta felizmente casada y tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos a quienes quiere dar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la animación de fiesta infantiles, y de otros eventos. Asimismo posee un negocio en donde vende artículos para fiestas, desde piñatas y disfraces para toda ocasión, así como el servioc de la preparación de buffets. Lleva casi un año en la venta de estos artículos pero en cuanto al trabajo e aniamción de fiestas lleva toda su vida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo, además que es sociia de dos amigas y entre ellas se ayudan, por ello desea que este negocio crezca más. Ahora su prioridad es ampliar su local de venta, para abarrotarlo de más artículos y disfraces. Este será el tercer préstamo y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará telas, accesorios, materiales para hacer disfraces y arreglar sus calzados que utiliza para sus presentaciones.
texts.en: Patricia is 30. She is a very happy and enterprising woman. She is happily married and has her own home where she lives with her husband and their three young children. She wants to give her children a better quality of life. Patricia's job consists of providing entertainment for children's parties and other events. She has her own business where she sells various items for parties, from piñatas to costumes, and provides services preparing buffets. She has been selling these items for almost a year, but she has worked in party entertainment all her life. What she likes about her work is being able to control her schedule, and the fact that she has partnered with two friends and they help each other. She wants her business to grow more. Now her priority is to expand her location, in order to stock it with more items and materials for making costumes. She wants to fix the shoes that she uses for parties.

loans.use: to buy items and fabrics for costumes, and to fix her outfits for children's parties.

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: Evelyn Carolina: de 29 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias desde hace varios años ella nos cuenta que en esta fecha son muy especiales en el pueblo y es cuando ella tiene muchos pedidos en el pueblo de sus clientes es asi como ella logra ayudar a sus padres y desea seguir ayudando por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de variedades en sandalias y estilos,el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y seguir ayudando a su padres.
texts.en: Evelyn Carolina, who is 29 year old, has made her living selling sandals for a number of years.  She tells us that at this time they are in high demand in her town, which is when she has a lot of orders from her customers.  This is how she is able to help out her parents.  She hopes to continue helping them, which is why she is requesting the loan: to purchase a variety of sandal styles.  Her dream is to have a larger store and to continue helping her parents.

loans.use: to purchase sandals in a variety of styles.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 27 años de edad está casado con el señor Fabián desde hace 9 años juntos han procreado a cuatro hijos Lizet de de 8 años que está en tercer de primaria, Evelyn de siete años de edad que está cursando segundo año de primaria, Alex de cuatro años aun no va a la escuela y Miguel que es el más pequeño  de dos años.

Su esposo vende controles para T.V. para DVD, antenas de todo tipo, rastrillos desde hace 13 años, esta vez han solicitado el crédito para comprar más producto del mismo tipo pero para ella sola ya que solo le ayudaba a su esposo ahora ella se quiere independizar para poder elevar sus ganancias ya que los gastos están fuertes entre escuela y hogar.

Ella venderá en la plaza cuatro días a la semana sábados, domingos, lunes y martes. Por el momento su inicio desafío es que los placeros no los dejan vender a gusto y tienen que salir corriendo con la mercaría. Su esperanza es que a ella le vaya mucho mejor que su esposo ya que le gustaría ayudar con los gastos y mejorar su vivienda. “Estoy muy agradecida con el apoyo ya que es de gran ayuda porque podre poner mi puestito aparte”
texts.en:
Carolina is 27 years old and has been married to Sr. Fabián for nine years. They have four children: Lizet is eight years old and in the third grade, Evelyn is seven years old and in the second grade, Alex is four years old and has not started school, and Miguel is the youngest at two years of age.

Her husband has been selling remote controls for televisions and DVD players, antennas of all types, and rakes for 13 years. This time she is requesting a loan to buy more of these same types of products, but for herself. Carolina was the only one helping her husband, but now she wants to be independent so that she can generate more income for school and household expenses.

She sells in the town square four days a week: Saturdays, Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays. At the moment, her initial challenge is that the street vendors do not sell what people like so they must go directly to the market. Her hope is that she does much better than her husband since she likes helping with the expenses and improving her home. Carolina says, “I am very grateful for the support because it will be a great help in making my small sales post stand out from the rest.”

loans.use: to buy remote controls, antennas, and rakes.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Carmen has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods and soap. 

In the future Carmen would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with seven children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Evelyn is a farmer and she is also a copra producer [dried coconut meat used for oil production]. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns 21,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer for copra.

Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to support the finish of her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for copra

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, este surgió por la necesidad de tener ingresos, trabajando todos los días para atender la clientela.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de 4 quintales de maíz, este préstamo le ayudara para tener suficiente materia prima para preparar la venta.
El objetivo de María, es abrir las puertas con los préstamos, para crecer con el negocio y poder mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: María sells tortillas.  She lives with her husband.  She’s been in this business for a long time.  It arose from her need to ear income.  She works taking care of customers every day. She’s asking for a loan at present to buy 4 quintals of corn.  This loan will help her have enough raw materials on hand for sales. María’s hope is to open doors with the loan to grow in business and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy 4 quintals of corn.

loans.name: Kipngeno Bett

texts.en: Kipngeno is a 39-year-old married man. He has four children aged between nine and fifteen. He describes himself as ambitious, determined, and focused. He operates a retail store where he sells fuel. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in Mauche shopping center in Nakuru town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to buy fuel. Kipngeno will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy fuel. His business goal is to run a petrol station at Mauche shopping center within five years.

loans.use: to buy 50 liters of petrol, 30 liters of diesel, and 20 liters of kerosene.

loans.name: Duo Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es: Duo Lluvia D. oro,este duo esta formado por unas personas que dia a dia luchan por salir adelante,tal es el caso D. doña Estefana,D. 40 años D. edad,ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos desD. hace 24 años,es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito para la copra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,al igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos tipicos,estan muy agradeciodas por la ayuda que se les pueda brindar.
texts.en: The Lluvia D. Oro group is maD. up of two people who struggle every day to get ahead.  Estefana is 40 years old.  She says that she has worked making traditional fabrics for 24 years.  She is asking for this loan to purchase materials to make fabric.  The other group members is also asking for this loan to purchase materials to make traditional fabrics.  They are very thankful for the support that they have been given.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Juliana Andrea

texts.es: La señora Juliana a sus 19 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 9 meses de nacido, desde temprana edad aprendió de un amigo a vender mercancía, fue así como en el año 2009  inició su propio negocio vendiendo de manera independiente cosméticos, lociones, fragancias y maquillaje. La señora Juliana requiere de la compra de productos para la salud y belleza que le permitan tener mejor surtido, aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Juliana es tener su propio local y ver crecer a su bebé.
texts.en: Miss Juliana is 19 years old and mother of a nine-month old son.  At an early age, she learned from a friend how to sell merchandise. This was how, in 2009, she began her own business of independently selling cosmetics, lotions, fragrances, and make-up.  Miss Juliana wants to purchase more health and beauty products in order to increase her inventory and thus increase her sales and improve her family's quality of life.  Juliana's dream is to have her own business property and watch her baby grow.

loans.use: purchase merchandise, such as lotion, cosmetics, make-up, and shampoo.

loans.name: Heidi Patricia

texts.es:
Heidi es una joven microempresaria de 33 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años es cliente de nuestra institución,y ha adquirido varios préstamos que le han servido en el desarollo de su actividad. Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar un vehículo que le permite llevar su mercadería hasta sus clientes , teniendo más facilidades para movilizarse y llevar  la mercadería que distribuye:ropa, tennis,perfumes, y otros articulos para las necesidades de sus clientes.
 Generalmente en sus viajes la acompaña su pequeña hija de tres años, y de esta forma no tiene que dejarla al cuidado de otras personas,aunque el proximo año podrá matricularla en el kinder y así estarán más cómodas y felices en sus ocupaciones, y Heidi tendrá más facilidad para hacer su trabajo. Su hijo mayor también la ayuda mucho cuando no tiene que ir a la escuela, pues sale con ella , y lleva la mercadería a los clientes y realiza los cobros , bajo la supervisión de su mamá.
 Junto a sus hijos y su esposo, Heidi se ha estado desarrollando como una mujer empresaria , muy trabajadora y esforzada, espera poder tener su casa propia y que su negocio siga creciendo para beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Heidi is a young 33-year-old entrepreneur. She is married with two children.
She has been a client of our institution for eight years, and has taken out several loans which have helped her to develop her business. With her previous loan, she was able to buy a vehicle for transporting her merchandise to her customers. This gave her more mobility for transporting her merchandise: clothing, tennis shoes, perfume, and other items to cover her customers' needs.
Her little three-year-old daughter normally goes with her on her trips. This way, Heidi doesn't have to leave her in someone else's care. Next year, her daughter will be in kindergarten; this will make it easier for both of them. Heidi's oldest son helps out a lot when he doesn't have school. He goes with her, brings merchandise to the customers, and takes payments under his mother's supervision.
Along with her husband and children, Heidi has been growing as a businesswoman. She is very hard-working. In the future she hopes to have her own home, and she hopes that her business will continue to grow for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as tennis shoes, perfume, clothing and other personal care items.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is a 27-year-old guy who is the father of two children and lives with his family in a local ger (nomadic tent) district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter attends secondary school while his spouse cares for their son who is only 3 years old. 

Since 2008, Boldbaatar has supported his family by operating a computer services business in the local area of the city. His daily duty is to provide computer services such as printing, text typing and etc. During the school season his business is very popular when students take finals and write reports. 

Thus, he is requesting a 1.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase some necessary computer equipment.

loans.use: to purchase some computer equipment

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es:
Ruth Mery tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Ruth Mery se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y damas, ella vende de forma ambulatoria en uno de las calles más concurridas en la ciudad del Cusco. Ruth Mery requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa como buzos, medias, chompas, pantalones y otras cosas que se le agotaron. 

El banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ruth Mery, 29, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She was born in Cusco department of Cusco and she lives in the beautiful city of her birth.  Ruth Mery sells children’s and women’s clothing as a street merchant on one of the busiest streets of Cusco.  She needs the loan to buy more clothing that she has run out of such as track suits, stockings, sweaters, pants and other items.

The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" is made up of hardworking and responsible people who strive to get their families ahead.  Most of the members live in Cusco where they work.  Cusco is known as a tourist destination and a business center, and for its traditional fiesta of  Raymi and because one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu" is found there.

loans.use: to buy more clothing that she has run out of  such as track suits, stockings, sweaters, pants, and more

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has for one year been running a small store that offers products like groceries, snacks, sodas and candies. She has 3 children to take care of, and she wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Her husband works in a private company, but earns a minimal salary that is not enough to cover all the home expenses. A long time ago, she had another store, but it was destroyed in a fire. Elizabeth had to start her business from the beginning again, but she could not have the same capacity of products and sales.

She requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise so that she can increase her inventory. She hopes with this loan her sales will increase and by consequence her incomes increase. Elizabeth and her children need your help and support.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Elizabeth tiene 1 año con su pequeña tienda, la cual ofrece productos como abarrotes, botanas, refrescos y dulces. Tiene 3 hijos que tiene que cuidar y por los que todos los días Elizabeth continúa trabajando para proporcionarles una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, pero gana un salario mínimo que no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos del Hogar. Hace tiempo tenía otra tienda, sin embargo sufrió un accidente y terminó en un incendio, por lo que Elizabeth tuvo que iniciar desde el principio su negocio pero ha sido difícil para ella tener la misma capacidad de productos y ventas.

Ella requiere de $ 250 USD para comprar mercancía y de esta manera aumentar su existencia de productos, ella espera que con este préstamo sus ventas se incrementen y como consecuencia sus ingresos sean mayores. Elizabeth y sus hijos necesitan tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reeves

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 4. I sell second-hand shoes for a living. I intend to use the loan to expand and diversify my business so as to enable me pay school fees for my children with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo has owned this small store for over 10 years. He sells all types of food products from his shop, ranging from rice to snacks for kids. He started this business with $15 (which was worth much more in Ecuador 10 years ago) and only sold rice, sugar, oil and plantains. Although he was one of the first businesses in this area he now faces competition from other stores around him. In order to contest with these businesses Lorenzo is looking to increase and diversify his inventory with this loan. He wants to begin selling chicken, meat, sausages and eggs as well as any other products that may be in demand.

Lorenzo has already lent from Kiva and Mifex and he did great with his first loan. He invested in a variety of products just as he planned. He saw his profits and the demand in the sector increase as his prices became the most competitive. He ended up investing in a second display refrigerator in order to keep the increased inventory fresh while also being able to show it to his customers. He made some small improvements to his home, although most of the profits went to the daily necessities of his wife and family. He wants to continue to invest in products for his store as he continues to grow and provide services for the community.

Translated by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Invest in supplies for his store

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Business Description

Felicita sells Yanbal brand cosmetic products. Seven months ago she also began selling lunches to construction workers. She got into the cosmetics business through a friend who suggested that she sell them, and she started selling the lunches with the help of another friend.

How the Loan Will Be Used

She needs the loan to buy more Yanbal merchandise so that she can keep herself in the market; if she doesn’t have sufficient inventory, her customers will go elsewhere. She also hopes the lunch business will prosper so that she can have another source of income for her family.

Information About Felicita

She is 36 years old and has four children. Her house is of mixed construction and she has a stable family life. She and her husband are eager to improve their business. Since it is their only income so they are very aware that they have to make it prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Felicita se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza de marca Yanbal, además desde hace siete meses se ha dedicado a la venta de almuerzo en las constructoras. El primer negocio lo consiguió mediante una amiga que le propuso que vendiera el producto y el de los almuerzos lo consiguió por medio de un compadre.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería Yanbal y así mantenerse en el mercado pues si no comprar mercadería sus clientes buscaran a otra proveedora. Inclusive ella espera que el negocio de la comida prospere y tener otro ingreso seguro para su familia

Información Personal

Ella tiene 36 años y cuatro hijos su casa es de contracción mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Ella y el esposo están afanosos por mejorar su negocio pues siendo su único ingreso están consientes que tienen que hacerlo prospero

loans.use: To buy more merchandise of the type her customers like

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia has a stand in the Ocosingo Market where she sells sweets and candies. Her main clients are children from the town. She is 28 years old and has three children. She belongs to a group called Compañerismo 6 together with Ms. Maria del Carmen Hernández (who sells traditional foods) and Ms. Carmen López Cruz (who sells clothes). With your loans Patricia will invest in sweets and also buy a case in which she can exhibit her merchandise; Ms. Maria will invest in renting a store and purchase a better way of keeping it air conditioned; and Ms. Carmen will travel to Mesilla where she will buy a supply of clothes for a less expensive price. They all hope to increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia, en el mercado de Ocosingo ella tiene un puesto donde vende dulces y golosinas y sus principales clientes son los niños del pueblo. Ella tiene 28 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo Compañerismo 6 junto con doña Maria del Carmen Hernández (vende comida tradicional) y doña Carmen López Cruz (vende ropa). Con sus préstamos Patricia invertirá en dulces y además se comprará una vitrina para exhibir su mercadería, doña María invertirá en rentar un local y la mejor forma de acondicionarlo y doña Carmen viajará a la Mesilla donde comprará un surtido de ropa más económica. Todas esperan con esto aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Candy Sales

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora is a diligent and noble mother. She can be found daily immersed in her small grocery store where she sells a large variety of basic goods and products. Currently, by some heavenly force, her ice creams are in highest demand. She bought them initially to sell them from time to time in her little store. With her entrepreneurial spirit, she soon learned how to make them from a good friend. Now, she sees this product as an opportunity to fulfill her wishes. She still lives with her in-laws and one of her dreams is to buy her own home where she can live comfortably together with the youngest of her 5 children and move her little store into a new space. She needs your generous support to stock up her store with more products and start producing ice cream in mass production to sell them to more people and other nearby stores. Let us count on your cooperation to help Teodora's family be happy.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Teodora, es una diligente y noble madre D. familia, a la que podemos hallar diariamente sumergida en su pequeña bodega, donD. cordialmente expenD. una gran variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad. Ahora y por la constante presencia del astro solar los productos que más comercializa son los helados, los cuales compra para poder venderlos en las instalaciones D. su tiendita; gracias a su espíritu emprendedor hace poco aprendió la elaboración D. estos gracias a una amiga que muy gentilmente le enseñó y ahora ha visto en este producto una oportunidad para lograr sus anhelos.Aún vive en la casa D. sus suegros y uno D. sus sueños es obtener una casa propia donD. vivir cómodamente junto al menor D. sus 5 hijos para trasladar su pequeño negocio a un nuevo espacio; requiere D. vuestro generoso aporte para implementar su bodega con más artículos e iniciar la producción D. helados para comercializarlos en gran número a más personas y tiendas aledañas.Contamos con su colaboración para hacer D. la familia Teodora una familia feliz y realizada.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to supply the store and start making and selling delicious ice cream

loans.name: Behruz Group

texts.en: Behruz is one of the most active client groups we have at Microinvest. Ahmad, the leader and person responsible for repaying the loan, is known locally for his kindness and willingness to help people who are going through difficulties. He and his colleagues sell candies and food such as cookies. Their business is doing very well, and operates in a great location with lots of foot traffic in the town food market.  They have applied for a loan to increase the supply of goods they have for sale during the busy New Year's holiday.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of sales in their shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a greater variety of products

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: “One plus one makes a bundle” is the business strategy behind K. Enid's success. She buys goats, rears them for 3 months, then sells some of the goats, while keeping others to produce more. Enid is 46 years old, married, and has 8 children. She has been involved in animal sales business for the past nine years, and is thankful for her previous loans that have helped her buy and sell increasingly more goats, as well as buy beans and ground nuts for sale as a side business. Enid's dream is to buy a house in Kazo's trading center to generate rental income, as well as to open a shop for the wholesale of beans and ground nuts. A loan of US$600 will help her achieve these two goals.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of a house in the town's trading center to generate rental income 2) Opening of a shop for the wholesale of beans and ground nuts

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Born around 1972 in Cotonou, Mrs. Y. Antoinette is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Akpakpadodome, a shantytown in Cotonou, with her husband and sells ready-to-eat meals and assorted products. She has a lot of experience selling ready-to-eat meals which draws most of the workers from companies located near her business. Each day she is faced with high demand. She is seeking this loan in order to improve her business and to meet her customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1972 à COTONOU, dame Y. Antoinette est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit à AKPAKPADODOME un bidonville de COTONOU avec son mari où elle exerce ses activités de vente de repas prêt à manger et des produits divers. Elle a une grande expérience dans la vente des repas prêt à manger ce qui fait converger vers elle la majorité des travailleurs des entreprises privées implantées dans les environs de son lieu d’activité. Elle est confrontée chaque jour à une forte demande. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin d’améliorer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 sacks of beans and 7 sacks of rice

loans.name: Zuhura's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is 39 years old and is a widow with 3 children, ages 18, 21, and 24. Zuhura sells clothes and owns a small food vendor store, businesses she started in 1993. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sharifa and Fatuma, who also have businesses dealing in retail sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertir en sus tierras de arroz

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar has always grown vegetables in order to maintain his household. Nevertheless, he has been experiencing low profits because he has few crops, so he has decided to sell his products without any middlemen, thus ensuring that he will earn a fair amount of proceeds. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he will used to obtain a vehicle for transporting his vegetables from the countryside to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

EDGAR, se ha dedicado desde siempre a la siembra y cosecha de vegetales para el sostenimiento de su hogar, sin embargo observando los bajos ingresos que obtiene por la venta ya que la oferta es poca, ha decidido iniciar la comercialización de sus productos sin intermediarios, así está seguro que obtendrá el dinero justo por sus productos. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo ya que planea adquirir un vehículo para el transporte de sus vegetales del campo a la ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle to transport vegetables

loans.name: Vauvasa

texts.en:
Vaivasa P., 57, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in sewing clothes and material. She sells to the public and villagers 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Vaivasa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will also use the loan for home improvement.

loans.use: To buy material and equipment for her sewing business

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.en:
The San Jose Village Bank is a new bank recently initiated with eighteen members. The members are from the Yanamilla neighborhood located thirty minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where many of them migrated to the city or settled (without land title) on land where many do not have basic services.

The members have different businesses such as selling vegetables, meats, food, ice cream, firewood, groceries, clothing, fruit, and cereal.

Every member has a different story. For instance, Vilma is a single mother with a six-month-old son. Vilma sells firewood in her house and with her loan she will start a project to sell CDs and disks.

On the other hand, Julia travels every week to the Ayacuchan Jungle where she sells vegetables, traveling on Thursdays and returning on Sundays.

Also, Hayde sells sachipapas (sausage and fries) streetside in the center of Ayacucho with the help of her husband. She has her business on the weekends from six at night to five in the morning.

The bank members need varying amounts of loans, ranging from 300, 600 up to 900 soles, and totaling 9,300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to be lent to the village bank.

The loans will be invested to buy noodles, firewood, disks, cooking oil, potatoes, beans, oats, corn, vegetables, and clothing.

The dreams of the bank members are to buy their own cars to rent out as taxis, construct their homes, to provide a good education and sustenance for their children, to expand their businesses, and that their children may become professionals.

loans.use: to buy noodles, firewood, disks, cooking oil, potatoes, beans, oats, corn, vegetables and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria is 28 years old and divorced. She lives with her four children; Abraham who is 14, Edwin who is 8, Yudith who is 3 and Jose Manuel who is 1.

She handknits clothing, which she does at home and sells in the Laguna Temporal market in the city of Juliaca. She has been doing this work for the past two years. Prior to this she sold seasonal products, but decided to change her activity to do what she like best: knitting. Knitting clothing by hand takes time, so she has to work all day long in order to finish the clothing on time. This is the hardest part of her work, but over the years she has learned to be patient and to trust her skills, and things have gone well for her business.

Hilaria worries about her four children´s futures and wants them to have a promising and prosperous future.

With money from a loan she will buy more wool in order to produce more clothing and someday would like to have a small workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Hilaria tiene 28 años, es divorciada, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Abraham de 14, Edwin de 8, Yudith de 3 y Jose Manuel de 1 año.

Se dedica a tejer prendas de vestir a mano, las cuales elabora en su casa y comercializa en el mercado Laguna Temporal de la ciudad de Juliaca, ha venido desarrollando este trabajo hace dos años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de productos por temporada, pero decidió cambiar a la actividad que más le gusta realizar, el tejido.El tejer una prenda a mano le demora bastante tiempo, es así que tiene que trabajar durante todo el día para poder terminar las prendas puntualmente, siendo esto lo más difícil de su trabajo, pero los años le enseñaron a ser paciente y confiar en su destreza haciendo que le vaya bien en su negocio.

Hilaria se preocupa por el futuro de sus cuatro hijos, a los cuales quiere ver con un futuro próspero y prometedor.

Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más lana, para producir más prendas y en el futuro tener su pequeño taller.

loans.use: Buy wool to product more clothing.

loans.name: Bendición Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición se formo hace mas de 1 año, son un grupo que esta en 4to. Ciclo.
Pertenecen a la zona de San Lorenzo. Reducto, un donde conviven personas de escasos recursos.
Las señoras se dedican a la venta de productos varios en sus hogares, las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.
Como grupo es un comité estable pagan con puntualidad sus cuotas en la Fundación y dentro del grupo también, poseen un Ahorro de 2.982.681. Ademas realizan actividades en conjunto como rifas y polladas para lograr un fondo de Caja de Auxilio para los casos que alguien se enferme , o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación. 
En este ciclos se nota el esfuerzo de las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo de su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo. Las señoras se sienten contentas con las  capacitaciones, especialmente con el modulo de presupuesto personal, pues les ayuda a tener una mejor organización.
Las actividades que cada una desarrolla son:
1-	Cristina Noemi B.. Profesora y Venta de ropa.
2-	Laura A.. Venta de Comidas.
3-	Justa Arevalo. Venta de producto de belleza.
4-	Luisa D.. Venta de remedios naturales.
5-	Olga F.. Venta de merceria.
6-	Rossana B.. Venta de perfumes.
7-	Julia G.. Peluquera.
8-	Francisca A.. Venta de productos comestibles. 
9-	Francisca D.. Venta de productos por catalogo.
10-	 Maria Antonia A..
11-	Maria G..Vta. De Ropas.
12-	Veronica F.. Venta de fruta.
13-	Susana A.. Venta de ropa.
14-	Ermelinda M...Modista.
15-	Maria O..Vta. De Comidas.
16-	Fatima F.. Venta de frutas.
17-	Maria Elena A..Venta de comidas.
18-	Mirta O..Venta de merceria.
19-	Maria D.. Venta de comida.
texts.en:
The Bendicion (Benediction) committee was formed more than a year ago and is now in its fourth cycle. It operates in San Lorenzo, a neighborhood where people have few resources. The women make a living selling a range of products. Some sell clothes, others medicines and food items, some selling from home and others door-to-door. The group has a record of paying their loans on time, both within the committee and to Fundacion. They have savings of 2,982,681. They hold joint activities such as raffles and dinners to build their savings in case one of their members becomes sick or so that they can accelerate their loan payments to Fundacion.

For this cycle, the efforts the women have made to improve their lives have been notable. The support of the group has been fundamental to the growth of their businesses and also to their self-worth which has developed as they've come to see themselves as active players within the group. The women are happy with their training, especially the module related to personal finance, because it helps them organize better.

The businesses that each member is developing are: 1- Cristina Noemi B.. Teacher and clothing sales. 2- Laura A.. Food sales. 3- Justa Arevalo. Sales of beauty products. 4- Luisa D.. Sales of natural medicines. 5- Olga F.. Sales of notions. 6- Rossana B.. Perfume sales. 7- Julia G.. Hairdresser. 8- Francisca A.. Food sales. 9- Francisca D.. Sales of catalog merchandise. 10- Maria Antonia A.. 11- Maria G.. Clothing sales. 12- Veronica F.. Fruit sales. 13- Susana A.. Clothing sales. 14- Ermelinda M.. Dressmaker. 15- Maria O.. Food sales. 16- Fatima F.. Fruit sales. 17- Maria Elena A.. Food sales. 18- Mirta O.. Sales of notions. 19- Maria D.. Sales of notions.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza B. has been selling the national coat called “chapan” for more than seven years. These coats are widely used by men in the region. She buys the coats from villagers and sells them in the central market.

Some years ago, she became a widow and has been raising and educating her two children. Gulnoza wants to use a loan to enhance the business and increase her income, which will provide her family a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase additional coats for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine Archibong sells provisions and drinks. She sells in retail to her customers. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes to stock her shop with more provisions and drinks because during the festive season, the demand for her goods will be high. She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mr. So S. is 73 years old , and his wife, Oun Noeun, is 62. They are residents in Kompong Tom Province. Mr. S. is a father of six children, four of whom are married and living away from home, and two are employed. The son is a fisherman, and the daughter is a garment worker at Phnom Penh Town.

Mr. S. and his wife have been farmers since 1979. They own farmland in their village, where they grow rice and vegetables. To alleviate the hard work of farming, Mr. S. has requested a loan to purchase oxen to help him plow the fields and a cart to transport his crops.

loans.use: Purchase oxen and a cart

loans.name: Enes Y.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Enes H. from Mbeya. She is married with six children, between the ages of 10 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents: one is an orphan because his parents died of HIV and the other has parents who cannot take care of her. Enes has been running a shop since 2008, selling staples such as rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, etc.

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enes currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and sodas. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. Enes thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and sodas

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot C. is group leader of six members who all live in Da village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  Her husband, Mr. Choem Chein, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Sot C. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and lotus seeds to grow on her field and her lake. She hopes to increase her income and improve family living conditions with this loan. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a security worker while the others are enrolled in the local school. Mr. Pao P. could not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and lotus seeds to grow on her field and her lake.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children. She sells clothing for children and teenagers at Obraztsoviy market in Melitopol city. She started this business 11 years ago because she just liked selling this kind of clothing. Ludmila changed several business locations and finally got a good one at one of the best markets.

Ludmila lives with her husband and their younger son, who is a college student. Ludmila helps her son cover his college tuition. Both her husband and son are very supportive of Ludmila in her business. They plan to remodel their house.

Ludmila would like to borrow 7,500 UAH to purchase spring inventories. She would spend the additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventories

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 41 años, lleva una vida de convivencia con su pareja por más de 21 años, es madre de 4 hijos. De soltera sembraba en las chacras de sus padres, mayormente cítricos, pero desde que se enamoró de un agricultor experto en cultivos de café y cacao han incrementado sus siembras con estos productos, en el intermedio de sus plantas frutales ha trasplantado plantas cafetaleras hace 6 años atrás y en la primera cosecha le fue muy bien, lo que permitió comprar un carro que le sirve para internarse en los lugares más lejanos donde no hay carreteras para sacar sus cosechas de cítricos, café y cacao. Asimismo este vehículo le ha permitido ganar dinero transportando la carga de sus vecinos, cobrando por cada carga entre 80 a 100 soles dependiendo de la distancia y del costo del producto. Y cuando su esposo viaja con carga a diversos mercados, ella regresa con su vehículo para seguir acumulando su carga para el próximo despacho, de ese modo ella y su esposo se organizan para trabajar arduamente con miras a progresar y educar a sus hijos. Dora trabajó por muchos años con créditos individuales, jamás había pertenecido a un banco comunal, por ello tiene muchas expectativas de cómo se trabaja, pero de la misma forma está comprometida en pagar todas sus cuotas programadas por su responsabilidad y el bienestar del grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de llantas de repuesto para su carro, ya que algunas veces se ha quedado en las chacras sin poder avanzar por falta del repuesto.
texts.en:
Dora is 41 years old, has lived with her partner for more than 21 years, and is mother of 4 children. When she was single, she used to plant crops in her parents’ fields, mostly citrus fruits, but since she fell in love with a farmer who is an expert in cultivating coffee and cacao, she has increased her plantings with these crops. Six years ago she transplanted coffee plants into her orchard, between the trees, and in the first harvest she was quite successful. This allowed her to buy a car in order to get deeper into the fields where there are no roads to gather the harvest of citrus fruits, coffee and cacao. This vehicle has also allowed her to earn money transporting her neighbors’ crops, charging between 80 and 100 Soles (Peruvian currency) per load depending on the distance and the cost of the product. When her husband travels with his produce to different markets, she returns in her vehicle to continue gathering crops for the next trip. This way she and her husband organize themselves and work hard to progress and educate their children. Dora worked for many years with individual loans and had never belonged to a communal bank so she has many expectations about how it works. She is committed to paying all of her monthly payments because she is responsible and for the good of the group. The loan she is soliciting is for the purchase of new tires for her car because several times she has been stuck in the fields, unable to move, for lack of replacement tires.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Amioga

texts.en: Amioga M., 22, is single with no children.  She has 1 year of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $104).  SPBD loans are Amioga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Supplies for making ice cakes

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou B. est une femme mariée qui a l’âge de 32 ans, elle habite au quartier Cité Lamy de Thiès. Elle faisait le petit commerce de parfums depuis 3 ans. Elle a démarré son activité avec ses propres fonds et elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC pour renforcer son activité et est à son premier prêt. Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter du parfum et d’encens.  Elle espère avoir un bénéfice de 75000CFA ($150) avec lequel elle  peut rembourser les intérêts du prêt et le reste elle l’investit dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Astou B. is a married woman who is 32 years old. She lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiès. She has had a small business selling perfumes for three years. She started her business with her own funds. She decided to join IMCEC to bolster her business, and is now on her first loan. With this loan, she's going to buy some perfumes and incense. She hopes to obtain a profit of 750,000 francs CFA with which she can make loan interest payments and invest the rest in her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes and incense

loans.name: Baï

texts.fr:
A. Baï est née à Bohicon dans le Département du ZOU. Baï est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants, tous majeurs. Baï n’est jamais allée à l'école. Baï a été élevée par ses propres géniteurs. Baï vendait de savons traditionnels avec sa mère. Après son mariage, Baï s’est lancée dans la restauration populaire à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Baï vend en effet du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs  et de causette d’igname; le tout accompagné de différentes sauces telles que les sauces d’arachide, de tomate, de sésame, de noix de palme et de gombo. Baï a eu de ALIDé  deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés  et avec lesquels elle a amené son activité à un stade supérieur. Aujourd’hui, Baï sollicite un troisième prêt pour faire ses provisions en gros à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Baï A. was born in Bohicon in the Department of Zou. Baï is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom are grown up. Baï never went to school. Baï was raised by her own parents. Baï used to sell traditional soaps with her mother. After getting married, Baï began a catering business in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Baï sells rice, beans, maize paste, and yam chips; all of these are accompanied by various sauces such as peanut sauce, tomato sauce, sesame sauce, palm nut sauce, and okra sauce. Baï has obtained two loans through Alidé that she repaid properly, and with which she has taken her business to a higher level. Currently, Baï is seeking a third loan to obtain her supplies in bulk at Tokpa, the large international market of Benin. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its per capita GDP is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg bags of rice and two 25-litre cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 3 Group

texts.en: Fhlippe is a single parent, the head of his household that provides for his three children. He is a clothes street vendor, his business is titled “Ropas Felipe”. With the loan granted he will buy clothes in bulk to reduce transportation costs. In the future he hopes to own his own vehicle so he can easily get from one place to the next. His lifetime goal is to see his children prosper. Please help Fhlippe and his group expand their businesses. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of new clothes in bulk to increase his profit margins

loans.name: Fummi

texts.en: Fummi sells clothes and jewelry. She is 47 years old and married with ten children. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rodellia

texts.en:
Rodellia D. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City, in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 29 years old. Rodellia is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rodellia owns and operates a business making and selling peanut butter and "longanisa" (pork sausage) to sell in the community. Rodellia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rodellia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodellia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase the ingredients for the foods that she sells. This will be Rodellia's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Xiomara García, tiene una pulpería que desde hace seis años logro poner con ahorros y préstamos que Afodenic a otorgado. Tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos uno trabaja y dos estudian, madre soltera y con mucho deseo de salir adelante con su familia. con este crédito comprar mercadería variada como: granos básicos,  golosinas, carnes,  entre otros el cual aumentara su inventario y ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados. Sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Sra. Xiomara García opened a grocery store six years ago using her savings and a loan she received from AFODENIC. She is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital of Managua. Sra. Xiomara has three children, of whom one is working while the other two are students. She is a single mother and would very much like for her family to get ahead.

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of merchandise such as basic grains, candy, meat, and other products to increase her inventory and her sales. She thanks the institution for helping her succeed. Her plans include improving the infrastructure of her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, meat, and other products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 36 years old. Helen is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen plants, harvests, and sells rice. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest from these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and labor during cultivation. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to buy the rice farm that they have been leasing. This will be Helen's 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy the rice farm that they have been leasing

loans.name: Escalera Al Cielo Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal  Panamericana, recientemente se conformó el grupo “Escalera al Cielo” y una de las integrantes es Franklina L. que tiene 20 años, soltera  y vive en la zona villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. Franklina tiene la habilidad de tejer y ha accedido al préstamo  para comprar lana y tejer mantas, más adelante desea hacer crecer su negocio  ofreciendo sus productos a amigos y vecinos, también ha pensado en abrir una tienda en su casa, por eso quiere seguir con su grupo y sacar un monto mayor en un futuro cercano.
Al igual que Franklina las demás integrantes cuentan con pequeños negocios como la venta de material escolar, atención de tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas chompas y buzos, venta de golosinas y comida, y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Recently the group "Escalera al Cielo" (Stairway to Heaven) was created at the Panamerican Focal Center. One of the members is Franklina L., a single, 20 year old woman who lives in the Ingenio Villa neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Franklina has a talent for weaving. She will use the loan money to buy more wool to weave. In the future she wants to grow her business by selling her products to friends and neighbors, and she is also considering opening a store in her house. For these reasons she would like to remain a member of this group and try to earn more money soon. Like Franklina, the other members have small businesses such as the sale of school supplies, woven jackets and sweaters, food and candies, and the management of a neighborhood shop. They need this loan in order to buy merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the size of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en: Rice farming is Gemma’s source of income. She owns a hectare and a half of rice field. Gemma is a 39-year-old married woman. She is very diligent when it comes to farming because it gives her family food to eat. Gemma’s farm still lacks necessary farm supplies, so she is requesting a loan of $150. She will use this loan for fertilizers and other items needed to increase the yield her farm provides.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 25 años, es madre de un pequeño de un año de edad, vive el casa de su madre, con ella y sus hermanos.

Actualmente viene refaccionando un espacio en su casa donde vende medicina natural y bebidas. Adicionalmente, desde hace un año, ha empezado a vender productos de belleza de casa en casa, para lo cual visita a sus amistades y vecinos para ofrecer su mercadería por medio de catálogos y los productos que tiene en stock.
Lo que le gusta a Evelyn de su trabajo es estar en contacto con sus clientes, con quienes comparte ideas y hace muchos amigos debido a su buena atención y jovialidad. 
Por otro lado, considera que su negocio le es rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en hacerle pedidos.
Al deseo a futuro de Evelyn es tener un minimarket donde ofrezca variedad de productos a sus vecinos y clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y desde ya a notado que sus compañeros de banco comunal son confiables y responsables, por lo que está entusiasmada con el trabajo que empezarán a hacer con miras al progreso de sus respectivos negocios. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos de belleza, medicinas naturales y bebidas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a 25-year-old mother of a 1-year-old son who lives with her mother and siblings in her mother's home.

She is currently remodeling a space in her house to sell natural medicines and drinks. For the last year, she has also been selling beauty products from house to house, visiting her friends and neighbors to offer merchandise from catalogs as well as what she has in stock.

The thing that Evelyn likes most about her work is the contact with her customers, with whom she shares ideas. She makes many friends since she provides great customer service and is very good-humored. On the other hand, she thinks that her business is profitable because she works with a cosmetic brand that is very well-known and her customers do not hesitate in making orders.
