In the future, Evelyn would like to have a mini-market that sells a variety of products to her neighbors and other customers.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has noticed that her friends in her communal bank are very trustworthy and responsible. They are also very enthusiastic about the work they have begun doing towards improving their respective businesses. Evelyn will use the money from this loan to purchase more beauty products, natural medicines, and beverages, and thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aurelia A.

texts.en: Aurelia A. M. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Aurelia owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca tiene 53 años D. edad, se casó a los 17 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos  (03 con familia y 03 solteros estudiantes), ella estudió hasta el 3er. Año D. primaria, vive en el  Distrito  D. Ilave  Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno.

DesD. el año 2007 integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazaret”, con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró ovinos. Ella se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, junto a su esposo desD. que se casó.

Para incrementar su capital y continuar con su negocio solicitará un nuevo crédito D. 2,000.00 nuevos soles para comprar 01 ganado vacuno mejorado.

A ella le gusta asistir a las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque recibe charlas.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old, she got married at 17 and is the mother of 6 children (3 have a family and 3 are unmarried students), she has 3 years of primary education, lives is the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. Since 2007 she has been part of the communal bank “Jesús D. Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth), she bought sheep with her first loan of 300 nuevos soles. She has bought and sold cattle and sheep, alongsiD. her husband since she got married. To increase her capital and continue her business she is asking for a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a better breed of cattle. She likes attending the communal bank meetings, because they have talks. Her greatest dream is that her children get ahead and become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF A BETTER BREED OF CATTLE

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine C. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Catherine is single. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Catherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and married to a commercial driver. She is the mother of seven children and they are doing well in School.

Ruth has a business selling foodstuffs. She is happy with her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. With the business she has been assisting her family in making a living.

Ruth needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. It will help her in contributing to the family income and will also improve her business. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

Nuestra socia la Sra. Eufemia, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son independientes y viven lejos y  vive con su hija de 36 años, quien le ayuda en el negocio, la socia tiene este negocio más de 10 años y con el pudo construir su casita y acondicionar su restaurante chicharronería, también vende sopa de gallina, trucha al horno o al vapor y el tradicional chicharrón de carne de cerdo, la socia alternan sus actividades con el comercio, ella tiene la suerte de hoy ser su propia jefa, la socia también vende bebidas frías como gaseosas y cervezas; es por ellos que solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio, utilizando el dinero cómo capital de trabajo y poder abastecerse de bebidas frías como gaseosas y cervezas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eufemia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ahorro Es Progresso – Saylla” (Saving is Progress). She lives in the District of Saylla, which is located 30 minutes away by bus from the city of Cusco. Saylla is well-known for its open air restaurants, where people can come to enjoy the scenery while savoring a delicious Peruvian meal. The specialty of the city of Cusco is “chicharrón” (a dish containing 3 or 4 pieces of pork with roasted potatoes, sweet corn, or onion and herb salad).

Sra. Eufemia is 62 years old, married, and has three children of whom two are independent and live far away. She lives with her 36 year old daughter, who helps with her business. Eufemia has been in business for more than ten years and was able to build a house and equip her chicharrón restaurant. She sells chicken soup and trout (baked or steamed) in addition to the traditional pork chicharrón. Eufemia divides her time between her activities at home and her business. She feels lucky that she is now her own boss. In addition, Eufemia sells cold beverages such as sodas and beer.

Eufemia is requesting a loan so that she can reinvest in her business. The money will be used as operating capital to stock up on cold beverages such as sodas and beer. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar vive en casa propia con su esposa e hija en la zona de alto San Pedro de La ciudad de La Paz; de profesión maestro jubilado al igual que su esposa, percibe una renta jubilatoria con la cual mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para poner un taller de joyería con ayuda de su yerno y de esta manera tener nuevos ingresos.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar lives in his own home with his wife and daughter in the Alto San Pedro region in the city of La Paz. He is a retired teacher, just like his wife, and receives a retirement pension with which he supports his family. The loan he has requested will be used to open a jewelry store with his son-in-law's help. In this manner, he hopes to increase his income. Oscar is not a member of IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner), but for his endeavor he has been able to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: start up costs to open a jewelry store

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino E., 43, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Perlita E., they are blessed with two children. He makes sure that he provides well so that their family can have a better life.  He has been managing their variety store for quite some time now.

Rufino has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he uses the money he borrows to expand and improve the store.

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a PHP 11,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to his expanding business by buying products needed to replenish and sustain stocks and operations of the store.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his children’s education until they finish their degrees. He also wants to have his own mansion to house his family.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products for his store

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La señora  María Juana P. vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia El Valle comunidad Maluay, esta comunidad se caracteriza por su vegetación, sus hermosos paisajes andinos, la mayor parte de su gente adulta mayor  se dedica a la agricultura ya que los jóvenes han migrado a las grandes ciudades o al exterior.

María Juana es socia del banco comunal Maluay, tiene 51 años de edad se encuentra casada, concibió 4 hijos el primero de ellos tiene 28 años es casado y formo su propia familia, sus hijos de 22, 20, 18 años  trabajan y le ayudan económicamente compartiendo los gastos del hogar  con su padre que se dedica a vender jugos naturales. 

Ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también a la cría de pollos, cuyes, labor que realiza desde muy pequeña ya que es como una herencia que  aprendió de su madre, sus animales los vende  a sus vecinos de la comunidad y también para el consumo en su hogar.

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la  fundación y nos comenta que los créditos  le han beneficiado mucho en su casa para ir mejorando su economía, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar crías de  cuyes y alimento para su crecimiento e incrementar su negocio.

Su gran sueño es no tener más deuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Juana P. lives outside the city of Cuenca in the parish district El Valle which is part of the community of Maluay. This community is known for its vegetation and beautiful Andean scenery. The majority of the older adults work in agriculture while the young people have migrated towards the big cities or foreign countries. María Juana is a member of the Maluay communal bank. She is 51 years old, married with 4 children. Her oldest is 28 years old and married with his own family. The other children are 22, 20, and 18 years old and they work and help financially by sharing the household costs with their father who sells natural fruit juices. María Juana dedicates herself to the household chores as well as raising chicken and guineapigs. This is work that she has done from a very young age and was a legacy passed on by her mother. As well as consuming the animals in the house, she sells them to neighbors in the community. This is her fourth cycle working with the foundation and we have noticed that her loans have greatly benefited her by allowing her to improve her economic status. With this new loan, she will buy breeding guineapigs and food in order to grow and expand her business. Her greatest dream is to have no more debts.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guineapigs and food for their growth

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de su abuelo, ya que sus padres son separados.Desde que tiene quince años, vende ambulatoriamente en el mercado de la zona donde vive. Y durante este año se ha propuesto  trabajar formalmente, por esta razón  alquiló un puesto dentro de este mercado, en sociedad con un familiar,  por lo tanto él paga  $ 70.0 dólares y el resto su socio. Vende los productos de acuerdo  a la temporada, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Como en el Perú  se inicia la época escolar, optó por vender  mochilas, por ser  muy cotizadas durante  estos meses, y  así sucesivamente cambiará su mercadería. A Héctor le gusta adquirir  sus cosas  propias, y  sabe lo rentable que es comercializar en su negocio,  y con las ganancias que obtenga  juntará  dinero y postulará a la marina, ya que su mayor anhelo es servir a su patria.Es el primer préstamo  que tiene, y agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero solicitado, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, y a los integrantes de su grupo, promete no defraudarlos, ya que anhela contar con posteriores préstamos, para seguir creciendo como empresario.Con el dinero solicitado  comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, para continuar  en el mercado competitivo de las ventas.
texts.en:
Héctor, age 19, is unmarried and has lived with his grandmother ever since his parents separated. From the age of 15, he has been a street vendor at his local market. This year, he has set to working in a formal manner, and with this in mind, he has rented a space at that market along with an acquaintance where he pays $70, and his partner pays the rest. From 9 in the morning until 8 at night, he sells products that are in demand according to the season. Since the school year is beginning in Peru, he has opted to sell backpacks as they are heavily requested in these months, and from here on, he will be changing his selection of merchandise. Hector likes to obtain his own things, and he knows how profitable it will be to market his business. With the earnings he will make, he plans save his money and join the Navy, as he has a great desire to serve his homeland. The is the first loan he will be granted, and he thanks all of the people who will make it possible for him to realize this request. Also, he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner, and to the fellow members of his group, he promises not to disappoint them, since he is counting on obtaining future loans in order to continue growing as a businessman. With these requested funds, he plans to buy a larger quantity of goods in order to keep his sales competitive at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drugs, drinks, groceries and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Cuando alguien conversa con Gloria Jiménez O., percibe  su gran satisfacción por el arte de la culinaria y es que su negocio es el sueño que ha tenido desde muy niña y que  hoy se ha hecho realidad, por eso es exitosa  pues disfruta de él y le gana dinero. Gloria prepara exquisitos pudines y postres  que luego vende, es una excelente repostera y conoce mucho de comida árabe y otras exquisiteces, su negocio es la repostería y venta de comidas corrientes a los vendedores ambulantes y de los locales, en los alrededores del centro de Barranquilla. 
Para sus encargos de postres y pudines  del día de la Madre, necesita comprar  por volumen, azúcar pulverizada, haibol, saborizantes, esencias, así como también arroz, aceite, granos, sal, porque  es menester surtirse de estos insumos para la preparación de sus almuerzos diarios, estas son las razones por las cuales acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a solicitar su séptimo crédito.   
Gloria Jiménez es una mujer para imitar, con los frutos de su negocio sacó adelante, ella sola,  a sus dos hijos ya mayores de edad que son su principal orgullo, ellos son personas ejemplares y productivas con hogares ya conformados y  “no estudiaron lo que no quisieron” uno de ellos es Chef de cocina en una empresa y el otro vive en Los Estados Unidos.  Ella dice que ha estudiado mucho para conseguir su excelencia en la preparación de alimentos especialmente de postres; además de ir a la academia y aprender repostería también está pendiente de cuanta receta se le atraviesa así que aprendió a decorar y a trabajar el castillaje también para eventos especiales.
Recuerda que la Fundación fue la primera organización que le hizo un crédito y ella le es fiel desde el 1986 aunque ahora la buscan de muchos bancos y otras entidades financieras, pero dice que no le interesan. Su sueño y desafío es tener un restaurante grande y ayudar a muchas personas cuyo hogar es la calle, pues ella sabe que necesitan amor, un lugar donde dormir y comida.
texts.en:
When someone talks with Gloria Jiménez O., they perceive the great satisfaction she has for the culinary arts. Her business is the dream she has had since she was a little girl. Now it has become a reality, and it is successful. She enjoys it, and she makes money. Gloria prepares exquisite puddings and desserts that she later sells. She is an excellent pastry chef, and she knows a lot about Arabian food and other delicious dishes. Her business is making pastries and selling “comida corriente” (a set menu of the day) to street vendors and salespeople in set locations in the areas surrounding the center of Barranquilla. For her dessert and pudding orders for Mother’s Day she needs to buy powdered sugar, containers, flavorings, and essences in volume. She also needs to buy things like rice, oil, grains, and salt to stock up on these ingredients to make her daily lunches. These are the reasons that she comes to the Fundación Santo Domingo to ask for her seventh loan. Gloria Jiménez is a woman to emulate. With the fruits of her business she alone got her two children ahead. They are now adults, and they are her primary pride. They are exemplary people who are productive, and they have their own homes. “They did not study what they did not want to study.” One of them is a chef in the kitchen of a company. The other lives in the United States. She says that she has studied a lot to achieve her excellence in food preparation, especially desserts. In addition to attending the academy and learning pastry making, she is also outstanding at whatever recipe she comes across. She learned to decorate and work with a sugar and gelatin based paste for special events. She remembers that the Fundación was the first organization that gave her a loan. She has been loyal to them since 1986, even though there are a lot of banks and other financial entities that look for her business. She tells them she is not interested. Her dream and her challenge is to have a big restaurant and to help a lot of people who live on the street. She knows that they need love and a place to sleep and eat.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy powdered sugar, containers, flavorings, and essences in volume.  She also needs to buy things like rice, oil, grains, and salt

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es: La señora Francisca vive en el barrio Walter Ferreti, procreo dos hijos, para ella ha sido difícil ya que no ha tenido la ayuda de su compañero. Desde hace varios años trabaja en una empresa privada como conserje, anteriormente lavaba y planchaba para ganarse el sustento cada día, muy agotador pero hasta ahora logro apoyar a sus dos hijos. Para ella estos financiamiento han sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha logrado mejorar su casa, con el crédito anterior logro embaldosar, y ahora quiere cambiar el techo que lo tiene en mal estado ya que comenzó a llover y se le pasa el agua. Sus planes es seguir haciendo las mejoras a su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in the Walter Ferreti neighborhood; she has two children. It has been very difficult for her because she hasn’t had any support from her partner. She has worked as a caretaker for a private firm for several years; she used to take in washing and ironing to earn her daily support. It’s exhausting work but she’s managed to support her two children. For her, these loans have been of great benefit because they have made it possible to improve her home; she used the previous loan to install tile floors. Now, she needs to replace the roof because it’s in poor condition and the rainy season has started and water leaks in. Her plans are to continue to make improvements to her small house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to replace her roof.

loans.name: Seak Muoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Seak Muoy U. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sroy In, are farmers who own one hectare of land on which they cultivate rice. 

Aside from being a farmer, Mrs. Seak Muoy U. is a vegetable seller of sweet tomato and beans, who earns a little additional income to support the family. In order to increase the family's income, Mrs. Seak Muoy U. wants to start a new business in pig breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her venture.

This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school while the youngest one is five years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Sope Serigne Mbacke Sokhna Lô Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « SOPE SERIGNE MBACKE SOKHNA LÔ » est crée en 2007 au jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui abrite ledit Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village et sont organisées par affinité. Elles sont pratiquement de la même génération, elles un ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Elles font en général de l’embouche bovine, mais certaines associent à cette activité le petit commerce de céréales locales, de poissons frais et de légumes. 

La présidente du groupe de solidarité, Fatou N. en second rang, debout et à droite sur la photo, est âgée de 50 ans elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charges. Elle fait essentiellement de l’embouche ovine, elle en a une bonne expérience car avant même qu’elle ne soit bénéficiaire des prêts de l’institution CAURIE-MF elle pratiquait cette activité. Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra acheter plus de moutons pour faire l’accroissement de son activité afin de se procurer plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir faire face aux besoins familiaux, par exemple assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et leur couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "SOPE SERIGNE MBACKE SOKHNA LÔ" has been created in 2007, the day of the inaugraton of the local Banc Villageois. It is composed of ten women, all of whom reside in the same village and know each other as friends. They are all more or less of the same generation and are on the average 40 years old; all are married and are the mothers of at least three children. Their main line of business is raising cattle, and some of them also sell local cereals, fresh fish and vegetables on the side. The leader of the solidarity group, Fatou N. pictured on the photo standing in the second row on the right, is 50 years old and the mother of eight dependent children. She mainly raises sheep, and has had plenty of experience with it even before taking out any loans from CAURIE-MF microfinance institutions. With this new credit she will be able to buy more sheep in order to expand her activity and increase her earnings, with the goal of better meeting her family’s needs, such as for example the school fees and healthcare costs of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the investment capital of the solidarity group

loans.name: Josephena

texts.en: Josephena F. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: rice and feeds retailing, and general store. She lives in Purak Genpas, Barangay West, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. Josephena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her rice and feeds retailing and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of P20,000. Josephena is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase an additional stock of rice. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Josephena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of rice

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S. 44 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its thirteen members that located in Puothi Reamea, Kandal province. While each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose.
Mrs. Kheng S. is a famer who works very hard to support her two children and aside from farmer she is also pig breeder at home, who is able to earn a small income to hold up her family living. For pig breeding, she will use the loan that asks from AMK to buy pig food for pig breeding. Mrs. Kheng S. is widow with two children, one is a laborer and another one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her store with soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Madina has a little eatery, which she has had for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food and other stock for the eatery.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Madina hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Madina hopes to complete university. Madina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by having time to share experience with her friends at the club and enjoying reading story books rather than doing nothing. 

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy food etc. for her eatery

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ileana tiene 31 años de edad, de los cuales 16 años los ha  pasado trabajando en su negocio que es el servicio de belleza ambulante,  ella atiende a sus clientes de la mejor manera posible pues siempre está pendiente de los diferentes pedidos que le realizan. Además de este negocio la señora vende productos de la Avon para así ayudarse un poco mas con los ingresos familiares madre de dos hijos que se encuentran en el colegio. Su esposo trabaja como contratista por temporadas. Es por ello que la señora recurre a financiamientos para a si mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ya que necesita ciertos productos como pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, toallas, cortaúñas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Ileana is 31 years old and has spent the past 16 years working in her business in which she provides mobile beauty services. She attends to her customers in the best way possible and always tries to provide them with the different services they request. In addition to this business, Ileana sells Avon products to help earn a little more income for her family. She is the mother of two children who are in high school. Her husband works as a seasonal contractor.

Ileana has returned to request a loan so that she can improve the conditions of her business. She needs to acquire certain products such as nail polish, lipsticks, towels, nail clippers, and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nail polish, lipsticks, towels, nail clippers, and other supplies

loans.name: Tonimar's Group

texts.en:
Tonimar C. is from the village of Fugo Echague. She is 40 years old. Tonimar is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tonimar C. group.

Tonimar is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a weaving business, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. Tonimar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Tonimar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tonimar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. Tonimar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Tonimar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make woven products

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Fishing is the most important part of 43-year-old Suon K.’s daily work. She and her husband wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fish. After they have made their catch, they hurry to the local market and sell it to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they have delivered. Suon K. and her husband also support their four children, all of whom are enrolled in school.  Recently, some of family’s fishing equipment has cracked, affecting their ability to fish effectively and frequently. Therefore, Suon K. has decided to seek a loan to buy new fishing equipment to replace the broken items.

loans.use: To buy new fishing equipment to replace broken items.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Manuel, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, tiene 63 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijas y se dedica a la venta de medicinas desde hace 15 años trabajando todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa, él necesita invertir en el negocio y para eso solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar más medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes.
Este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer su inventario de medicinas y cubrir con la demanda, ya que este producto siempre es buscado por las personas y si  posee para distintas clases de enfermedades así como vitaminas, contara con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Don Manuel quiere tener un buen historial crediticio y seguir recibiendo de esta ayuda para invertir en su negocio y poder obtener más ganancias que solventen sus necesidades y las de su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Concepcion Batres in the community of Usulutan. He is 63 years old and he lives together with his wife and daughters. He has been selling medicines for the past 15 years, working every day alongside his wife. He needs to invest in his business and to this end he requests a loan. He will purchase more medicines to offer his clients.

This loan will help him supplement his inventory of medicines and fill customer demand. His products are always in demand by his clients, especially because he has products for various kinds of ailments, including vitamins. He caters to his clients' preferences.

Manuel wants to maintain a good credit history to always be eligible for loans to invest in his business. He will obtain better earnings that will help him provide for his needs and those of his homestead.

loans.use: To purhcase medicines for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more door locks, hinges, nails, paint, cutlasses, shovels, etc.

loans.name: Shukria

texts.en:
Shukria is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a clothes selling business from home, her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Shukria faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to and from the market where she purchase clothes for resale. She hopes to open a clothes selling stall and sell more clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane B. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Jane has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for less than a year.         

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees.  

In the future, Jane hopes to own a plot of land. Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching us how to be self employed.

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Y. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Susan is single and has one adult-aged children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products like lagundi syrup, gotukola & assorted food supplements in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fruit vending business.  Her husband Angelito, who is 51 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have five children who are 18 to 29 years old. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to buy more assorted fruits to sell in the local market so she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Marilyn F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: La Señora Esperanza tiene 61 años y vive en la zona “A” de Huaycan, está separada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad, ella forma parte del grupo “Amigas Unidas”, grupo que lleva 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo y conformado por 9 socias vecinas y amigas. Esperanza ah trabajado por 20 años de costurera y ah podido apoyar a sus hijos cuando eran muy jóvenes, últimamente han logrado construir el techo de su casa y ella se siente contenta con esto, pero desde hace 4 años sufre de diabetes, mas no por esto se rinde y sabe que lograra alcanzar sus metas con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Edaprospo.
texts.en: Señora Esperanza is 61 and lives in Area "A" of Huaycán. She is separated and has three grown-up children. She is a member of "Amigas Unidas Group" (United Friends), which has been working for 2 years with the microfinance institution Edaprospo. The group has 9 members; they are neighbors and friends. Esperanza has worked for 20 years as a seamstress and was able to support her children when they were very young. Recently she managed to build the roof of her house and this makes her happy. However, she has now suffered from diabetes for 4 years, but it doesn't deter her and she knows that she can achieve her goals thanks to her effort and the support of Edaprospo.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: La Confianza Group

texts.es: Doña Ingrid Maritza  A. C. es madre soltera, ha cursado el primer  grado primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales   siguen a su cargo, ella se dedica al comercio  venta de ropas tipica, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina la Confianza, El grupo cuenta con tres   integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar la crianza de animales. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería   y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en ASDIR.
texts.en:
Ingrid Maritza A. C. is the single mother of two children whom she cares for.  She completed the first year of junior high school and has been selling clothing for 15 years.  With lots of enthusiasm and with the help of some of her neighbors, they formed a group so that they can request a loan.

This united group is called “Confianza,” (Confidence) and is made up of three members; ladies who are dedicated to different businesses, including raising livestock.  They will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise so that they can increase their sales.  One of the challenges of being a business owner is the lack of working capital, but she has managed to get ahead with the help of her children, and she expects her business to be large and productive, with the help of this loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio U. is from the village of Poblacion, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 46 years old. Sofronio is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Sofronio owns & operates a business providing general repair services like vulcanizing of tires to local community members. Sofronio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sofronio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofronio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Sofronio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sofronio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a vegetable farm. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.  Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she could have additional funds to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her vegetable farm.  This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Enriqueta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a member of Shalom Self Help Group under Faulu Kenya. He joined the group so that he could save his money and access loans easily. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He also started running a motorbike transport business after getting capital from Faulu Kenya. Daniel is also a farmer who grows tea. He hopes to expand his shop into a supermarket in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kes to enlarge his retail shop.

loans.use: To enlarge his retail shop

loans.name: Yajaira Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señorita Yajaira, ella tiene 19 de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, estudia el primer semestre de marketing en la Universidad Laica de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 4 ciclos y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Se dedica junto a su madre a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ellas tienen un local en su casa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta 18h00. Su mercadería  la recibe en Portoviejo ya que se las envían desde Panamá y Perú, nos cuenta que lo que más venden es la ropa femenina y la de niños aunque ellos tienen de todo y para toda edad, tienen este negocio 2 años y seis meses y que les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera profesional y llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. 

Here we meet Yajaira, who is 19 years old and single. She lives in her parents' house and is studying marketing in her first semester at the Civil University of Manta. She has been with the communal bank for 4 cycles, and she likes the convenience in obtaining loans. 

Together with her mother, she works selling clothing of all types. They have a store in their home. Yajaira works every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her merchandise is sent to her from Panama and Peru, and she picks it up in Portoviejo. She reports that the highest sales are in women's and children's clothing, although they offer everything, for all ages. They have had this business for 2 years and six months, and it has gone very well for them. 

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothes, and underwear, among other garments. 

Her dreams are to finish her professional studies and become a large entrepreneur.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, ropa interior, etc.

loans.name: Peter Ndungu

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 53 years old, married to Peris Mumbi, and they have five children.  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old, married and a mother of three children aged 22, 20 and 16 years old. She owns a shop in the Mobon trading centre in Kapsabet and has been in this business for a period of seven years, getting a monthly income of about $94.

She has applied for a loan of 25,000 KES, this being her third loan term after repaying the previous loans successfully. The amount will be used to purchase two bags of sugar, three bales of maize flour and one carton of cooking fat. 

She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Elar Vidali

texts.es:
Elar tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y reside en el distrito de Pucalá, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Elar vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus hijos varones que se encuentran en edad escolar. 

La zona  de Pucalá se caracteriza por ser  una zona rural y dedicarse al cultivo de caña de azúcar debido a que existe una fábrica azucarera en la zona.

Desde hace quince años, Elar, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, de los cuales extrae su leche para su venderla  a los  acopiadores de la zona (acopiadores son las personas que recolectan la leche para venderla a empresas grandes) y en algunos casos cría y engorda su ganado para vender la carne de este. Esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Elar también tiene otros empleos ocasionales como la albañilería.

Elar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado, que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de leche que podrá vender a mayor precio.

Elar desea ahorrar sus ingresos para cumplir su sueño de tener su propio establo.
texts.en:
Elar is 46 years old, married, and lives in Pucalá district which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Elar lives together with his wife and three of his sons who are school age.

Pucalá district is noted as being a rural area where sugarcane is grown.  There is a sugarcane factory in the area.

For 15 years, Elar has been raising cattle.  He milks his cows and then sells the milk to 'acopiadores' in the area ('acopiadores' are the people who collect the milk to sell on to big companies) and, in some cases, he raises and fattens his cattle to sell as meat.  This business has allowed him to get his family ahead in life.

Elar also carries out other temporary jobs such as construction work.

Elar is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy balanced feed for his cattle.  This will enable him to obtain a better quality of milk which he will be able to sell for at a higher price.

Elar would like to save his profits so that he can fulfil his dream of owning his own stable.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his cattle

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of inventory to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She started working as a private teacher from her home over the past two years. To receive the students properly, she has prepared a special education room. Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform modifications needed for the room by adding more tables, a bigger wall and new educational equipment. She intends to increase her income because she is hoping to get married soon and needs to finalize all the wedding preparations as soon as possible.

loans.use: to perform modifications needed for her schoolroom, adding more tables, a bigger wall and new education equipment.

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.en:
Rosa, Blanca, and Isidra, all of whom live in the Choluteca region of Honduras, formed the “La Frontera” solidarity group in June, 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of one another’s loans. 

Rosa is married with four children and makes a living by selling freshly prepared food. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which to buy ingredients for her food business. 

Blanca is married with two children and works selling clothing and citrus juices. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 to buy merchandise.

Isidra is married with two children and operates a small convenience shop. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 4,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, shoes, sandals, meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
She is 35 years old and married. She has five children and her children go to school.

She is currently in the business of selling goods like rice, sugar and oil.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana tiene 38 años de edad , ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun en la Provincia de Chiclayo 

Ana se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos y pavos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando sus animales han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. 

Ana  solicita un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de mas aves de corral con sus respectivo alimento balanceado, para mejorar y ampliar sus corrales, en los que desarrolla su negocio y asi pueda percibir mayores ingresos.

Ana es una mujer carismática  de buena voluntad que desea salir adelante , con sus empeño y trabajo, goza de buenas referencias y de estima por parte de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old.  She owns her own home which is located in Oyotun district, in Chiclayo province.

Ana raises and sells farmyard birds.  She raises hens, ducks and turkeys in an area behind her home and, when her her animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.

Ana is requesting a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can invest in buying more birds and balanced feed for them.  She will also improve and expand the pens in which she keeps her animals so that she can make more income.

Ana is a charismatic, compassionate woman who would like to get ahead in life through her efforts and hard work.  She has good references and is well liked by her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy farmyard birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a teacher and they live together with their four children. She sells beans and ripped plantain (red-red) at Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. Her husband is a teacher. Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.  Adjoa plans to plow back the new profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
"Life is like a wheel" is David's favorite quotation. He is 59 years old and happily married. He is blessed with nine children. Four of his children are already married. One child is working abroad, and the rest are in school.

David is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. They both manage their farming business, which involves planting and harvesting corn. Aside from the farming business, David is also engaged in a hog-raising business. David and his wife are trying their best to sustain their family's needs, especially their children's education.

David wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He wants to expand his business to get higher earnings and to continue sending his children to school to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Aireen has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Aireen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support one child. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Gemma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros, tiene 50 años, es madre soltera y tiene 8 hijos. 
Felicitas se dedica a la venta D. quesos en la puerta D. un horno D. chaplas y en su casa tiene una tienda, con la ayuda D. los prestamos pudo salir adelante, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para comprar mas quesos y poder comprar abarrotes para su tienda, lo que ahora desea es poder mejorar su tienda esa es su meta y ahorrará para ello.
A Felicitas le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le ayudaron a poder ser mas fuerte y a tener valores.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the community bank Arrieros. She is 50 years old, a single mother, and has 8  kids.
Felicitas works selling cheeses and she has a store in her house. With the help of the lonas she has had, she has been successful. She will use the loan that she is requesting now to buy more cheeses and to buy groceries for her store. What she wants now is to be able to improve her store - this is her goal and she is saving for it.
Felicitas likes the training that she gets from the community bank because this helps her to be stronger and to have values.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is divorced and has eight children. She is a fishmonger who lives in a fishing community called Elmina, located near Cape Coast. She has been a fishmonger for 12 years. The income she makes helps to provide food for the family. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Jonhstone is aged 34 and has been in the farming business for four years, producing and selling tea, milk and maize for the local market. He is married and lives with his family of four children, with the first three already attending school in his home area in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Jonhstone has made a first-time loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children as well as improve his breeds to more productive ones.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for loan services but reiterates that animal diseases are a great limitation in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a widow with two children. She is 60 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Brenda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Brenda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Brenda's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo, nuevamente necesita otro crédito, porque quiere invertir en la agricultura y comprar más insumos como: abono, semilla, herbicidas, el objetivo de él es que este año sean mejores cosechas y poder obtener más  ganancias. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a tener una mejor estabilidad económica  y no ha surgido ningún problema, y les  ha podido dar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Eduardo needs another loan again because he wants to invest in farming and buy supplies like manure, seeds and herbicide.  His goal is that his harvests improve this year to obtain higher profits.  Previous loans helped him to have better economic stability and no problems arose; he’s been able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Ayme

texts.es: Ayme es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 31 años, es madre de 1 hijo, esta en Finca hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de tortas de queque, con los préstamos que Finca le dió logró comprar insumos en grandes cantidades tales como harina, azúcar, mantequilla, manjar, huevo, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones porque le enseña a ser responsables, a como invertir su dinero y a dirigir su negocio, a valorarse como mujer y valorar a su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, mantequilla y huevos. Su meta es llegar a elaborar tortas variadas hasta lograr que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Ayme is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca”. She is 31 years old and the mother of one child. She has been with FINCA for three years. Ayme sells cakes and cupcakes. With the loans that FINCA has provided, she has been able to buy supplies in large quantities such as flour, sugar, butter, caramel, and eggs. Ayme greatly enjoys the training seminars because they have taught her how to be responsible, invest and manage her money, and value her family and being a woman.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flour, sugar, butter, and eggs. Her goal is to make various cakes so that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, and eggs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 24 años una mujer trabajadora y responsable, convive con Wilmer, de 26 años, viven en casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija Maribel de 07 años a quien le dan mucho amor y desean un futuro mejor para su hija. Hace 10 años que Nelly, se dedica a la agricultura, ahora junto a su pareja se van a trabajar desde muy temprano en sus tierras de cultivo donde producen cacao. Los productos de Nelly, son de buena cosecha y comenta que la gente que compra sus productos no se queja de los buenos granos de cacao que produce. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que lo hace junto a su pareja y ambos lo hacen con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo;  lo que se le hace difícil es no poder brindarle una casa propia para su pequeña hija ya que viven en casa alquilada. Con el tiempo desea construir una casa en la que pueda estar cómoda en especial su pequeña hija. Este es su préstamo numero 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr su objetivo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal ya que trabaja con personas de responsabilidad. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: fierros, alambres para que pueda avanzar con la construcción de propia casa.
texts.en:
Nelly, 24, a hard-working and responsible woman, lives with Wilmer, 26, in a rented house with their young daughter Maribel, 7, whom they love very much and for whom they want a better future.  Nelly has worked in agriculture for 10 years.  Now, she and her partner go to work very early to their fields where they grow cacao.  Nelly's products are of good quality and she comments that the people who buy her products do not complain about the good cacao beans that she produces.

What she likes most about her work is that she does it alongside her partner, and both do it with great dedication and effort.  The difficult part is not being able to give their daughter her own home, since they live in a rented house.  In time she wants to build a house in which she can be comfortable, especially her young daughter.

This is her second loan with MFP, for which she hopes for a small loan to achieve her objective.  She also likes to be part of her communal bank since she works with responsible people.

With the 1,000 PEN she will be able to buy construction materials such as metal and wire so she can move forward with the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy metal and wire.
